description:
I cannot even begin to tell you how much I adore Mission Minis! My family has gotten these miniature treats for numerous special occassions because they are delicious and adorable!

Last month I wanted to order some minis for my son's birthday, but due to a private event, they were unable to. However the owner Brandon, through the kindness of his heart made a miracle happen for me and everyone at my party was able to get a taste of these mini bites of heaven.

I have already ordered the next batch for another party, and I plan on ordering them for many more birthdays to come!

Mission Minis Wooo! *jazz hands*
author: Karen C.

description: Not only are they delicious, they're very polite.  Customer service is FANTASTIC...
author: April W.

description: Got 40 cupcakes for my birthday party. Everyone was fighting over the delicious cinnamon horchata cupcakes!! They were the right size for the price of $1. The employers were so lenient about my pick up time when I was running late. Definitely coming back!
author: Kendall C.

description:
Not the best cupcakes and nor the worst and I think worthy of their current Yelp rating. I tried their red velvet mini and it was decent.

The lady at the counter was very friendly to me contrary to some of the yelp reviews I saw.

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake
4 Ariscault =Croissant

6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies
7 Dynamo Donuts=donuts
8 Golden Gate Bakery=Egg tart
9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes

30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description: Ehh expensive tiny cupcakes unless you get a Groupon and assuming they let you use it... if you do have a Groupon don't expect to drop in and pickup cupcakes even if they have stock. They are super sticklers for pre ordering using a Groupon. Thumbs down
author: Brandon I.

description:
I like the fact that the mini-cupcakes look cute and are in calorie watcher-friendly small sizes, but the cupcakes themselves weren't terribly memorable, either for the frosting or the cake portions themselves. For me, flavors like the cinnamon horchata, peanut butter kiss, and blueberries and creme all tended towards the lukewarm end of the taste spectrum. 

Might be worth if it you have a discount of some kind, or if you can get them to do some specialized catering for you.
author: Vincent L.

description: Bought a groupon with the intention of bringing some cupcakes into work. With the groupon you have to order in advance to make sure they have enough. I emailed them on a Wednesday for a Sunday pickup. And got a confirmation email back. But I arrived at the place on Sunday and the very nice lady couldn't find my order. So she offered to put together my order for me. I couldn't get my email up in time so I just got and assorted amount of whatever they had in the display case. I think I was missing one or two flavors that I requested that was on their website but wasn't available in their display case. Oh well. I then tried to pay with my groupon and she said oh, do you have a confirmation email and I had to bring it up and show it to her to prove that I did really try to pre-order the cupcakes. And she let me purchase it. Fiasco aside, the cupcakes were just ok. They are pretty small - like 2 bites each. I think the groupon is about 40-50% off and even with the groupon, it still seems pretty pricey for these small cupcakes. My favorites were the blueberries & creme and the cinnamon horchata. These were moist and had good flavor.  The rest were actually like of dry. Hopefully they were all freshly baked. Good location - located off the main strip of the mission with plenty of street parking. It's a small shop but plenty of room to grab cupcakes and go. I guess they also offer baking/cooking classes too because there was one going on in the back when I was there.
author: Alison W.

description:
The cupcakes are fine (fine, not great), but the service is BAD. TL;DR they aren't good with orders being ready on time and don't care if they're late. That's not a place worth spending your money IMO. 

I was asked to be the Godmother to my best friend's son. Since I'm an Atheist, I thought it was super sweet to include me and ordered 48 mini cupcakes to take to the baptism. I'm not only Atheist, I'm also paranoid. So I asked for the cupcakes to be ready at 10 AM on Saturday so they'd definitely be ready when I needed them at 11 AM to make it to Berkeley by 12 for the event. I even called to re-confirm my order and they assured me it was all set. 

The day of, I was running late and arrived at Mission Minis at 11:10 AM. Guess what...my order wasn't ready! They said it would only be another '30 seconds' so I kept my mouth shut and stepped outside to keep an eye on my car (parked in front of a hydrant). After a few minutes I went back and they still weren't ready! So I asked how much longer as I was going to be late and was worried about getting a parking ticket. Without looking up at me, the woman behind the counter said they were almost ready.  Finally I said, 'this order was supposed to be ready at 10 AM.' The woman replied to me in the rudest, snarkiest voice and says, 'Well, we got backed up.' ie 'get over it cause we really don't care.' No sorry, no feeling bad on her part. I was shocked by her response and didn't reply. Instead, I give you 2 stars. Bye, Felicia.
author: Bita A.

description:
Five stars for the cupcakes and five stars for the customer service!   

The mini cupcakes come in many flavors- cinnamon hortchata, vegan banana, pumpkin spice, Aztec chocolate and classic vanilla with rainbow sprikles... and much more!!! Omg, I'm drooling as I write this. SO GOOD! I especially like that the cupcakes are tiny.  I'm indecisive and want to try all of them. So, I get 4 different flavors and its like getting one normal size cupcake but with 4 different bites!!!

The shop itself is adorable. It's super charming and clean. The staff is so welcoming. This is big for me.  I only write yelps when I'm wowed by the customer service. It's rare to come across these days. Thank you ladies, for always taking care of me with a smile!
author: Kat K.

description:
TL;DR I used to believe there was no God. After trying these cupcakes, my certainty of nothingness has been shattered. Agnostic, it is. That frosting is divine.

An atheist chimed in below... personally, I used to lean that way. Though after having some of Mission Minis coconut cupcakes... no way that flavor exists without some sort of deity.  

Also, I was in the shop when a father walked in... "I'm having a cupcake emergency!" He explained that his kids were having a Saturday meltdown - this man needed a break. Mission Minis to the rescue. They hooked that Dad up with his order lickety-split. 

Turning atheists into agnostics and minting San Francisco's newest Dad-of-the-year. What more could you ask for in a cupcake?
author: D K.

description:
Mission minis opens at 8AM, according to their website. I showed up at 9AM on a Friday, hoping to get cupcakes for coworkers. 

...they didn't have any cupcakes ready. 

Why are they open if they don't sell any cupcakes?
author: Yuyu S.

description: If you guys are looking for good cupcakes, this is the place to go! They are super good and affordable! The owner was very friendly so thank you for accommodating us!
author: Raquel R.

description: Yummy cupcakes! Cute little store! Great variety! Super friendly and helpful gals behind the counter, they do excellent sprinkles! Can't wait for my next reason to cupcake it up! And they're mini so no guilt in eating more than one!
author: stephani p.

description: My friend told me about this place decided to go check it out ... Well the chocolate peanut butter cupcake was super dry and the customer service sucked the guy wouldn't get off the phone to help us he just kept his conversation on his phone going , on top of that I asked for the peanut butter cupcake to be separated from the other cupcake in the box because someone had a peanut allergy and he gave me attitude I was not to pleased and will not recommend to others especially at a $1 a cupcake ... Had the customer service been better so would have my experience...
author: Shannon B.

description:
Such a great idea, but not executed well. We went at 3pm on a Saturday with about 5 hours until closing and were left with the dregs of cupcakes...  Just a few flavors, a handful of cupcakes in a sad little case. We got a very "take it or leave it" attitude from the staff... Not an awesome experience. I guess they don't make new cupcakes throughout the day?  Weird. 

The cupcakes we did get were also a bit dry and didn't have the bold flavors of other minis like Melissa's in NYC. Maybe because they'd been sitting all day. 

Parking can be a challenge also. Not sure overall that  it's worth the effort.
author: Bob K.

description:
Purchased a Groupon for 4 dozen minis for my daughter's birthday. I emailed them my order on Monday for a pick up on Friday. It wasn't until after that I read the previous reviews here about the Groupon not working for Friday/Saturday pickup! Eeks!!! However, I heard back from them the following day and was reassured they would accommodate my order and I'd be able to pick up the cupcakes on Friday morning!! Yippee!! 
Pick up was super easy and fast.  Given that it was still early in the Mission, I found parking right in front, went into the store and was out within a minute. =)

I ordered a dozen each of: Red Velvet, Aztec Chocolate, Classic Vanilla and Blueberries and Cream.
The party wasn't until Saturday and I forgot to store them properly overnight. But, they were still very good the following day!! These mini cupcakes are the perfect size but, just be careful not to eat very many!
The cupcakes I ordered were the perfect amount for the birthday party. (Which was for 8 girls.) I think if you get the Groupon, it's definitely worth the price.
author: Mimie L.

description: What happened to customer service the two Caucasian ladies are so extremely rude and careless I was a customer for 4 years and after my experience yesterday I will Never go back .How sad that now that they became well known their customer service just got extremely rude
author: Edith S.

description: I came in on a Thursday and needed 3 dozen assorted cupcakes which I knew might be a gamble as I didn't call ahead to place an order. The interior was decorated adorably and is incredibly clean as well. I appreciate the attention to details here! They were super friendly and gave me a great assortment. As for the cupcakes themselves, they were DELICIOUS. My favorite flavors were the Horchata and the Aztec Chocolate; cakes were moist and the frosting smooth. Also, I loved that they weren't too sweet! At $1.00 a pop, this place provides great cupcakes that won't break the bank.
author: Pamela G.

description:
Mixed feelings about the cupcakes. Was nothing spectacular. I bought numerous cupcakes to try. I bought the Swiss almond coconut, Aztec chocolate, Meyer lemon creme, blueberry creme and double chocolate. 

Both the Swiss almond coconut and Aztec chocolate were over cooked/dry. The Meyer lemon creme was moist, but not much of a lemon taste. The blueberry and double chocolate were moist. 

Guess my favorite was the blueberry creme. 

Service was good, ordered 48 hours in advance. It was ready at pick-up.
author: C W.

description:
I went there on Saturday.  There was an issue with the calls I had made during the week to place an order for cupcakes.  The young man who was there was absolutely amazing and made an otherwise super stressful situation into a great one!  I am grateful for him and his great customer service.  The cup cakes (all 72 of them) were enjoyed by everyone and the perfect touch!  

I will definitely go back!
author: Bonnie N.

description:
A talent of ours brought two boxes of cupcakes by the agency last Monday, January 25th. I first heard about Mission Minis when they were offering a Groupon years ago. I thought about it getting the deal, but knowing I never really get the the Mission, I didn't buy it.

I was excited to finally try a cupcake. They really are mini and can be easily consumed in one bite. Two in my case. I ended up trying the MEYER LEMON CREME: Meyer lemon cake topped with lemon curd and cream cheese frosting. Very subtle lemon and cream cheese flavor. I wish it were a little more tart as I wasn't even sure if I was eating the lemon one. The cake itself was too moist and wet. I like my cake a little springy, but this ended up having a slightly mushy texture.

I like the size of the cupcakes. Perfect for someone like me who doesn't like eating a whole dessert. I can just have a taste with the minis. Too bad the cupcakes themselves were just okay.
author: Elena N.

description:
I had the cinnamon and blueberry. Nice little bite when you don't want to have a full cupcake. The frosting is a bit thin. I prefer a thicker frosting. 

I ordered a couple dozen for my bday and they were fine. Bc they're small, they will dry out quicker than a regular cupcake. So, just be aware if you're planning to have them out sitting for a long time.
author: William V.

description: If your ever in San Francisco and have a sweet tooth come to Mission Minis.... Very happy if the cupcakes don't make me return the customer service will. Keep up the good work ! I
author: Osagie O.

description:
Don't trust their hours. Website, Yelp, Google, etc. all say open until 8, but they actually close at 5. If you look through the yelp reviews there are plenty of other people who've found them closed at 6 or 7 as well.

On 12/10/2016 my wife made a 45 min detour on her way home in the middle of the pouring rain to get something nice for us on her way home. At 4:45 the staff was packing up, saying that they close at 5, and only a few cupcakes left that looked stale and may have been from other days.

Mission Mini's Staff: If you're going to post hours, and nobody had to go to the hospital, honor them or update them. Not doing either was ridiculous.

UPDATE: Mission Mini's replied that they were in fact open until 8pm, so I uploaded a photo taken that dayshowing the empty racks at 4:45. https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=n6BSAUY5GaXxE2myo03hug. I'm sure their cupcakes are great in the morning, but their hours aren't correct and they don't own up to it.
author: Aaron M.

description:
We buy cupcakes a few times a year from them. Bought the Groupon for 2dozen thinking I'd use it for school. Saved it to use for our anniversary weekend instead, since we were going away for our son's baseball tournament, and thought it would be a fun treat. Emailed them my order on Thursday morning, 48 hours before as stated on the certificate and they emailed me back saying they were booked for Saturday, I could pick them up Sunday (which wouldn't work) or Tuesday (since they are closed Mondays). After going back and forth on email and growing more frustrated, I contacted Groupon and they allowed me to turn in the certificate and purchase something else. I also asked about coming into the store and just getting what they had on hand and was told no, they'd be full price. So done with Mission Minis. You've lost a local customer.

*note - the store called me at 1:30pm today and said the manager said to go ahead and fill the order. Too late! Already turned in my certificate and bought something else. Store needs to train employees better and work on customer service.
author: Heather B.

description: I've bought cupcakes here from groupon at least 4x and never had a bad experience. Everything was super easy and simple- from the email ordering to pick up. Will continue to buy and support this local business. Thanks Mission Minis!
author: Mimi S.

description:
Got the deal from Groupon for my intimate wedding reception. Sent email to them once I got the Groupon deal, tell them when I need to pick up and the flavors that I want. It's just that simple. 

Walked in the day of , cupcakes were ready for me to be picked up. My guests all enjoyed the cupcakes. 

Thanks mission mini for the great deal. Will definitely order again.
author: Emmy L.

description: Cupcakes are fine tasting, but the customer service sucks. Very rude and horrible attitude. Plus, they refused to turn down their music to take a phone order. Therefore, the order was never recorded properly, so we had to contact them through email. That was more helpful than the nasty attitude of the girls that work there.
author: Kasa R.

description:
Amazing cupcakes!!! Love the vegan banana maple and their cupcakes are really addicting! If you're going to purchase a lot, I would say to get the Groupon deal for them and order ahead. 

The reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is because though their product is great, they are constantly running out. I can right at 9am once when they opened at 8am, and apparently the first few customers all bought like 4-5 boxes which only left a few available. Other times I come in the middle of the day and they would be practically sold out. They really should think about expanding.
author: Semhar G.

description: Dry and BITCH attitude, I meant the cupcakes and the customer service lol. But the flavor is good and you can tell it's good ingredients but it's dry!!!! #bye
author: Phebe T.

description: Came here to pick up last-minute cupcakes for an office birthday and they were delicious.  Had what I needed ready to go and cheerfully thanked me for my business.  A bit pricey and I would have appreciated a discount for ordering so many (or a baker's dozen), but ya gotta make a living so I don't begrudge it.
author: Mia M.

description: Obsessed with Mission Minis! The cinnamon horchata, the Meyer lemon, and the peanut butter kiss have all become a staple of my pregnancy diet...  the secret is in that frosting and it's beyond yummy. For $3 I get 3 Minis!!! You can't beat that in SF and Kate at the front, is always so sweet and cheerful!
author: Yesenia G.

description: I absolutely love this place! They have the best cupcakes! Super fluffy and delicious, my favorite one is the red velvet. I placed an order yesterday for my friends birthday and had a great experience with a pleasant and helpful girl named Kate, super helpful and sweet and had the best tattoos :). I will definitely be recommending them to friends for the next bday or special event.
author: Josh R.

description: Called at 2:00p trying to order 2 dozen cupcakes.  Was told that they would get more at 4:00p. Called at 4:00p and tried to place another order. The woman who picked up the phone really didn't seem to want to help. She said, "We don't have anymore."  I commented about how I was told to call back at 4:00p.  Long pause.... "We don't have any more cupcakes."  Hang up the phone. Check Postmates and low and behold cupcakes are available. Call her back and she says, "We don't have Postmates."  I give up.
author: Clifton T.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place! From the customer service to the amazingly delicious cupcakes-you can't go wrong with Mission Minis! Do yourself and your taste buds a favor and go immediately !
author: Kelsey V.

description:
Made an order on Thursday for pickup on Saturday. Called the store and they said there was no record of my order! They had confirmed with me that my order would be ready by the time I requested (12PM) though. I had called at 1:40PM on Saturday while I was in the area.

I did mention in the order that I had a groupon and asked if I could have Happy Birthday written on the top. They said due to a new policy they would not do that for groupon customers....pretty messed up that they would not honor these requests simply because I used a groupon. Please do not use groupon services if you arent willing to treat groupon customers fairly (as mentioned in previous reviews about pick up times and such). 

I am completely upset that they did not have my order. The cashier I called said that she would look for it and give me a call back right after but didnt even bother to give me a call back to let me know that it was not there...I called back later ten minutes after and she asked to look up by invoice again. Clearly it would not be ready for today. So upset! At least have the courtesy to call back and tell me immediately.I had planned to get these cupcakes as a bday surprise (and have them ready fresh for tonight) but thanks to Mission Minis that did not happen. Bday ruined :(
author: Christina G.

description:
When I went there, the cupcakes were almost all gone.
I get to try the horchata, coconut, and red velvet.
They're all okay.
Horchata is my fav of all.
author: Candice L.

description: This update is long overdue but we just wanted to say that we've ordered cupcakes from them about 6 more times since our first try and each subsequent visit has gone well, and the cupcakes fresh and moist. Staff super helpful. The only thing that could be better is to make more cupcakes so they don't run out as quickly -- we went to pick up some cupcakes at 4pm on a Sat (3+ hours before close) and there was only one kind of cupcake left and not a flavor that the kids would eat.
author: Kate A.

description:
They are amazing!!!

I ordered 4 dozen of cupcakes after purchasing the coupon on Groupon and the process was so smooth. I needed the cupcakes on Sunday afternoon and I placed the order on Thursday afternoon. They say to make all orders 2 business days prior and after look at other yelpers reviews, I choose the 4 following flavors:
- Cinnamon horchata
- Double chocolate
- Blueberry Cream
- Red Velvet

They were all crowd pleasers and everyone loved them. Only downside was that traffic was crazy in that area because of Sunday Streets but Mission Mini's is definitely my go-to next time I need desserts for a party or event!
author: Eva O.

description: We were soooo excited to try this spot after seeing it on CUPCAKE WARS. We bought red velvet, horchata, vanilla and Aztec. They were all just okay. No distinguished flavors. Just bland. I've had cupcakes from The Cupcake Shoppe in Hayward that blow these out of the water. So disappointed because we were really craving a great cupcake.
author: Mama B.

description: Mission Minis has a wonderful selection of delicious cupcakes and friendly staff.
author: Foo M.

description: Ordered 4 dozen minis for a bday party. I emailed my order and they replied right away. Picked up my order on the day of the party and I was in and out. Ordering and customer service was fine, only problem I had were the cupcakes. They were so dry and lack taste. I don't think I will order fr this place again.
author: Pinky B.

description: Fresh mini cup cakes :) got variety of them. Favorite one was the velvet cake cup cake.
author: Polo R.

description: Best mini cupcakes in San Francisco I have eaten so far. All the taste of the favors are in just one bite, which I love!!!! Excellent customer service is a plus too. I went this past Friday with my daughter after her appointment, the location is very easy to find, but you wouldn't know its there until you Google the location. I will be back again.
author: Delia W.

description: Thank you Mission Minis! I just finished hosting my friends baby shower, and your cupcakes were a hit. Everything was perfect, from beginning to end. I ordered via email and they got back to me pretty quickly and the pickup was a breeze. I'll definitely come back to Mission Minis for other special occasions.
author: Megan K.

description: These cupcakes are great.  They're nice little bites when you don't need a huge desert, though if you want more you can always buy a few.  I like the red velvet and coconut flavored ones.  but i've had most and all were good.
author: Mariaté G.

description: I tried a chocolate peanut butter cupcake.  It was really dry, like boxed cake mix quality or below.  Maybe their other flavors are better or this was an off day, but I feel like a bakery that specializes in cupcakes should be able to make better cupcakes than that.
author: Alex H.

description:
I ordered 4 dozen mini cupcakes for my 2 year olds party. I have an order a several days prior through an email order. I confirmed the timing and day. They assumed me that they would be ready and I could pick them up that day. I have more than advance days for the order. 
I went to pick them up the day of and at 3:30 they were closed. Everything locked up. No one in sight! I drove ages and brought my little child out with me to pick them up. 
I called the next morning, the day of my daughters birthday and still no one is answering nor did they reply back to my email. I'm so upset! I had everything planned out for my daughters birthday. Now I have to go running around for a cake. 
This is really upsetting. Don't trust you'll get what you want when you put an order in.
author: Sbeen A.

description:
Some are good. I like how they make some cakes not too sweet and with the cream topping you can add as much sweetness as you like. 
You need to check your order before you leave. They messed up my orders. I didn't know until I got home. I checked my order, took a picture of what I received and emailed them right away. I didn't receive a response. Some are drier than others, so it can be the old cakes vs. more recently bake cakes.
author: Minh N.

description: Love Mission Minis! Absolute perfect size for a sweet treat. Around the corner from my daughters school and its the perfect (priced and sized) treat for her. I also do sweets tables as a job, and these are almost ALWAYS a part of my the tables. They are sooooo cute, so yummy and allow people to have a couple of flavors without eating huge cupcakes. The staff is awesome, and I appreciate that they hire natives, and people from the neighborhood.
author: Tamika B.

description: got 3 dozen from a groupon and even discounted, so not worth the money.  not very flavorful at all...even icing which I am an easily pleased customer with...was bland and boring.   It was odd, but my favorite was actually the vegan which had the most flavor & sweetness.   won't be going back :(
author: Gina R.

description: We ordered a ton of cupcakes for our San Francisco wedding on January 5, 2018! And they were soooooo yummy! There was not a single cupcake left! I wish we had ordered more so we could have had leftovers!
author: Bianca S.

description:
Three dozen mini cupcakes later, here's the verdict. 

Many flavors to choose from, I appreciate the variety. 
We had blueberry, Aztec chocolate, chocolate peanut butter, snickerdoodle, and coconut almond. 

The cake was a bit dry but the frosting paired well. Not too sweet. My favorite was the blueberry with cream cheese frosting. 

The cupcakes were a bit small, even for mini size.
Placing an order over the phone was super easy.

I wouldn't go out of my way for these.
author: Sonya T.

description:
3.5 stars

Lots of flavors to choose from though they do run out later in the day so go early! 

$1 each. They are pretty small and bite sized. Great for when you have a sweet tooth but won't feel too guilty. 

Taste is average. They're not as moist or taste as fresh as cupcakes from sprinkles.
author: Yin H.

description: This place is definitely the cupcake shop that San Francisco is missing. They have a unique selection of flavors and their cupcakes are pretty delicious. I wouldn't say they are the best cupcakes that I have had in my life but they definitely do the job of satisfying my cravings. I like the fact that their cupcakes are mini-sized as full-sized cupcakes that you get at other cupcake shops can be a bit too much and you aren't able to sample a wider selection of flavors. I will probably be back if I am craving cupcakes and I am in the Mission.
author: Kunal N.

description: The quality has changed in the last few months. Was my favorite place to go. Hopefully they can get it back on track.
author: Margot G.

description:
Great deal with a Groupon for two dozen mini (two-bite) cupcakes. Easy and fast pickup, but since I was a last minute order, I had to get Baker's Choice. Luckily, Baker's Choice came with a great assortment.

The cupcakes were moist, but fairly typical. 
Red Velvet- a pretty good red velvet
Meyer Lemon- nice and lemony
Cinnamon Horchata- tasted slightly like cinnamon horchata, but was underwhelmed by this one
Aztec Chocolate- not sure what the point of this one was. Tasted like standard chocolate.
Double Chocolate- chocolate cupcake with chocolate frosting, but reliably tasty
Peanut Butter Kiss- one of my favorites with frosting, nuts, and coconut on top, but tasted only slightly peanut buttery and mostly coconut-y
Classic Vanilla- standard
Pumpkin Spice- standard, like a pumpkin pie

Small place without really any seating. Seems more like a place for catering and order pickups, not for hanging out.
author: Alice T.

description:
Two pop ups in one weekend? Yep, I officially live in San Francisco! Friday night was Pink Zebra, Saturday was Hal Jr's at Mission Minis. Whomever thought that cupcakes and BBQ should go together is genius!

Pretty simple concept: Order at the counter and either shove that delicious food in your face right there. Or take it home to shove in your face from the comfort of your couch. We chose the latter, since BBQ can get pretty messy... that and we ordered one of everything, wanted to give the impression that there might be more people enjoying this huge pile of food.

The good: Ribs! Slow cooked and falling off the bone. Only one sauce to choose from and it was spicy! If you have an aversion to spicy things lay low on the sauce. Good BBQ doesn't need a lot of it anyway. Also the macaroni was quite good. Not usually a big fan of bread crumbs on top, but the creaminess of the cheese sauce gives way to just about anything.

The OK: Side of corn and sweet tea. Let me go on record saying I detest sweet tea in any form, so that's not completely fair. My +1 says it was just fine. Corn was cooked fine, tons of mayo, just not the best. Certainly better than anything KFC attempts though.

Of course we got two Mission Minis to go as well, lemon and salted caramel. Those are always a treat. I love that they still cost only $1 in a city of overpriced cupcakes. Well played, guys.

Hope to see more pop up action out of this Mission bakery. Bring on the crazy combos, I'll be back!
author: Abby S.

description:
Less than a month into my new job, and can you believe that I've already developed a crush on my co-worker?

Not surprising, given that I'm crush prone.

So, thinking this would be a great idea to score major points, and possibly a date, I offered to buy cupcakes for this person, along with other people in the office so that it wouldn't look so obvious.

Thing is, my crush, staring at me with these beautiful blue eyes, declined saying, "Thanks, but I'm watching my figure."

Say what?!?

By that time, I'd already sent an e-mail to the whole team.

That meant I still have to buy EVERYONE else cupcakes.

Darn, I didn't think this through.

Three dozen cupcakes for random office people later, I found myself noshing on the Red Velvet, Horchata (You know it!! My favorite in any form), Aztec Chocolate, and Coconut, until about 6 of them were gone.

These cupcakes were good, but were sort of pricey at $1 each and were definitely mini, yet for a moment I almost forgot that this all blew up in my face.

My crush did stop by and said they looked good, but still was watching that figure.  
I wanted to scream like a soap opera character and say, "I did this all just for you!"

But I held it all in, and realized that the road to Hell is truly paved with good intentions.
author: Jack R.

description:
Awesome place and costumer service, beside great and outstanding flavors.
We order a cake for our daughter 2nd birthday party at Golden Gate Park and a day before the party we had to cancel the party due to wildfires in north CA which caused air pollution hazard for kids.
This guys were amazing understanding our situation.
We ended with a small cake for our daughter and a big one for free which they baked already and don't want to throw away.
Thanks so much Mission Minis!!!
author: Joel T.

description: Ordered cupcakes for my dad's birthday. The place is small. I went here on Sunday morning and cupcakes are almost gone!
author: Kim O.

description:
If I can give them 20 stars I would!! Everything we experienced with Mission Minis was amazing! 

Start off.. We called and spoke with the manager Diego. We told him our wedding was on September 13th and we wanted to have cupcakes for our reception instead of a wedding cake! He let us try all the flavors! All of them were good, but we decided on Red Velvet and Horchata! Yes, I said Horchata!! Soooo good!! 

There was another day we went in the store because I actually wanted a top tier wedding cake to eat for our one year wedding anniversary. He showed us this big book! We fell in love with a two tier wedding cake. The design of the frosting was roses! Omg! The day of our wedding, it was beautiful!! 

Cake pops! We wanted to have a dessert bar so we contacted Diego from Mission Minis to order cake pops! He told us to email the design we wanted our cake pops to look like and that's what we did! 

Bottom line.. The cake, cup cakes, and cake pops were so moist and not dry! Diego is stellar! He answered all our questions, he emailed us in a timely fashion, and he was just a pleasure to work with. 

Delivery.. We had our cup cakes delivered to our venue. They came on time and the set up of the desserts looked amazing!! 

Thank you Diego and the staff at Mission Minis! You made us feel stress free on our wedding day! Outstanding job!!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Super easy to order via email 
I bought a groupon, so I felt it was so worth what you get. Full price however, is $1/each, which seems kind of pricey for one tiny bite. 

I used these for my baby's party, they were a hit. Red velvet flavor - cream cheese icing, yumm. I like that theyre not overly sweet.
author: Denise L.

description: These cupcakes are to die for. The pumpkin cupcake is my favorite but they all are so yummy! The gal at the front desk was very friendly! I will definitely be back! Mission Minis for the win!
author: Theresa S.

description:
I recall seeing part of an episode of Cupcake Wars sometime last year where Mission Mini's was the winner so when I saw a Groupon deal around Christmas time for 2 dozen I snapped it up. Of course, not thinking that I now live 65miles away and about how just myself and my Husband were going to eat 2 dozen. Damn, you Groupon and your impulse buys!
Panic over when I was planning a trip to the City with Tram that luckily coincided with having friends coming to visit the following day, extra people to help us eat these cute little cakes.

I placed an order 3 or 4 days in advance which was very quick and easy, I said I would be there to collect them between 4pm and 5pm that coming Saturday but as it turned out we were running a little late and didn't get there until almost 6pm. I made sure to call and let the staff know and was reassured that someone will be there until 8pm and not to hurry, upon arrival were greeted with smiles from he 2 young males working and was handed my 2 boxes of goodies.

With my order I requested 7 different flavors which were all present and before saying goodbye to Tram at the end of the day handed her the 3 extra Chocolate I ordered for her and her little one's enjoyment once home. I would like to say that I was good and didn't touch the Cupcakes until our friends came around the following day but that would be lying. After a rather disappointing Dinner my Husband and I tucked into a couple that evening: 

* Cinnamon  Horchata (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?filter_by_userid=True&select=uCdACqGfGhq5-DCpfe2MSA&userid=wwmJ56OlvMC_Z8llXTd6mA#6C9qFBPfKkM66ya8vNupeQ) - - Sooo good! Delicious Cinnamon flavor with creamy frosting.

* Swiss Almond Coconut (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=a2lno5HNl9XyPQpDzAOAmQ#z-_2aq0RkaB2vtoefq4Tzw) - Not as impressed. The flavor of the sponge just didn't sit right with me, nor my Husband who said it tasted like soap..??

The rest we saved until the following day for our guests which went down well. The Cinnamon Horchata was the favorite by far followed by the Blueberry (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=a2lno5HNl9XyPQpDzAOAmQ#D-I9Dux_iwFr_NDLqEOCxQ) then the Double Chocolate (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=a2lno5HNl9XyPQpDzAOAmQ#XN7QK0i4jCpouetz8eHdlA

The other flavors were a bit of a hit or miss, a couple were a on the dry and chewy side, maybe my own fault as we waited a day to eat them? They were sealed in an airtight container though. Then a couple of them also had a sprinkling of granulated sugar on top of the frosting which isn't an appealing texture. 

*Peanut Butter Kiss (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=a2lno5HNl9XyPQpDzAOAmQ#lPcFCkVAz6tws0bNibG50g).

* Ruby Red Velvet (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=a2lno5HNl9XyPQpDzAOAmQ#3UstGo-66YDxjl8ua_nfBA).

* Meyer Lemon Creme (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mission-minis-san-francisco?select=a2lno5HNl9XyPQpDzAOAmQ#YmekmGQPNDQhs5OTdfJh8w).

For $12 I think I got a great deal though as myself, Husband and friends got to sample a number of the flavors.  They are usually $1 each and take about 3 bites to devour one. The store is small inside with cases filled with the mini Cupcakes, however you can get regular sized ones for between $3 and $4 a piece if you place a custom order and they deliver! It's a 4 dozen minimum for delivery.

*TIP*
They also have Vegan Banana flavor available everyday as well as Gluten free available with 48hrs notice ($20 per dozen).
author: Emmalouise B.

description:
Yelp was running a hackathon and Mission Minis catered the dessert and blessed us with a huge variety of delicious mini cupcakes. 

You can eat them in one bite and they usually come with a bit of topping to add some sweetness and flavour. I tried the red velvet, vanilla, chocolate and double chocolate with even more flavours which I don't remember exactly, but I remember them all being really good. They tasted really fresh and had the perfect combination of texture and sponginess when you take that first bite into them.

My favourite cupcake was the red velvet. I would love to eat their cupcakes again.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Ordered 6 dozen for my office's monthly birthday celebration. The flavor selection was varied and they even have gluten free & vegan options which is a big plus with my coworkers. The gluten free was a bit on the dry side (not awful but not the best I've had) but all the others - double chocolate, classic vanilla, pumpkin spice, peanut butter, meyer lemon - were fantastic. As some other reviews mentioned, the meyer lemon had a bit of a syrupy, sticky texture, but that's going to happen anytime you add lemon curd to something and it was a big hit with our group. 

The only negative is that the delivery scheduling process was a bit odd. I needed the cupcakes for a 2:30pm party and was given very broad "delivery windows", one of which was too early and the other would be too late. So they were delivered at noon and I had to find a place to hide them for two hours. Not the end of the world but it did seem odd they couldn't narrow it down more than that.
author: D L.

description: I hate giving out bad reviews but I have to let whoever plan on buying their Groupon know how bad my experience was. I thought I was getting a good deal but the quality of the cupcakes were terrible.  I know they are bite size but a few of them were 1/3 of the bite size's size! Those should be lossed out. Can't believe they didn't throw them away but mixed them in the box for their Groupon customers. Yes, your Groupon is cheap but for the garbage I got, it's not worth my time and money.
author: Mel C.

description: If I could put no Star I would. The staff here is horrible, rude and a bit unpleasant. I would not go here again if they had the last cupcakes on earth. Wasted my money to get treated like I was the idiot. Be warned.
author: Katrina P.

description: Purchased a Groupon and was planning go use it on a particular day for cupcakes for a party. Called a few days in advance to place an order according to the directions. The person who answered the phone cut me off and said they were "fully booked" for the next few days and won't be taking any orders. However i can come into the store the day of and choose from their display case, but i would have to pay full price and won't be able to use my Groupon because it only works for pre-orders. They couldn't even give me an exception to their own rule that they created surrounding Groupons even though THEY could not accommodate my order. No apologies. They just told me I can call Groupon for a refund. Isn't the point of Groupon for marketing purposes and trying to get repeat customers?! They are obviously are "so booked" they don't need my business so I will happily spend my money elsewhere.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Mini cupcakes?! Yes please! For people like me who can't eat a whole cupcake without feeling like you're eating a cup of sugar, Mission Minis is perfect. The cupcakes are literally bite sized and you never have to worry about too much cream. For $1 per mini cupcake, I think it's a pretty good deal when you pay upwards of $3.50 for a regular cupcake.

The store is really small, and the cupcakes aren't stored in any fancy display -- it's just a regular old clear plastic one, so...But the cupcakes are still delicious. I went to try their horchata cupcake, which was amazingggggg. I also picked up the peanut butter one, some chocolate ones (Aztec?), and red velvet ones. The peanut butter ones are SUPER peanut buttery (duh) so if you like Reeses, you'll like these, and you can't ever go wrong with red velvet. I didn't try the chocolate ones because they weren't for me. I wish they had more flavors (maybe they do on other days?) but it seems pretty limited to the usual flavors other than horchata.
author: Doris K.

description:
GROUPON HOLDERS BEWARE!

I love MIssion MInis and have ordered cupcakes from here over the years.

However, I tried to use my Groupons to order cupcakes for Friday pickup. I tried two months ago and today. I was told just like at the  first attempt that they were booked for Friday. Today, Tuesday,  my order was about to be taken for Friday pickup when I mentioned Groupon. I was then told that they only take Groupons for Sunday pickups. 

I asked if that was the case for Groupon from now on. I was told just this week or from time to time. I told them about my experience last time and this has been my second attempt already. The person on the phone apologized and was polite which I appreciated.

I just do not like it when businesses do not honor their part when they participate in social online businesses like Groupon.

By the way, there is nowhere on Mission Minis' website that states that Groupon orders are only honored on Sundays. Groupon's fine print only states "48 hours pre-order required".

Hi Brandn, Then why is it my order was about to be taken for Friday pickup unitl I mentioned Groupon? No need to answer this. Thank you.
author: XY Z.

description: BEWARE - I went in with a Groupon and they won't honor it! Shady business practices and horrible customer service.. Mediocre cupcakes.. I won't come back..
author: tom w.

description: $1 for a mini cupcake, can't go wrong with that, especially in a city like SF known for its $4-$6 toast. Yes, toast. Ordered about 15 dozen minis for an event, and delivery was on time, and the order correct. They are just the right size so you don't get the sugar shock overload you would get with most other large and heavily frosted cupcakes like other South Bay competitors. Frosting is also not the heavily sugared/buttered recipe, but a light and airy one that doesn't make you feel as if you're eating a day's worth of calories. Would definitely return to try the more adventurous flavors. Delivery fee is a little steep, $3 a dozen, which does add up with a large order, so it may be worth picking them up at the location (especially since the boxes are so small, it's easy to transport, even on Bart).
author: Alison A.

description:
I've ordered from them twice now (thanks to Groupon), and they were a huge hit both times! Ordering has been really easy -- last time I ordered a week in advance, and this time I ordered 3 days in advance.

The mini-cupcakes are bite-sized and are decorated adorably. Both my orders have been for 2 dozen mini-cupcakes. They pack each dozen in a perfectly sized box so they don't move around very much. I've tried a bunch of flavors, and they are all good, but my favorite by far is the swiss almond coconut! I could probably eat a dozen of those by myself. They have a lot of flavors, so I love that they let you choose however many flavors you want.

Pickup is extremely easy and took me all of 30 seconds. This is the perfect place to pick up for an event or just casually stopping by for a sweet bite to-go, but the storefront is tiny and barebones so I wouldn't recommend this as a sit-down place.
author: Cynthia W.

description: This place opens early so it's easy to get your coworkers some Friday goodies.  Super nice and 7 flavors of cupcakes.  I will be back!
author: Chris L.

description: Cute but way to small. They had no flavor. I could barely tell between the vanilla and chocolate cupcake. But staff was nice enough to give me some cupcakes for free
author: Holly G.

description:
Great quality, solid service, very affordable. 
We use these guys every month and are consistently satisfied. 
Vegan and GF options are very good, too. 
Swiss Almond Coconut is my fav.
author: Jordan S.

description: I had an online deal for two dozen mini cupcakes and we thoroughly enjoyed them - especially the chocolate and peanut butter-chocolate ones. Mm mm mmmm!
author: Maile N.

description: They are MINI for sure. Definitely lives up to the name. The Cinnamon Horchata was tasty. I also had the Meyer Lemon which was my favorite. Nothing special about them though.
author: Andrea O.

description: I would give this place no stars if I could. I didn't even get to buy anything since the woman working there was incompetent. I had a gift certificate I was trying to use and she said she didn't know how to process and I had to wait until her boss came back. Horrible customer service.
author: Cleo I.

description:
What can go wrong when you order 100 cupcakes with a blue writing and the day of pick up they give you 100 cupcakes with green writing? 
They were supposed to be for a celebration party for an organization which had blue as only colour in the logo and they completely ruined the experience for our guests. 
They messed up my order and they did not even call to ask if I still want cupcakes made that way or maybe a different colour (even white would have been ok, but green is insane!!!). I pick up cupcakes but I notify My manager who - of course - gets mad at me, I called them to say I dont want those cupcakes and I will return them. The girl says: I'll call the manager and let you know. She doesn't call until two hours later and says she cannot give me the Manager's number (btw he is never there!!!! Dont even know if he really exists!) She suggests to send an email and he will reply by EOD. Of course that doesn't happen and on Monday they are closed. Bad bad bad experience. If you dont want to risk it with your party and most of all if you are organizing something and dont want to ruin your reputation, simply do NOT go to this place.
author: Serena P.

description: We got the Groupon deal for our wedding. They were sooo good and our guests loved them!! We saved so much money. Wedding cakes typically cost around 500-$1000 with cake cutting. We spent $52 total for 8 dozens!! It was amazing! So happy we found them!
author: Phoebe K.

description:
Ordered two dozen custom-topped cupcakes, and couldn't have been happier. From emailing my order to pick-up, the process was seamless. Mission Mini's even converted a JPEG file into beautiful fondant toppers; this place is incredible and has too-notch customer service.  

Every flavor was a new and delicious surprise, and my friends and I couldn't get enough. My friend who absolute hates cake/cupcakes has now been converted into a cupcake lover thanks so your Red Velvet bites. 

Can't wait to come back here often and wow all my friends!

#Airbnb
author: Jesse H.

description:
Not sure that you can get much better than this!
They serve only mini cupcakes. You can try many of their fantastic flavors for waaay less calories than a traditional cupcake shop!
The employees are always super sweet just like their products!
If you're in the mission & have a small sweet tooth to satisfy, why not? There's no minimum purchase & they are very reasonably priced!
author: Ashley G.

description: Mission Mini's in heaven in a bite-size bite! I live in Modesto but my aunt lives in San Leandro. She was having my baby cousin's first birthday party at the Golden Gate Yacht Club in SF and I was organizing the dessert bar. I wanted to find a bakery where I didn't have to go too far to get the stuff I needed. Thanks to Yelp, I found this gem! I ordered 8 dozen cupcakes for our party. Swiss Almond Coconut, Ruby Red Velvet, Meyer Lemon Creme, & Double Chocolate were the flavors we chose. Every single one was so delicious in its own way. I ordered my uncle the Swiss almond coconut as he is a fan of coconut and he absolutely loved it! The Meyer lemon Creme was my personal favorite. All the cupcakes were light and airy. The frostings weren't too overly powering sweet. They were just perfect. We wish we had ordered more so we would've had our own stash we didn't have to share with the guests lol This party was in January of 2016 and we just used them again last weekend for the baby's 2nd birthday!
author: Mehndi M.

description:
After having a misunderstanding, Mission Minis completely made it up to me and my family. Their cupcakes are tasty and they look just beautiful.
Thanks for apologizing and getting back to us, it is never too late to change our mind and mistakes happen. I am happy I gave you a second chance.
author: Serena S.

description:
I bought a groupon for 2 doz mini cupcakes. I went with my wife and kids this past Saturday. I can't believe the insane, messed up lies we were told by the girl behind the counter. 

When I went in, the girl behind the counter tells me that "For the 2 doz groupon, you were supposed to order 48 hrs in advance." 

I said I didn't know because the groupon didn't say anything about that. I did notice the groupon said that for "advanced orders" 48 hrs notice was necessary. But I wasn't trying to get any particular flavors, so I didn't see why I would put in an advanced order. I'd never been to the place before so I just wanted to try a variety of whatever flavors they had available. 

She responds as if I'm trying to cheat her or something. She say, "yes the groupon says advance orders need 48 hrs notice, so you should have known that a 2doz order needs 48 hrs notice."

After going back and forth on how in the world I was supposed to know that a "2 doz order" is the same as an "advanced order", she says "If you had bought the 1 doz groupon it wouldn't have had that language about 48 hrs in advance. That's how you'd know." I told her I didn't buy the 1 doz, I bought the 2 doz. 
Then she asks if I've used a groupon from them before, which I haven't. She nods and smiles like "suure, whatever". 

Then she says "The 2 doz groupon lets you get 1 doz per visit, so you have to come back on another visit for the other doz."

At this point, I already know I'm never coming back, so I don't want to do that. I ask, where in the groupon does it specify that? Of course, it does not, but she says that's how it works. Then I ask, couldn't I just get my first doz, walk out and come back in, so what would be the point? She just gives me that twisted smile again. Finally I showed her the groupon voucher on my phone and said there's no way to indicate that only the first 1 doz was redeemed. So if I tried to do what she said, I wouldn't be able to comeback for another doz. She said, "I guess you just lose the other dozen."

At this point I said to her there's no way anything she said makes any sense and I wasn't going to do that. I wanted 2 doz right now from the flavors they have available. She said she'd "let" me have 2 doz, like she was doing me some kind of favor. 

I don't know what her problem was. Maybe she's new, there was a miscommunication when she was trained on the groupon, or she was just having a bad day. But it was an extremely frustrating experience because of her. 

The cupcakes themselves actually aren't bad, so 1 star for that.
author: Tad G.

description: I ordered two dozen assorted minis. The cakes were dry and a bit hard and frosting was standard.
author: LT B.

description:
Emmalouise, my kids, and I walked all around San Francisco Saturday.  This was our last stop.  She had a Groupon that she wanted redeemed.  She placed the order and said that she would be there at 4PM to pickup but we didn't get there till almost 6PM.  Though we were late, I saw the friendly smiles behind the counter.

Even though I love cupcakes and I love its price but I wanted to limit as much refined sugar as possible so I took a step inside but immediately walked out once I realized I might succumb to my cravings if I don't get back outside.

Emmalouise ordered 3 dozens, I believe.  A variety but she insisted on giving me 3 chocolate cupcakes because 1) I only do chocolates and 2) she wanted my kids and I to each try one.  Very sweet of her *hearts*

I devoured mine when we got to the parking garage.  I liked that the cake was moist and that the frosting was light and semisweet.  My daughter enjoyed hers right then and there as well.  My son didn't get his till the day after.  As I was cleaning up the crumbs that has fallen from his grasp/mouth, I can feel that the cake is still moist.  It was a day old and was left out (not refrigerated).  I was quite impressed!  

I had no idea this bakery won Cupcake Wars.  I don't follow much on Food Network since hockey season has started.  All I know is that this is such a cute little bakery filled w/ nothing but mini cupcakes.  At $1 a piece, you can't go wrong!  

Until our next San Francisco adventure, BFF...
author: Tram N.

description:
My wedding venue manager told me about this place and highly recommended me to use it for my wedding in March. So I went there and tried their cupcakes, perfect size, not too sweet and lots of good favors. The cashier was friendly when I asked her about placing big order with the Groupon deal. That's all before I read all these bad reviews.....they get me little nervous.
I just sent an email to request for the 10 dozens orders, will see how it's going to turn out. But the cashier did me confident that would be fine. Will update after the wedding!
author: wing c.

description: Yummy cupcakes! My brother picked up these cupcakes using groupon and I'm so glad he did cuz it yummers! Light cupcakes with 11 different flavors! About $1 ea but better deal with Groupon! Parking is ok. No lines! Great service from the ladies at the counter! I will definitely come back with my brother!
author: Angel G.

description:
Lovely little shop that dishes out some tasty tiny morsels. Yes, Mission Minis; you have made me an addict. I love peanut butter, I eat that stuff from the jar at times. That being said, the Peanut Butter Kiss minis are fantastic and fulfill my PB hankerings. 

Buy a dozen or two of random minis, some Pepto, and proceed to eat them in one sitting. You'll thank me except for the minor sugar induced stomach ache.

This place rocks.
author: Justin C.

description:
Little hole in the wall store in the mission with ridiculously cute mini cupcakes! 

Decided to come here because I saw the amazon local deal that came out recently.  Since my family was having a get together that day, I thought it would be perfect to bring to the party. I mean c'mon, what's better than a mini cupcake at a party?

Walked in without calling in/ emailing the store first, but the person working the counter was nice enough to let me buy the cupcakes; I guess it was because it was a slow day.

This place has a decent selection of flavors, including all the favorite: aztec chocolate, red velvet, lavender honey, cinnamon horchata.. the list goes on.  If you buy a dozen, the cupcakes come in a smaller version of the typical pink to-go boxes you get at asian bakeries with a mission minis stamp on top.  The whole package presents well.

This place had everything going for it until I actually bit into the cupcakes.  As cute as they look, I would say it was one of my more disappointing cupcake experiences.  The cake itself was a bit dry- gave me the feeling that they might have been overbaked or day old. However, if you feel that cakes like the ones you get at Kara's or Sprinkles are too moist, you might find this place better.

The frosting to cake ratio was also disappointing.  When they say mini cupcakes, they really mean mini.  The cake itself is smaller than you would imagine when just looking at the cupcake, and that is because most of the cupcake's size comes from the sheer amount of frosting they apply to the top to make it actually look like a miniature version of what you would get at other cupcake places. Half the amount of frosting would suffice.

That all being said though, I would say that if you are in the area and happen to need to buy a small gift for whatever reason, this place is not a terrible option. These cupcakes present well, and are an inexpensive option for these types of occacssions.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Store hours today are 8-6pm and they are closed already and it is 5:45!
The lady still inside but door is lock and the open sign is off?
author: Abi R.

description: I purchased via groupon since they had a deal. This was for my sister's babyshower. I knew they were mini but not THAT mini! It was totally not worth the price, very disappointed. I ordered  what seemed like unique flavors (cinnamon horchata,  aztec chocolate, etc.) but they weren't memorable. Won't order the minis again. I haven't gone inside the store, maybe they have better cupcakes which are regular size but really felt my money wasted on those small minis.
author: Mary C.

description:
I've had these cupcakes at parties and decided to purchase them for my sister's bridal shower. I have enjoyed these cute little cupcakes in the past, however when I purchased four dozen it was a little upsetting. One of the four boxes, the cupcakes were on their side or completely upside down. The other three boxes at least three cupcakes were on its side. This made for horrible presentation at the bridal shower. 

Completely dissatisfied with my first purchasing experience. I would recommend Mission Minis get better boxes that hold the cupcakes better so this could be avoided.
author: Leah I.

description: Mission Minis is the best! Their cupcakes are delicious and they are super easy to work with. Diego is great and been very helpful on multiple occasions for both large and small orders making sure we have exactly what we need! I am a repeat customer and will continue to be one:) Favorite flavor is the classic vanilla.
author: Jessica L.

description:
GROUPON USERS BEWARE

Went to Mission Minis to order cupcakes for a party on a day they would normally be open, within the time constraint required to place the order. They were arbitrarily closed. Called, emailed, finally got a response the next day. Went there again the next day they were open. Was told they wouldn't honor my Groupon for the day I needed the cupcakes, that I could buy some cupcakes for the full price without the Groupon, but could only use my Groupon after I didn't need the cupcakes anymore.
author: Linda H.

description: I went w my mom and sister , cupcakes were good . But ummm customer service was hmmm it wasn't bad but she was pleasant .
author: Woo J.

description: Cupcakes are ok nothing amazing.  Got red velvet, lemon, chocolate, and blueberry. Red velvet was ok lemon and blueberry were good but not amazing. Didn't try the chocolate. Staff seems uninterested but not rude just not overly enthusiastic.
author: David S.

description:
Swooped up a Groupon for $23 for 4 DOZEN of their cupcakes! Yeah, that's over 50% off! Honestly they are a bit overpriced $1/each, but with the Groupon it was definitely worth it! It came at a perfect time for a couple coworkers' birthdays. Didn't know if we wanted a cake to celebrate, but this groupon gave us the option to get multiple flavors, share with more people at work, and save us the trouble of cutting a cake!

THE HIGHLIGHTS:
~Ruby Red Velvet~
Red velvet buttermilk cake with classic cream cheese frosting. -- A classic for any cupcake lover. The cake was moist and the cream cheese just sweet enough without overpowering the cake.

~Cinnamon Horchata~ 
Mexican rice milk cake with classic cream cheese frosting topped with freshly ground cinnamon -- Described in one word: CHURRO. This was my favorite of the bunch (tied with the Lemon)

~Meyer Lemon Creme~
Meyer lemon cake topped with lemon curd and cream cheese frosting -- A MUST HAVE for lemon cake lovers like myself. So good and the cake was moist! A favorite!

THE MEHHH:
~Classic Vanilla~
Classic vanilla bean cake with vanilla bean buttercream topped with multicolored sprinkles -- As a classic vanilla lover, I was disappointed. Cake seemed a bit dry..

~Double Chocolate~
Dark cinnamon infused aztec chocolate cake with chocolate buttercream topped with multicolored sprinkles -- Just didn't stand out. Coworker mentioned she liked the frosting more than the cake.

~Aztec Chocolate~
Dark cinnamon infused aztec chocolate cake with vanilla bean buttercream.
-- This didn't stand out either.

~Swiss Almond Coconut~
Fresh coconut cake with swiss meringue buttercream topped with toasted almond and shredded coconut -- Per yelp reviews we got these. I was disappointed...the cake seemed dry and not enough of a coconut flavor.


ORDERING/PICK-UP:
Ordering was a breeze. They have a copy and paste form which you fill out and email to them with at least 2 business days in ADVANCE.

Pick-Up was a bit tricky. Parking is scare, so it was a good thing I came with a coworker who double parked as I ran in to pick up the goods. They were already bagged and ready to go. However, the girl at the counter did mention (as I placed my Groupon on the counter) that I was suppose to mention in the order I was using a Groupon, as it affects how they enter the invoice in their system. I thought she was going to make a big stink about it, but she didn't-- so crisis averted. I'm usually very good about reading fine prints in Groupons, and after re-reading it again it made no instruction about mentioning in the order form that I was using a Groupon...Just something to note.

PACKAGING: 
They put a dozen cupcakes in one box, so I can imagine this getting ugly with cupcakes rolling around if you don't order by a multiple of 12. I wish they had cardboard/plastic wells to sit the cupcakes in for safe transport, but we cant have everything as consumers.
author: Jenna H.

description:
Continuing my quest to visit as manny cupcake wars winners as I possibly can, I arrived at Mission Minis. Unfortunately, it was nothing exciting. Yes, I knew they would be minis but if you're gonna be small you better pack the perfect bite. Location, in the Mission so parking can get crazy, probably doesn't help that it's right next to an amazing gelato place. It's definitely a quick pick up.

I had one of almost everything. Really came for the horchata.. which was featured on the show. That was the only one that seemed to be a contender. Now cause they are minis none of them had yummy centers.. not sure if I like that. The cake was a tad on the dry side but the frosting perfect not to sweet yet creamy enough.

As for the other cakes I had the following:
Red velvet- cake was nice and moist but not enough coco
Lemon- dry cake not enough lemon
Chocolate PB- not bad but I didn't care for the frosting
Cookies & creme- best bite

Price wise they are all $1. They are made every day till they sell out. Not sure if I would come back. My feeling I could probably make one at home just as good.
author: Nicole G.

description: This place knows how to make cream cheese frosting! However, for my cinnamon horchata minis I could not taste the horchata flavor at all and the bread tasted more like bananas. overall, good cupcakes!
author: Anielle G.

description:
A great deal if you have a Groupon voucher.

My favorite flavors here are the vanilla and red velvet. The cinnamon horchata is alright, and the other flavors weren't as good or moist.

Things to note:
- Be careful transporting these items. I traveled two blocks with them in my tote and it looked like a cupcake massacre when my friends opened the box.
- You need to email them your order at least 48 hours in advance. Pickup is super easy.
author: Diana K.

description: Best. Such a gorgeous little morsel. The price is perfect; the size is right. Boyfriend brought me here after dinner and they were the perfect ending to an excellent day of food.
author: James I.

description:
I have been to Mission Minis a number of times and every time I went I was incredibly impressed with not only the quality of their cupcakes (moist and flavorful) but also the amazing service. 

The first time I went, I arrived one minutes before they were about to close. The person working there graciously let me in and didn't try to rush me. He answered all of my questions and helped me pick out two dozen cupcakes. 

 Mission Minis! Thanks for providing great service and yummy bite sized cupcakes. I will be back!!!
author: christina t.

description: I had these cupcakes at a Yelp Elite event that my co-workers and I were one of the vendors at. We met the owner and founder, Brandon, and since we fed him dinner, he gave us a box of mini cupcakes. They were delicious! My personal favorites were the Ruby Red Velvet and the Vegan Banana Maple. The funny thing was that I didn't even know that the VBM was a vegan cupcake. I just saw it, thought it looked enticing, and ate it. When I asked Brandon what it was because I thought it was so good, he told me that he thought it was funny I liked it because it was vegan, and made out of bananas. I enjoyed it very much, especially how moist and sweet the cake is, without being too sweet, and how the maple syrup glaze also gives the cake a crisp texture. Delicious!
author: Jo W.

description:
Their frostings are on point. Some are a little sweeter than I prefer, but great textures either way.

Cinnamon Horchata- so good! Wasn't expecting the contrast between the frosting and cupcake, but great stuff.

Vegan Banana Maple- DELICIOUS. It is more of a muffin because it's vegan (very very dense), but I love that flavor.

Aztec Chocolate- very bold chocolate flavor! 

Peanut Butter kiss- the frosting is to die for...the chocolate cupcake was bland, dry, and tasteless.

Blueberries and Creme- there's everything wrong with this. Overly sweet frosting, not nearly enough blueberries, and the vanilla doesn't even show through in the cupcake.

Red velvet- good frosting, and the taste wasn't bad, but it's not really red velvet. It tasted like an odd chocolate cupcake. And it was dry.
author: Ellie M.

description:
I had seen Mission Minis on Cupcake Wars and ***spoiler alert*** they won the coveted title of best baker out of the four competitors on that particular day. My curiosity was piqued, especially when I saw that they had a vegan flavor, hooray!

I am a strict vegan, so no eggs, dairy, honey, etc. al. On my first visit, at around 2:30 on a Saturday, they were already sold out of the vegan flavor. Bummer! I guess I would try again next time.

I was already in the neighborhood today, so I stopped by. Again, only one vegan flavor, and there were 5 left. I purchased all 5 and gave 4 to my friends in the Hella Vegan Eats truck at the Mission Mercado, but did taste one, to see if they were any good.

They are very cute, for sure. These petite little cuties come in at about 100 calories a pop (so I've heard). Their one vegan flavor doesn't sound like the most appetizing one (Banana Maple Glaze), and it doesn't have the same creamy whipped frosting that the others have. 

Well, it wasn't the worst cupcake I've had, but definitely not the best. The banana flavor was a little overpowering without any frosting. The glaze doesn't provide enough sweetness. I think they should try to experiment and create an awesome dairy-free frosting and/or filling. I would even pay extra for the vegan flavor if it was a better one. 

At least they don't break the bank , as these mini treats are only $1 each, which is really reasonable and affordable. 

Why not bake more vegan flavors though? 9 regular and 1 vegan seems a little unbalanced, especially when you're smack-dab in the midst of the Mission in San Francisco, which is supposed to be a very veg-friendly, eco-friendly, hippie dippie city. Get on the bandwagon and ditch more dairy, even if that means two vegan flavors instead of one. Maybe then I would find more incentive to visit.
author: Brandi W.

description: My daughter is in love with the show Cupcake Wars which apparently the owner of Mission Minis was on a couple of years ago. She insisted we try them... Walked in the store to find some girl at the counter on a laptop, she barely acknowledged us. I asked if the only cupcakes they had were on the display and she barely gave me a yes. They had 5 different flavors, chocolate, almond coconut, classic vanilla, banana maple, and red velvet. I bought all 5 none of which were good, just ok. The cupcakes are mini emphasis on MINI. These cupcakes are so tiny and $1.00 a piece. With bad customer service, tiny, and just OK cupcakes this place just didn't do it for me.
author: EmCee C.

description: On our way to late breakfast, we stopped and each got 2 minis. Then we each got 1 or 2 more!  So yummy!
author: K J.

description:
Not bad.  Not great.  Definitely not Kara's Cupcakes.  Their Red Velvet alone would earn them 4 stars but I judge cupcake bakeries based on the quality of their chocolate cupcakes; sadly, they fall short there.  The problem with their Double Chocolate and Aztec Chocolate cupcakes is the base is dark cinnamon and the chocolate is infused.  This causes the chocolate to be more of an aftertaste rather than the dominant flavor which doesn't make much sense to me.  If I wanted a cinnamon cupcake, I would get a cinnamon cupcake.  

A lot of their cupcakes are cinnamon based.  Thus, go here if you like cinnamon.
author: Michele L.

description: We had a baby reveal party with all of our family & friends this weekend in San Bruno. We had Mission Minis do our cupcakes for this event and they turned out PERFECT!!!! We wanted to be surprised with our guest so everybody @ Mission Minis made sure we wouldn't find out. Cupcakes were delicious and of course the blue filling in the inside said were having a boy! Thanks again for all your hard work and meeting with us to make this day so special!
author: Daniel E.

description:
I ordered 2 dozen cupcakes for my friend's birthday. We exchanged a couple emails over the order - fairly simple with Happy Birthday [insert my friend's name]! I picked up the order at the specific time & the employee showed me one of the boxes. The color was not what I had requested, but it would suffice, small potatoes. When I went to put the cupcakes on a platter that evening I was pretty unhappy to realize that they had misspelled my friend's name. It was really embarrassing, but we were able to laugh it off.

The next day I checked the invoice to make sure that I hadn't sent them a typo in her name, and was relieved to see everything spelled properly in our email correspondence and in the final invoice they sent me. I sent them an email explaining the problem in hopes they might rectify things. No response at all. Cupcakes are alright, service is shameful. Plenty of bakeries in the neighborhood - I would encourage you to satisfy your sweet tooth at a place that treats their customers with a modicum of decency.
author: Laura G.

description:
After a chomping down a "massive" burrito from El Farolito, I even had enough room for dessert. When you hang out with me, there is ALWAYS room for dessert. 

"Being surrounded by the taqueria's grills and having onion breath, I also kind of need it too!

A cute little shop in the slowly-revamped Mission area. The little shop sells only mini cupcakes. And the $1.00 minis can fit in the palm of your hand. 

The size: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eHlz_z85nrozA8WaCCELfg?select=uSU1TTb7MKxNmyE6CjhBmQ

I bought three cupcakes:

(From counter-clockwise), the Cinnamon Horcahata, Red Velvet Cupcake, and Peanut-Butter Kiss. 

Cupcakes: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eHlz_z85nrozA8WaCCELfg?select=Vk4AxCY0VRblBDoCHZb0Sw

You better your bottom's dollar that I devoured all three of the moist mini cupcakes.

 The only downside that the Red Velvet one was a bit dry. But the Cinnamon Horchata-one is the "real deal". 

It would be nice if this place serve beverages .i.e. coffee, to wash down my cuppycakes. 

Despite the busy neighborhood, I'm happy that businesses, like this cupcake places, are taking over the rugged Mission Street.
author: Matt G.

description: We walked past the shop right before closing today. Their minis are $1. We tried the cinnamon horchata, red velvet and Meyer lemon. My favorites were the horchata and the lemon. They are moist and perfectly portioned for just a bite!
author: Jen L.

description:
I was really excited to try Mission Mini's after I saw them on Cupcake Wars.  One day my husband and I decided to try them.  We got lucky and found parking right away.

I had checked out Mission Minis on Yelp so I knew which flavors I wanted to try if they were available.  Sadly they were out of the Banana Maple Glaze so we decided to try Aztec Chocolate, Ruby Red Velvet, Peanut Butter Kiss, and Cinnamon Horchata.

The Red Velvet was an average red velvet; not too exciting.  I'm not sure what made the Aztec Chocolate "Aztec" but it tasted like a regular chocolate cake.  The Peanut Butter Kiss was good but like the Red Velvet and Aztec Chocolate, not too exciting.  I'm not a big cinnamon fan but I'd have to say the Cinnamon Horchata was the best one.  All the other cakes were a bit on the dry side.  But a plus is that the cupcakes are only $1 each.
author: Rose A.

description:
I'll admit, the cupcake is played out. I got on the bandwagon early and jumped off late. It just feels like it's all been done and I'm a tough customer and no longer impressed. 

However, the cinnamon horchata at Mission Minis could turn me back into a cupcake devotee. All mini sizes are $1 each and that cinnamon horchata is a nice bite of cupcake.
author: Lee H.

description:
OOOOOOONE DALLLAHHHHHH!!!!
one dollar
one hundred pennies
twenty nickels
ten dimes
four quarters
$1


$1 for super mini cupcakes! Yum! Now that's my kind of price! :D

Tried all the non-chocolate flavors that were left...
- swiss almond coconut
- cinnamon horchata

There's a cupcake thief! O_O I wanted to try (but were all sold out before 3:30pm on a weekday)...
- pink lemonade
- banana maple glaze
- pumpkin spice
- classic vanilla
- ginger carrot

I was super sad that they were out of every non-chocolate flavor, except for the two flavors above. *tear* Go early if you are really set on a certain flavor. They do sell out quickly! The cupcakes were indeed super TINY, but were just enough to get a taste where you don't feel sick from all the sugar overload.

Needs improvement: The store is bare naked! It needs more decor... store front windows and cute, cupcakey decor throughout the store! They should hire an interior decorator! haha 

Gobble! Gobble!

Cupcake flavors: http://missionminis.com/menu.php
author: CeCe C.

description:
Regarding FLAVOR:

Yummy yummy yummy! I'll come back. Wish there had been a few extra flavors to choose, but what we had was scrumptious. Good job, Mission Minis! 

Regarding SERVICE:

While I liked the flavors I had, the store front was empty when we walked in & it felt more like we were bothering the employee. I tried asking questions, and felt like we needed to "hit the road," so we did. :(  For good customer service, they would have done better. I just don't like going places I'm not welcome, & I didn't feel welcome here.

I found Mission Minis because of Cupcake Wars & another show they were on. I walked FOUR MILES to sample them, which made the disappointment even greater when we felt like we were bothering them. Feeling rushed we quickly ordered & headed back towards Bart at Embarcadero & then home to the Central Valley.
author: Susi B.

description:
Date & Time:  Thursday February 18, 2010 @ 5:30pm
Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Cute Hipster Girls in Checked Shirts w/ Skinny Jeans or Flowy Tunics w/ Leggings & Boots
Atmosphere:  Cheery
Decor:  Cute Small Space.  Hot Pink & Baby Pink Striped Walls.  Cupcake Counter
Service:  Sweet Young Girl & Nice Helpful Guy
Devour:  Classic Vanilla, Aztec Chocolate, Ruby Red Velvet, Banana Maple Glaze, Swiss Almond Coconut & Cinnamon Horchata Mini CupCakes
Total:  $10 A Dozen & $20 for 2 Dozen
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Strangest location ever.  I thought we were in the wrong place, but we saw the sign so we went in.  It looked like they were just getting set up or closing down.  The place was empty.  There was barely any cupcakes in their display case.  We went on a Saturday at 4:00 in the afternoon, so I don't think they were closing up.  There was one person that came up to help us after waiting for a little bit.  It seemed really run down to me.
