The mini cupcakes are really cute, but don't taste as good as they look.  Also, they are priced at $2 a pop for a tiny cupcake.  We had the ruby reds and horchata cupcakes.  I know horchata is really a rice/cinnamon flavor, but it tasted like a cinnamon roll.  Nothing special.  I'd buy cupcakes from here if I was in the area, but I'm not going to go out of my way to buy them.
author: Richard N.

description:
Listen to me. 
CAKE POPS. they are my fav.

Mini cupcakes for $1. The most delicious red velvet with buttermilk cake and cream cheese frosting. Meyer lemon cream was delightful, tangy lemon cake and subtle buttercream topping. The boyfriend likes cinnamon horchata. Perfect destination post  24th st mission bart.
author: Esther P.

description:
Had a Groupon for three dozen. Placed the order way in advance and was surprised they were ready when we said we were going to pick them up.  The lady i placed the order  with was very nice and patient. I didn't  pick it up,  so can't attest to that.  4 stars for customer service and coordination. 

Now the mini cakes... got like 10 different flavors.  1 of the 7 blueberry was moldy, 2 of the 7 blueberry didn't look quite right/ deformed. All the frosting tasted good but frosting to cake proportion seems top  loaded.  Wish there was more cake to it or less frosting. Good thing it's not overly sweet. Most of the cake was way too dry except for the lemon one which was too oily.. consistency can be improved. 2 stars for the product. Don't think i will get from them again unless i have cravings and in the area.
author: chiisaikori C.

description:
Et tu, Mission Minis?

Tartine Bakery.
Bi-Rite Creamery.
Mission Pie.
Anthony's Cookies.
Dynamo Donuts.

This Axis of Evil has been wreaking havoc with waistlines and waging war with the exercise regimens of Mission denizens for years.  (Well mine anyway.)

The only chink in the armor was CUPCAKES.

WAS.  

Thanks to Mission Minis, I now have to deal with a relentless assault of nefarious mini cupcakes in an array of flavors, colors, and sprinkles.  

Since these mini cupcakes are well priced at $1 apiece, before you know it, you've been lured into ordering one of each flavor, and you find yourself in the midst of a maxi cupcake tasting.  (Tip:  Sip milk in between tastings to clear your palate.)   

After trying nearly all of them, the favorites are the creative and pretty pastel colored Pink Lemonade, the rich Peanut Butter Chocolate, and the awesomely flavored Pumpkin Spice with addictive Rum flavored frosting. 

Damn you Mission Minis.  

May God have mercy on your soul.
author: Amy C.

description:
Cute little mini cupcakes at $1 each. Don't think you will save on calories though. I bought 6 there with different flavors before my class nearby one evening, thinking I'll just taste one and share the rest with my teacher. While I got to the class parking lot, it was around 5 pm, so I sat in my car and tried one. The next thing I knew was within about 3 minutes all of the cupcakes were gone; they became my dinner!!! I normally limit my intake of sweets but these mini cupcakes were soft, not overly sweet and the buttercream was also so soft, creamy and not very sweet. They kind of reminded me of the spongy yellow cale you can get at most Chinese bakeries in the Chinatown. Depending on what you are looking for, this could be a plus or minus. I wasn't expecting anything fancy going into this so was happy with what I got. 

The store itself is very small and nothing fancy like other higher-end specialty cupcakeries. If you get there late, they may run out of the flavors on the menu. I just grabbed whatever they have got left on the counter. Also they don't carry standard size cupcakes on a regular basis. If you want those you have to pre-order them. That's probably good for the waistline and pocket for someone like me who just wants to taste different flavors on their menu.

The parking can be challenging but I got lucky and got a spot right in front of the shop.
author: Claire W.

description:
YAY for Groupons!!  "$11 for Two-Dozen Eclectic Miniature Cupcakes at Mission Minis - $22 Value" -- They couldn't fill our order in time since we didn't make the 48hr cutoff notice and received an email saying they have already closed order reservations for Saturday. (They sold over 3000 Groupons), so we just dropped in as recommended to choose from available in-store selection ... and managed to sample ALL of the flavors too! 

swiss almond coconut
ruby red velvet
cinnamon horchata
aztec chocolate
pink lemonade
banana maple glaze
classic vanilla
ginger carrot
peanut butter kiss

They're all pretty delish bite size goodness... They're not as sweet and heavily laden w/ frosting which I like. The mini's are perfect to satisfy that sweet tooth w/o all the carb guilt ... unless you're planning to scarf down a dozen and not trip then that's all you... ENJOY! 

W/o the Groupon they're a buck each. The guy at the counter was very patient and completely accommodating to ALL the customers... those picking up their orders and another line for drop-by's (which was out the door @11am) to grab whatever was left. 

We have one more Groupon to redeem... soooo looking forward to having another couple bites of the peanut butter kiss and pink lemonade ... my faves!
author: Aga O.

description: This place is so cute, though sitting inside isn't really an option. Take the cupcakes and find one of the nearby parklets or benches to eat your fill of dollar cupcakes.  You can even get a day old dozen of mini cupcakes for $5 if you want to try a few flavors without breaking the bank! My favorite flavors are probably aztec chocolate and pink lemonade! I really want to come back and try the horchata if they still serve it. The flavors just aren't reliable from day to day so good luck!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Today, I had an incredible urge for cupcakes. I don't consider myself a cupcake fanatic, and as a student with a limited budget, gourmet cupcakes aren't something I regularly indulge in. 

I looked online to see if I could find any deal for cupcakes in the city, and came across the Groupon instant deal, $5 for 6 cupcakes and a cup of coffee. The deal expired at 4 pm, so I planned my day to run errands around town and stop at Mission Mini's at the end of my trip to be rewarded with cupcakes. 

Unfortunately, there was traffic, so I was held up elsewhere in the city once the clock struck 4pm. I called the number on my groupon and ended up chatting with the owner of the store. He was so nice, and assured me I could come anytime that day before 6pm to redeem my coupon. 

I ended up at Mission Mini's around 5 pm (I took my sweet time getting there knowing I didn't have to rush anymore to meet the earlier deadline, picking my mom up on the way to bring her with me so I wouldn't be a fatty and eat all the cupcakes myself). There were two girls working. I showed them my coupon and they told me they had been expecting me (that was a nice feeling!). The girl told us all about their different flavors, recommending their peanut butter cupcakes (so yummy!). We also got the Ruby Red Velvet (I'm usually not a red velvet person but theirs was so good), Aztec Chocolate, Classic Vanilla, and Vegan Banana Maple(my mom's favorite). 

Because it was near the end of the day, they were out of their other flavors. I'm a huge fan of lemon so I was disappointed they didn't have any when I went. But my disappointment didn't last long when the girl working gave us extra cupcakes! My mom fell in love with the Vegan Banana Maple, so the girl gave us two extra ones for free! Also, I didn't want the coffee that came with the deal, so I was able to forgo the coffee for 2 extra cupcakes. I had 12 cupcakes in total, all for $5! 

This girl was so sweet and nice! The other cupcake shops I've been too, such as Karas and Sprinkles, the girls have been cordial for the most part, but sometimes give the vibe of being snobby. Not the case at Mission Minis! My mom and I felt so  welcome! 

I definitely plan on coming back to Mission Mini's again! Great service, delicious cupcakes, and super affordable! Not to mentioned easy to eat thanks to the cupcakes being perfectly bite sized!
author: Maahum C.

description:
Had heard decent things. Ordering was easy and staff was accommodating with groupon
Very underwhelmed and unimpressed with the actual product. Got 1 dozen each of red velvet, Meyer lemon, double chocolate, peanut butter.  Each was cute but all cake flavors were pretty dang dry.  My red velvet sadly is better. I felt bad wasting my calories on these minis. Frosting was decent for all flavors. 
My sister ordered as well but didn't get her order in time to do a custom order so she got the bakers dozen.   Surprisingly it happened to be a good thing.  Of all the flavors the best was the cinnamon since it was the only flavor we had that was not dry. Sadly we only had 3 edible cupcakes out of a total of 72. 
So decent deal with groupon in term of discount from original price but for the dryness I wouldn't have spent the $
author: clarissa l.

description:
Incredible pricing & great for corporate/company events. I've ordered cupcakes for birthday parties, product launches, and company parties. They're always on time with my orders and they have a wide variety of flavors. Orders have to be placed 2 business days in advance (they're closed Mondays).

They can do custom flavors, colors, cakes, whoopie pies, cake pops, and full-size cupcakes. They can also do branded baked goods.
author: Lynae C.

description: I always grab a few dozen mini cupcakes here. With so many little ones in the family, these are the perfect size. Small enough for little hands and it doesn't create a crazy sugar high that parents would hate me for buying these for the party. I think my favorite is the coconut almond one. I'll be back again when another baby shower hits my office. These make great displays that will wow the mommy to be.
author: Antoinette L.

description:
After reading other reviews I wasn't expecting great customer service here, and I didn't get it. The gal who rang me up was cooly cordial; but not friendly. Another guy at the counter did not acknowledge me and I was the only person in the shop.

I came in to place a catering order and told the girl there I wanted to try some flavors before placing my order. 
I purchased 4 cupcakes and asked if they had some water for when I did the tasting. She told me "We don't have water here.You can go buy some next door". 
Really? I'm surprised that when you mention you want to place a catering event order that they can't give you a cup with some water in it. That bugged me.

As for flavors- I tried the red velevet (very good), the horchata(also good) the double chocolate (I was not impressed-it didn't seem chocolatey enough) and the blueberry (ok).

Since we're in SF, I'm not shocked at the cost- but if you're going to sell cupcakes (which you can get all over town at the same price and often the same or  better quality) I'd suggest they up their customer service game and at least offer some paper cups of water when requested for a tasting as a courtesy.
author: Stacy S.

description:
Relatively expensive mini cupcakes.  Really mini.  Like 1 inch diameter, 1.5 inch height.  $1 each.

I came to try out the maple glazed bananna cupcakes.  They tasted alright, about what you'd expect from bananna "cake" and some maple flavored glazing.  

Maybe I'm just not the biggest cupcake fan.  The next time I want something sweet, I'd go to the Arizmendi Bakery instead.  Their vegan mint chocolate cookies are amazing!
author: Matt T.

description:
I'm not that impressed with their cupcakes here. I mean they're not bad tasting cupcakes but they were just cupcakes to me. 

Its very appealing to come here when they have a variety of flavors to choose from and the mini cupcakes are a $1. It makes your mind go nuts that you can get a cupcake for a $1 so you feel like splurging. My brother and I tried I think 8 different flavors. None really rememberable for me unfortunately. 

The place is very small too its like you go in and select your cupcakes then just leave. Like its awkward in a way lol.
author: Denice D.

description:
I ordered for pickup for this weekend and sent them specific pictures of the colors I wanted. The colors were a baby pink and a mint green color with gold sprinkles. I know their cupcakes taste really good because I've tried it before.  But I was extremely disappointed because the mint green cupcakes turned out to be a lime green/avocado color. It looked nothing like the color in the picture I sent. So now I will only be displaying half of my order!
Never ordering from here again for my parties. 
Maybe it's because I used a groupon and they were careless of the details?
author: Telly O.

description:
Ordered for delivery. When it came 60% of the mini cupcakes were tipped over and not usable for display.

Plus the cake and frosting color combinations were not pretty. I chose the flavors based on what they recommended over the phone. My party colors were yellow and white. I asked for some with white frosting and some with yellow and let them figure it out. They had a dark brown cake with a dark yellow frosting on top and it didn't look appetizing. If anything they should have had the white frosting on the dark cakes so that they would look better. But again, we couldn't use 60% of them anyways.
author: Louisa W.

description:
This is one of those places I would give 0-stars if Yelp allowed me to. 

I was in a hurry and wanted to get a co-worker a treat for her birthday and this was on my way so I thought I would stop. 

I entered to an empty store front, after a few minutes some little hipster emerged from the back and just looked at me with a confused look as to why I was there. Another 30 seconds passed after I asked if I could purchase some cupcakes. 

"Ya they're $x each," says the emotionless employee.

"Oh, do you do any discounts for a dozen?" I inquire. 

"Uhhh, what did I just tell you...?" 

.... 

Okay. Has this freak never been to a bakery before? I chose every different kind and went on my merry way, already displeased. 

I then got to the point where I tasted the cupcakes, and boy did the displeasure increase. EVERY single flavor was dry as sand and tasteless. EVERY one of them was awful.

Do yourself a favor and spend $3 on making boxed cupcakes instead of 3 bites of sawdust you're going to get at Mission Minis.
author: Anthony G.

description:
Got a web deal and drove down into the hipster hamlet, and wonderful hang out of the nortenos, the mission to pickup a dozen of these mini delights.

First off these are truly minis....they be very small; A biteful at best.

The flavors are very good and unique. I would personally prefer stronger flavors.

The aztec chocolate was great although they subbed cinnamon instead of  peppers. The peanut butter was good but the peanut did not pop. The classic vanilla was good. The meyer lemon was great .



To be quite honest unless I got a similar deal of half off I might not trudge down to the mission to get them...but they are good and they are a bargain compared with Kara's cupcakes which are 2.25 for a mini.
author: David G.

description:
Way to go, fellow Yelp reviewers. Your love for all things mini (ponies! cars! pickles! dogs!) has made you overlook two very important factors when reviewing a place: 

1) Taste
2) Service

And based on those two *very important* factors, Mission Minis is a 1-star joint. 

I've been twice. Once with a friend who wanted mini cupcakes for a baby shower, and once with my partner. 

The first time my friend was uncharacteristically patient, and waited 20 minutes to receive her order of two dozen cupcakes. To thank me for waiting, she bought me my own mini cupcake, which was like taking two very small bites of a sand dune. 

The second time, my partner and I waited inside the bakery for four - count them, four - minutes for anyone to take notice we were there. We did the coughing thing. The clearing the throat thing. The "hellllooooo? Is anyone here?" thing. Realizing our money and our time was considered unimportant at this establishment, we went to Dianda's on Mission Street, where in return for their delicious food and welcoming smiles, they received our return business. 

Stop drinking the Mini Koolaid, people, it's affecting your rational thought.
author: Mel H.

description:
Ordered an assorted set of mini cupcakes for a friend of mine for Valentine's day. We ended up sharing them, and they are delicious!! I especially loved the vanilla and lemon cupcakes. The vanilla bean frosting is suuuper creamy and fresh tasting, it was unlike any other cupcake frosting I've tasted. It has a nice gritty texture to it. The red velvet cupcakes were good too, and came with pink frosting and heart sprinkles for the holiday. After trying all the flavors, the only ones I did not like were the banana with maple glaze and the coconut (I liked the cake part, just not the frosting). I do recommend trying all 10 flavors though to see what you like.

At $1 a pop, they are a bit pricey considering their size (Approx the same size as a donut hole), but are really delicious and nicely presented and makes for a great gift. They come in a cute pink box (Though I'm not sure if this was due to it being Vday). They also do delivery - though they book fast on holidays so make sure to book in advance. For the cupcakes themselves you also need to order at least two days in advance.
author: Anna C.

description:
Over the holiday season, I won' Rookie of the Year' at my non-profit's holiday party.  I was very excited about the award and the fact that it came with a nice cash bonus.  I wanted to buy a little something for my coworkers since not everyone received a bonus, and I figured the groupon for mission minis would be a great idea to perk up the office.

Everyone I talked to on the phone was very nice, and when I inquired about them delivering the cupcakes to my office (since it was too many for me to transport via bus) the manager kindly delivered them even though the groupon didn't allow delivery.  My coworkers were very happy, the treats were delicious, and the excellent costumer service didn't go unnoticed!
author: Jen S.

description: I relied on this establishment to have cupcakes since that's the only thing it sells. Every single time I come they are 'sold out for the day' ..... it is 1pm.
author: Lacey A.

description: I got 6 dozen mini cupcakes for about $30 from the groupon deal. I preordered for an event; 2 dozen red velvet, 2 dozen cinnamon horchata, and 2 dozen blueberry. I didn't try the blueberry but the cinnamon horchata and red velvet were delicious! Not too sweet, very moist and looked beautiful on the cupcake stand that I bought from party city. And most importantly, the guests all loved it! My only complaint about the cupcakes is that when they package it, the frosting gets all over the box.
author: Joyce C.

description:
Perfect place to get mini cupcakes for parties. The 9 flavors have enough choices for everybody's favorite, and they are always moist. 

My favorite goes between double chocolate and pumpkin spice.  The red velvet, lemon, and banana are also great. I always bring these to work events - and I always get requests for every flavor. 

They are mini (smaller than other places), but the price is also cheaper, and it's the perfect bite size for parties.
author: Jon H.

description:
My boss told me I HAD to try the famous Mission Mini's knowing I'm an avid lover and I bake. I told him I was going to go someday and all of a sudden an idea came to mind, ta-daaa! I decided to order two dozen for my friends Birthday the following day at the park. I took the stinky, slow, and horrendous 49 bus at 9am for almost an hour just to this little to-go cupcake shop. 

My eyes dazzled once I smelled the sweetness around me. Swiss Almond Coconut! Ruby Red Velvet! Vegan Banana Maple! Aztec Chocolate! Peanut Butter Kiss! Blueberries and Cream! Classic Vanilla! Double Chocolate! And you can make them Gluten Free Minis. Seriously delish, I wanted them all. But the CINNAMON HORCHATA takes the cake, unquestionably.  It was $1/each for Mini Cupcakes and  $3/each for Regular Cupcakes. I ended up paying around $30 and signed on an Ipad and emailed my receipt, techie, huh?

Next day comes around, I take the cupcakes that were in the boxes and someone's stupid dog decides to eat 3 boxes and smashed the rest that were put next to the beautiful cake. I was embarrassed when they were singing Happy Birthday and my friend said "Stephanie brought these cupcakes!", I was very happy there was two Stephanie's at that party, but she had, HAD to point at me, sigh. I had to tell everyone that it doesn't matter what they look like, it's how they taste. Before I knew it, they were all gone, everyone loved them and asked me where I bought them.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Wow! The girl at the front counter was a real B. $1 per mini cupcake seems a bit high, and they were very oily. Used a groupon so I went in to place my order two day in advance. The girl at the counter was impatient and was giving off audible sighs as I was placing my order -- I should mention that I along with my family, were the only customers in the place. She definitely emotes the idea that we were somehow interfering with her day. In addition to the preorder we pick up four mini cupcakes to sample the fare. Definitely not worth the price they charge. I would recommend if you are going to get these to only buy them through one of the deal apps/websites.

Updated experience:
Went to pick up my order and the guy behind the counter looked everywhere for it and could not find my order. He asks if I got an invoice when I ordered, which the unpleasant counter girl did not give me. So she apparently did not submit. I guess no cupcakes today.
author: Makoto V.

description:
I waited until last minute to place an order for a Bridal Shower I was throwing.  They were not only able to make mini's but were also able to custom make them to match my theme.  

Everyone at the shower devoured them, they were moist and flavorful!  Definitely would use them again.
author: Jackie L.

description:
Meh. 2.5 stars.. but I'll be nice and round up.

I had the horchata and the aztec chocolate flavors. Nothing to rave about. A bit on the dry side...

I think that because these cupcakes are bite-sized, it's difficult to realize that the cupcakes are dryer than the competitions'. There's really nothing that makes them stand out from the crowd.

The only saving grace? I got a dozen of these for only $1 through an online deal. Would I pay full price for these? Definitely not.
author: Kazu O.

description: What's the point of being open until 8 p.m if you literally have 20 cupcakes left. Super disappointing.
author: Shanah K.

description:
After tasting the cupcakes from That takes the cakes I'm kinda skeptical with any other cupcakes.

Using the Groupon, I gotta make a reservation of what I want and picked it up 2 days later. No problem at all. Great!

Red velvet cupcakes were awesome! Banana maple tastes like banana bread, which I love.

Most of the other flavors are pretty good too and I think the mini size is perfect for cupcakes so I don't overindulge. I did ate 5 cupcakes in 1 sitting. Much better than eating 5 of the normal size one ;)
author: Novalina N.

description: Omg, the red velvet cupcake is to die for! Delicious, not dry and just the right amount of sweet. Oh, and the cup cakes are bite sized, perfect for a mid afternoon treat without making you feel guilty :))
author: Kylie F.

description:
I like the idea/size of mini cupcakes, and ordered 4-dozen online for a work party with an Amazon Local deal with no problems. 

Unfortunately, they package them super loosely in cake boxes -- if you are thinking of ordering cupcakes for a group, be advised that if you jostle them at ALL in transit that the frosting will be ruined. Although I was super careful with them, over half of the four dozen I'd bought tipped over in the twenty minutes it took me to get to work from the shop. Lame.  

Also, the "cake" part was really flavorless and dry. Staleness may be an issue? 

Not sure I'd go here again :(
author: chloe w.

description:
They're alright, flavors are cool. Cupcakes are dry if you ask me, and overpriced like you're paying $1 for 1 bite of cake.

As another yelper said, Cako is much better they have mini's there too. I think people are more impressed by their cuteness more than anything.
author: Aundria G.

description:
I don't have a sweet tooth but when it comes to frosting, most frosting for me are to sugary and grainy, but this place frosting was unique taste smooth and buttery, i thought that was cool, the cashier guy was awesome , great attitude, and friendly.

that frosting is a 5 star the cake itself  need a bit more flavor because it just taste like cake or maybe im just eating it wrong am i suppose to just pop it all in my mouth?

if that's the case there's to much frosting, at least for me, so i cut the frosting in half and then eat it all. taste a lot better and definitely get that flavor.
author: Dylan C.

description: Get the salted caramel, you won't regret it! I also liked the double chocolate and the red velvet. I prefer the mini, this way you get to try more.
author: Sunil R.

description: Super efficient, fast, easy to work with and order from. Everything ready when I arrived. Everyone loved all the mini cupcakes and commented the cake to frosting ratio was perfect. Will definitely order again!
author: Viv R.

description: This is a review only for an online order (I have walked in once to only find semi-stale red velvet cupcakes left but at 6 PM on a Friday, I take that more as an indication of a good sale day than anything else for a cupcake shop).   I ordered a dozen cupcakes (2 of cinnamon horchata, red velvet, peanut butter kiss, aztec chocolate, swiss almond coconut, and vegan banana) and the process was so simple. I was able to pick them up on the way home late friday afternoon for a birthday party and they were a huge hit.  Perfectly sized for birthday dinners (aka not awkward to eat when out) and very reasonably priced.  You just need the foresight to order a few days in advance.
author: Raina D.

description: It's 1/3 the size of a regular cupcake, but also 1/3 of the price, which means you can try 3 times the number of flavors for the amount of a regular cupcake. I like that. What I like even more is that day old cupcakes are only 50 cents. What!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Very cute little shop with mini cupcakes. Some were seasonal (ie. blueberry, pumpkin spice) so the choices of flavors will vary from time to time. My 3 friends and I tasted 12 different cupcakes. My favorites were honey lavender (frosting was a very strong lavender flavor at first but becomes mild very quickly), swiss almond coconut (just so fun to eat) and peanut butter chocolate (and I don't usually like peanut butter flavored desserts). Across the board, the actual cake was average to good, but it was the frosting was what really made the cupcakes 4 stars. I am usually not a big fan of frosting but how they made theirs so light and fluffy!
author: Vi N.

description:
Here I go, feeding my cupcake addiction again. 

I was lucky enough to walk in as one of the owners was experimenting with a new apple cupcake recipe. It had a maple glaze criss-crossed on top - sort of like a mini apple pie. He let me try it and asked my opinion. It was soft and moist and with teeny bits of real apple in it. The glaze was light, so you could enjoy the taste of the cupcake without overpowering frosting. I gave him two thumbs up!

The cute little pink tables in the front made me wanna play tea party with someone. But I don't believe they were meant for adults. I tried...

Cinnamon Horchata
Peanut Butter Kiss
Aztec Chocolate
Pumpkin Spice
Vanilla
Swiss Almond Coconut

The coconut was my least favorite. Not as much flavor and a bit dry. The Cinnamon Horchata and Peanut Butter were OH YESSS! That means they were delicious. I only wish they offered discounts for buying a dozen ((insert sad face here))

It's now my mission to try the elusive Pink Lemonade cupcake that they always seem to be out of. But seriously, it's just an excuse to keep going back. Don't judge me.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Although these mini cupcakes are very cute due to their daintiness, I have had cupcakes that are much better.  When I got there a little after 4:00 yesterday, there were only three flavors left which was disappointing since I had a groupon for TWO DOZEN that was going to expire in about a month.  Since this place is in the Mission, it isn't the easiest place for me to get to, so I decided to use the groupon up and get it over with.  

I was able to try the double chocolate which was very pungent. The cake was dry on that one.  The salesgirl said the vegan banana flavor was one of her favorites so I picked a couple of those up, too.  I actually thought that one had the best flavor and was very moist from the bananas.  But it was more reminiscent of a muffin, especially since it had a little trickle of glaze on it rather than frosting.  And third flavor I got to try was the peanut butter kiss which was also dry.  At least the frosting on this one was nice and peanutty.  I don't think I would care to go back to buy any more especially at $1 a pop.
author: Jeannette W.

description:
I came last week and ordered half a dozen. They also had a special and I had a dozen more. The flavors were great! Here are my reviews about the ones I tasted:

Mocha-The only one I was kinda "ehh' about. Cake was great (aztec chocolate) because I am NOT a coffee fanatic

Lemon-I'm not a huge lemon fan and their lemon was just right! Not too tart or too plain. 

The aztec chocolate with vanilla frosting is SOOOOOOO yummy!!! 

The blueberries n' cream is also my other fav!

Can't go with bad with red velvet :)

Horchata was interesting. The cake was a tad bit dense, but I'd order it again.

Peanut butter kiss-WOW! order for sure again

ALSO! They use Square which lets you pay with credit card, I signed on the iPad and a text message was sent to me as a receipt...that is tight!
author: Elisa R.

description: Just wanted to say that mission Minis sent me a private message apologizing for my poor experience at their store. I think that says a lot about who their management is and how they value their customers.
author: Tess B.

description:
Love this place for a little cupcake fix. Guilt-free in every way. Lots of flavors, great for meetings.

I came across them at at event last year at Root Division, where they had donated hundreds of cupcakes and staffed a cool event. So I like that they combine their promotions with mission neighborhood organizations.
author: Jay S.

description:
Last night I ran three blocks in the rain to get to your shop by closing... I arrived at 5:45 to a darkened store front (metal gates shut) and a sign for store hours that advertise that the shop closes at 6PM most weekdays. 

NO CUPCAKES FOR ME or for my boyfriend's birthday celebration.

Thank you for ruining my party Mission Minis!!!
author: Andy S.

description: Lemon and Red Velvet are sinfully good.
author: Mike V.

description:
Their Flavors I have tried:
Vegan Banana Maple
Blueberries & Cream
Peanut Butter Kiss
Cinnamon Horchata
Pink Lemonade
Ruby Red Velvet
Meyer Lemon Creme
Aztec Chocolate
Double Chocolate
Swiss Almond Coconut
Classic Vanilla

I love the size of the cupcakes because I love eating small portions.
The Vegan Banana Maple and Blueberries & Cream are definitely my favorite flavors.
In my opinion, they are definitely the most flavorful.
author: Mariel F.

description:
************* REVIEW 237 ****************

The owner & his lovely wife are really nice & wonderful. The location is definitely not my hang out spots! There's no valet parking anywhere, unless I valet @ Foreign Cinema or Medjool, then walk 2 blocks here! 

Ruby Red Velvet - Red velvet cake with classic cream cheese frosting topped with red nonpareils -  my FAV -mini for $1!

Cinnamon Horchata - Horchata cake with classic cream cheese frosting topped with cinnamon dust - flavorful & aromatic - mini for $1!

Classic Vanilla - Classic vanilla bean cake with vanilla bean buttercream topped with colored organic nonpareils - mini for $1!

Seriously what can you get for a buck now beside junk fattening French fries? All cupcakes are made fresh daily & it's only 70 calories per (really who's counting?).

Love the mini cupcakes here & this will be great for party & I'll plan on order it for my BFF up coming party!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
My mom's best friend got her some cake pops from Mission Minis for her birthday; luckily, I was available to sample them.

I've never had a cake pop before...Mission Mini's version looks just like the ones at Starbucks with the pink icing and sprinkles, only quadruple the size.  Shockingly, I wasn't crazy about the chocolate flavor.  The cake, though super-moist, had a strange spicy note that concealed the cocoa.  But the vanilla cake pop was perfection on a stick: super-moist, authentic vanilla taste, and the icing was killer.  Like biting into a piece of heaven.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Surprisingly good.  I got 4 dozen minis and tried almost all the flavors.  I was worried that the cupcakes would be dry as some reviewers had indicated but my minis were moist and delish!  I ordered two days ahead of time and had a specified pick-up time.  

My favorites were the red velvet and lemon minis.  I didn't try all ten flavors but the ones I did try were quiet good.  Both guests and family enjoyed the cupcakes and red velvet definitely got the biggest compliments.  The double chocolate was a tad too chocolaty for me but I think dark chocolates fans will enjoy it.  The blueberries and cream mini had real blueberries within the cake.  Very nice touch!

Another reason to love these mini cupcakes?  The frosting is sweet and buttery but it's not overwhelmingly sweet.  Part of the reason I am not a cupcake fanatic is that I find the frosting disgustingly sweet and sugary.  The frosting on these minis were well balanced, creamy, and had just the right amount of sweetness. 

This move toward mini desserts is awesome.  Minis allow you to try multiple flavors without eating up a storm and putting on those pounds.  It's even better if you can split the mini with someone!
author: Chrys S.

description:
I recently tried their cupcakes and some were better than others.

Blueberries and Creme - a really impressive and unique cupcake - just like a muffin, but instead it's a cupcake (is there really difference besides the frosting?) with a nice creamy Vanilla frosting.

Red Velvet - Not terribly impressive...the cake itself was decent, but I really enjoyed the frosting - a perfect version of cream cheese frosting with just enough sweetness, sourness and creaminess.

Aztec Chocolate - Considering it has a name like that, this was a bit disappointing...the cake was pretty flavorless, the cream frosting did help, though.

Cinnamon Horchata - Wow...a cupcake that really does taste like horchata with all that cinnamon spiciness.  The cream cheese frosting was a perfect topping. 

Classic Vanilla - a great version of the classic flavor.

Overall, I'd say these are good cupcakes...a bit dry, but the ones I enjoyed had some good texture (Blueberries & Crème, Cinnamon Horcata)...stick with the more unique flavors since they are much more impressive.
author: Ken G.

description:
(See pics, a bit dark inside the bar but actually really delicious minis)

Came to enjoy MM at a launch party where I also got to meet the MM maker, Brandon, who handcrafts his cupcakes and was telling a tale of his hard work and devotion. His workmanship is well defined, delicate and detailed. 

The base is not too sugary but the top is creamy and smooth. It gives you just enough to entice you to have 1 more, and seduces you to another one, then a couple more. They are so lovely looking but I could not help but ate them in no time.

Each piece tells a story. 

While it might be more economical to buy a regular size cupcake, it also reminds me a full meal, exercise and sugar rush. MM brings in fluffiness, elegance, the excitement of pursuing another MM and feeling of closeness when sharing a few with the ones you care. It gives you a much greater sense of satisfaction by not dulling the senses.

MM makes a perfect compliment for afternoon tea/coffee or after dinner when you sit with your friends and popping a few delights. 

It changed me from infrequent tasting cupcakes to totally falling in love with the smaller ones.

A side note, as we were leaving the party for a dinner, Brandon was nice enough to give us 2 trays to share with others. This itself earns the extra star for his generosity, especially reading about the running out of cupcakes from the overwhelming coupon responses situation. I don't think it's a business tactic but something he tried hard to accommodate. I would give a little more patience as I await the special bites and pre-order if I can.
author: T L.

description: I never would have discovered this cupcakery had it not been for a Bloomspot coupon. I really enjoyed placing my order online and having it ready for pick-up. I'm still enjoying my 2 dozen mini cupcakes -- about 4 = a nice size regular. I also appreciated being able to order 6 each of 4 flavors: red velvet, peanut butter chocolate, horchata, and vegan banana. Each cake is different, each icing is different. Quite a treat.
author: Leslie K.

description:
it's really out of no where lol!  kind of hard for us to find it.

i came here because i watched Cupcake War on Foodnetwork.  My friends and i went to Anchor Oyster Bar (check this place OMG i love Anchor Oyster bar) and after lunch, we took bus to this place.  

This is a really small cupcake store.  the lady is really nice.  however, their variety has only a few (around 8-10 options).  I bought 2 flavor: red velvet (not sure i spell correctly) and Cinnamon Horchata.  I love these 2!!!!!!!!!!  The topping is yummy!  I thought the icing would taste like the one i bought in Safeway or Ralphs, but I was totally wrong.  The topping is not over sweet, but perfect.  Don't know how to describe the cupcake topping hahaha....

the reason they can't get 5 stars because they only have mini size cupcakes.  mini size is perfect for me, but I kind of want to see the regular size cupcake.

$1 per cupcake (mini size) fair enough!
author: Brandy C.

description: I love their cupcakes. Especially the fact that they're mini. I can devour as many as I please without feeling to guilty lol because they are mini afterallI've tried most of their flavors and I've been beyond satisfied with each one. My favorite is Aztec chocolate and Swizz coconut Yummm!! I'm sooooo happy I live in the area so it's easy for me to walk to. I need as much cardio as possible anyways since I make a regular stop to this place. Then again I don't mind the extra pounds that goes straight to my junk in the trunk lol its a win win woohooooo!! Also as soon as I walk in every time I'm always greeted with a smile and cupcakes of my favor. Great customer service:) soooo I'm happy
author: Stefany L.

description:
Went here for the mini cupcakes due to a bloomspot deal. Although my mom and sister didn't like them ("Better elsewhere") I enjoyed them! (Still not as good as love at first bite's cupcakes in berkeley.) 

I recommend trying all of the ones with sprinkles, because the crunchy texture the sprinkles add to baked goods is programmed in us to like it, friggin a.  Because of the bloomspot deal we were able to get 2 dozen baker's choice. My fave was probably the black cake/white frosting one that resembled a fancy oreo. I tend to like fancy oreos. Also, the peanut butter frosting here is to die for.

I have some remarks about the service though. Sucky that they close for lunch and even though I told them when I was stopping by they were the said state. Thankfully they still let me in since I was whining with my puppy dog eyes at the front door. They were like "Just here for a pick-up?" My reply, "Yes." And then as they placed the two pink boxes stuffed with delicate mission mini's I trampled off.

Sooo IDK, sure you guys deserve a lunch break, but I told you I was stopping by just for an order. I guess thanks for letting me in and all, but foreals if you guys didn't I would've written Bloomspot themselves. So phew for both of us.

Anyway, 3/5 and I shan't return again b/c it's just too troublesome with 'em.
author: Sarah W.

description:
They really are minis and literally just  a single (or two) bite. I think they are the perfect size for parties and gatherings as it lets everyone try a variety of flavors without having to commit to eating a whole normal sized cupcake! 

The taste of the cupcakes itself was ok. It was good, but nothing to go crazy about.

Overall thoughts: I think the mini size are a great idea and at only $1 each it's worth the bite.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Can you say awesome?

I've never been too big a fan of cupcakes, but I can now say that I'm a fan of MINI CUPCAKES!

Yep, bite-size goodies lead to more variety, which leads to a happier me!

And although the idea of bite-size may seem like you are consuming in moderation, I might just have to disagree. 

If I see a cute cupcake truck, I am likely to buy ONE cupcake for myself.

Today I walked away with 5 dozen assorted mini cupcakes (MOST as gifts), but half a dozen already in my yummy. Trust me, the other half will be in my tummy for breakfast tomorrow.

The first red velvet mini cupcake I had wasn't as moist and soft as I wanted it to be. However, the cream filling on top was OH SO SMOOTH, LIGHT, AND DELICIOUS! Every mini cupcake I ate after that was oh so yummy!

This shop is in the mission, where it's borderline sketch. But the shop itself is cute and small, and the girls are friendly!

MINI cupcakes you say??? Mini indeed...

But it's a dangerous game...
author: Elaine H.

description:
Unlike most places, they only have mini cupcakes, priced at a reasonable $1 a pop.   They had 9 flavors (some inventive, some classic) but three were sold out.  The cupcakes are frosted prettily.

Mission Minis cupcakes are easier to find than most.  They were carried by YoCup, Whole Foods, Pirate Cat Radio, Philz, and other places before they opened their retail storefront.  

* Cinnamon horchata:  Mexican rice milk cake with smooth cream cheese frosting and a dusting of cinnamon, I liked the cinnamon and cake but the cream cheese frosting had a slight sour taste that I didn't really like but I never like cream cheese frosting

* Pink lemonade: Loved the Meyer lemon cake (a tiny bit dry though) and lemon zest on top, the thick creamy blackberry buttercream frosting didn't have much blackberry flavor, wasn't too sweet.  I'd love a regular size cupcake with Meyer lemon cake and Meyer lemon buttercream frosting.

* Peanut butter kiss: very good, I like how the Aztec chocolate cake had cinnamon and the pb frosting was thick, smooth, creamy, soft (but it held its shape) and rich

It's a pity there isn't any place to sit but the cupcakes are easy to stroll around with.  Since you can finish one in one or two bites, eating two didn't make me feel guilty at all.

P.S.  They have donuts...but they're not made by them.  They're the vegan kind by People's Donuts of Berkeley.

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description:
First off, parking is ridiculous! Mission Minis is located in this random alley just off Mission and parking is so hard to find. I spent a good twenty minutes looking for parking.

Anyways, once I got parking. I immediately smelled the yummy cupcakes from across the street! Ah I was excited. :) The store is cute! Regular storefront with their cute little cupcakes displayed in a glass display. The man who helped me was super friendly and explained to me what each cupcake was.

I like the fact that they're sanitary as well! There was a customer who came in and asked to use the bathroom and the employee helping me said that they don't let customers use the bathrooms while baking. 

I got half a dozen for my friend's birthday. I ended up getting Aztec Chocolate, Cinnamon Horchata, Red Velvet, Banana Maple Glaze, Vanilla, Banana. I didn't like the fact that they just put them in a box where they eventually got tossed around.

I got half a dozen for my sisters and I as well. I got three red velvets, one Aztec Chocolate, one Cinnamon Horchata and one Vanilla. I can only review the red velvet and the cinammon horchata. The red velvet was such a disappointment! The cream cheese made up for it though. On the other hand, the Cinnamon Horchata was amazing! Ahhh so moist and so good. Love it!

At $1 a pop, I don't think I would indulge in these babies every day but these are definitely a treat!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Cinnamon horchata oh my god. 

I wish they weren't mini because they disappear way too quickly. They're only $1, which may seem cheap, but these bite-sized cupcakes really don't satisfy my intense cupcake cravings. They are literally bite-sized: think 1.5 inches tall and that same length in diameter. 

In addition to the cinnamon horchata (my fav!) both the blueberries and creme and red velvet minis are pretty decent. 

These cupcakes are more muffin-like rather than airy, but I think it's a perfect interpretation of the mini cupcake - a compact little cupcake should have this kind of bang for the buck. That... one buck.

But hey, if anyone I know has a baby anytime soon, mini cupcakes would be insanely cute for a baby shower, no?
author: Colleen M.

description:
I'll take a box of Mission Minis cupcakes over one regular cupcake.  Why?  Your stomach thinks its eating a lot more when really you're not consuming as many calories.

I'm a chocolate addict, but I do like eating the alternatives available at Mission Minis.  If it has coconut (Swiss Almond Coconut) I am all over it.  Cinnamon horchata is like eating the delicious stuff in cupcake form.  It's a mandatory order.  All of the cupcake flavors have really good frosting.  It would be no surprise to find me scraping the box with my finger to get all of the last bits of frosting out.

The bummer part is the small location.  It's hard to find standing room during high traffic days.  Worth it!

I hope Mission Minis expands to have seasonal flavors or a deeper permanent menu selection.  It would give me more reason to visit (as if I don't have enough already).
author: Christine L.

description:
Someone explain this to me - Why aren't all cupcakes mini? Large cupcakes are so awkward - too much cake on the bottom, too much frosting on the top. In order to eat them optimally, you have to deconstruct the cupcake to make a cupcake sandwich. But this can be messy and annoying. 

See this comic for a visual representation: http://www.notquitewrong.com/rosscottinc/comics/2010-03-25-cupcakesandwich.gif

Mini cupcakes, however, provide the perfect balance of cake and frosting. No sandwich-ing necessary! 

Mission Minis makes pretty excellent mini cupcakes ($1 each). I most recently had the Aztec Chocolate. Conclusion: Good, but not as cinnamon-y as I would have liked. My favorite of the one's I've tried is the Pumpkin Spice cupcake. If you're into large cupcakes, you can get them for $3 each, but since I clearly prefer mini, I can't vouch for these.
author: Talia G.

description:
Homegirl, who happens to be a cupcake connoisseur, was raving about Mission Minis so we just had to stop by.


Sadly, they were almost closing by the time we made our way over so a lot of the yummy flavors were sold out. First thoughts upon arrival were "Whoa, it's kinda small in here" and "Oh, I guess that's where the "mini" comes in".  There was a lady behind the counter waiting to take our mini cupcake order, a few girls on the side waiting for their goods and.. us. All the flavors looked super yum but my girl hollered at the vanilla while I, well I decided to go for the cinnamon horchata. Ahhh, party in my mouth. SO yum. We were devouring those little things on our way out (poor minis, they didn't stand a chance) and half way down the block, we decided we had to go back to order more.  So we ran back and got a half dozen more of those bad boys. 

I believe they still have their Groupon deal - $5 for a small coffee and half a dozen cupcakes, which is is crackin' seeing that the cupcakes are a dollar a pop. So holler at that before heading in!
author: Annie C.

description:
So I tried again to pick up my 2 dozen cupcakes with the Townhog coupon and this time I got great service.  The girl who answered the phone was courteous and sent me email confirmation of my order with in minutes of placing the order.  It was raining the day I went to to pick up the cupcakes and I really want to get them and run back to the car (which is parked temporarily in the middle of the street) as quickly as possible.  I'm very happy that they have the boxes ready to go.  

In terms of the cupcakes, I love their frosting but the cupcakes were a little dry.
author: Stacy D.

description:
$1 each for a mini cupcake is an incredible steal, and I love that Mission Minis is committed to keeping their prices reasonable.  

Last weekend I picked up two dozen for a friend's birthday.  Stopped by around 2PM and the majority of the flavors were already sold out, so ended up with:  Aztec Chocolate, Vanilla, Red Velvet, and Banana Maple Glaze.

I found the chocolate to be a perfect bite of wonderfulness and also very much liked the red velvet with cream cheese frosting.  My friends were less enthralled and a few mentioned they were a little dry.  The banana was the least favorite (in both looks and in taste) and now that I've checked the website, I realize that it's vegan.  Yeah, won't be getting that one again.  The vanilla wasn't that great either.

I'd still like to come back again and try some more interesting flavors, such as Cinnamon Horchata and Ginger Carrot.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Word of caution: They sell out fast. Even on a lazy Wednesday afternoon. I'd advise giving them a call even if you're sure you're reading a sign that clearly states "SOLD OUT." Give them a call 'cause chances are, they'll open up their doors and offer at least one flavor.

That's what happened to me today after a grueling treacherous mission (no pun intended) to find this place as I am quite prone to getting lost even to my own home. I finally found the correct address, parked and lo and behold, the "SOLD OUT" sign was propped up on the door mocking me. 

To make the best of this trip, I did a little grocery shopping and found that the shop opened it's doors again just 15 minutes later. Joy! They only had one flavor available-the red velvet but I truly believe a good cupcake shop should make a good signature red velvet or they're not worth their weight in batter. I appreciated the size and the easy price tag of only $1 for the 3 bite cupcake. 

The cream cheese frosting was really spot on in comparison to other cupcake bakeries in San Francisco. +1. And even if you don't like their cupcakes, you don't waste $4 like other cupcake joints or $2.50 for other places mini creations just to find you wasted $2.50 for something you don't like. The red velvet cake itself was light, slightly chocolatey and had a good thick texture to it. I didn't get an angel food feel out of it and the frosting to cake ratio was just right. 

My only wish is that I had gotten there earlier so I could have tried their other flavors but I'm one of the lucky kids who got a 2 for 1 groupon so I'll definitely be making an advanced order for later this month. Mission Minis is gonna get some new fans once I bring these babies to work!
author: Jessica K.

description:
Bumped up a star just for having some creative flavors :) 

I actually came here last month for their Grand Opening Valentines Day event. They were giving out free samples and other goodies (ie. samples from pizza hacker and creme brûlée cart). It was a pretty long line to get in and a pretty small space inside. All of their flavors were up on a cupcake tower. We couldn't really try all the flavors because the line had to keep moving. Plus, we weren't sure if there was a limit to how many we could grab lol. I would feel guilty if I took one of each flavor, especially since the people behind us were just staring like they were itching to say "you're holding up the line!" lol.

In the end, only got to try their red velvet which just okay. I recently got to try their cinnamon horchata flavor though. I was at Philz Coffee on 24th and they sold 'em there. Loved it!!  Very good flavor!

I plan to go back to mission minis and maybe get an assorted dozen (if that's possible). FYI - these little cupcakes are $1/ea

Follow 'em on Twitter! They're a great follow!  That's how I heard about Mission Minis. :)
author: jesiree b.

description:
I first found Mission Minis sometime earlier this year and since then every time I make it out to the city I try to stop by. They have the traditional flavors as well as some really unique flavors. I love their HORCHATA  cupcake!!! It's just really good. I highly recommend it to everyone that stops by. The mini's are the next best thing to a cupcake, small, figure friendly ;) and just right if you want to taste different flavors! 

Their staff are always nice and friendly. Brandon their owner is also a pretty cool guy! Another random outing with some friends we stopped by and were talking to him-and started to talk about an upcoming Johnny Cupcakes event (i absolutely love all things related to cupcakes! and if you do too, you definitely need to become a fan of JC!=) Anyways, low and behold Brandon knew JC from back in the day and to make a long story short I delivered some Minis to JC himself the night of the event.

Back to the review- Trust meeee. I've had my share of cupcakes all over, and Mission Minis is definitely a spot to add onto your SF food and dessert tour! Happy cupcaking! =)
author: Remy-Anne V.

description:
I cheated and got the Groupon for 2 dozen minis for $11. I know...how could one 93 pound woman eat 24 cupcakes? Not sure, but I did it. 

I placed my ordered within the 48 hour time frame via email and BAM! The cutest 24 cupcakes you could ever imagine were tucked neatly in a white box to show off its delectableness. Pick up was easy. Didn't have to bother with lines. Just brought my receipt and gave it to the employee (who was super nice). My taste buds were flaming when I peeked inside to see my choices: Swiss Almond Coconut, Ruby Red Velvet, Cinnamon Horchata Aztec Chocolate, Banana Maple Glaze, Classic Vanilla, Ginger Carrot and Peanut Butter Kiss. The best ones were the Peanut Butter Kiss and the Red Velvet. 

These minis are great for parties or something to enjoy during happy hour or dinner w/ friends. A little goes a long way. Just the right amount and easy to enjoy!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Dear Mission Minis,

I really, really want to like you.  I came in today, and was greeted by the friendliest person ever.  5 star service.  He even told me that some things weren't on the selection board, and you always feel a little bit special when you get in on the "off the menu secret stuff".

Your pink lemonade was actually pretty tasty, and the cupcakes have a good density and texture.  Better selection today, too.

But damn, son!  You are KILLING ME with the cream cheese frosting.* 

Love, 
Alice 

*and not in the good, artery clogging Mission Dog kinda way.
author: Alice C.

description:
My friend bought a groupon-like deal for two dozens and so kindly gave me one (thank you!). I'm such a lucky girl to have friends who fill me up with one of my favorite things ever: SUGAR!

We picked up the two dozen and then rearranged each box to have every flavor since they were assorted. The women at the store warned us that the box was not very sturdy and if you pushed up on the bottom, they would collapse. Since we had several other places to go throughout the day, the box was bound to bounce around in the car and they did! They toppled over and created such a mess. Not one to waste sugar, I ate them w/a fork when I got home anyway! :) 

I thought the cupcakes were just average. I guess what I couldn't understand is how a mini cupcake isn't moist? The best flavor was what I think was carrot (once they were in the box toppled over, I just couldn't decipher what was what at that point) but it wasn't great. I didnt find anything here to be memorable or worth coming back to try out.
author: Stella C.

description:
Am I the only one who doesn't like these!? Had a whole box of these at my office yesterday.
The cinnamon horchata was soooo dry, not to mention there was so much cinnamon sprinkled on top that I coughed and choked on it.
The red velvet was pretty moist, but it DID NOT taste like red velvet. It had this strange, synthetic, chemical-ish after taste. NO BUENO.

Sorry Mission Minis, I really wanted to like you but i'm going to stick with Kara's, they have been consistently good.
author: Susy C.

description: Tried them again.  Gotta work on quality control bc some were on the dry side.  What missed the mark this time were the Aztec Chocolate and Red Velvet.  What shined were the Lemon Meyer and Horchata.  Calling in to order and picking up was a breeze.  They are on Groupon too!
author: amee m.

description:
another cupcake place I visited during my cupcake crawl.

I wanted to get here early morning when the cupcakes are freshly baked.
parking was a bit hard to find but its the mission so I'm used to it.

Place: cute, clean and not too fancy.  I don't remember seeing chairs.

service:  good.  the guy was very helpful and accommodating, he described all the flavors and answered my question: except that he told me all the chocolate cupcakes has cinnamon.  I specifically told him I can't have cinnamon. however I tasted their peanut butter cupcake and there's not cinnamon in it at all.

cupcakes:  they're cute. lots of flavor varieties. i bought pumpkin, red velvet, vanilla, choc peanut butter, choc/choc, horchata, and pink lemonade.  peanut butter was good, red velvet frosting was good, pumpkin was ok, pink lemonade needs more kick to it. 
One thing I noticed: all the cupcakes are dry... I guess it's the catch with baking small cakes.  

I've tried lots of cupcake places around the bay.  this is not on my top list.
author: Learnee L.

description:
Size doesn't matter. (At least thats what your mom probably told you.)

I tried a mission mini at Mortys. And... well, sometimes size does matter. 

They're good, because even a bad cupcake is a good cupcake, because its a cupcake and I'll take it any way I can get it.

But if I were drunk on friday, and lonely, this cupcake wouldn't be on my drunk text list.
author: Emily D.

description:
So I got a deal from aaa for 12 minis for 5.70 and I went in to pick them up today and the minis are delish but I had to give a low
Rating because at 3.00 for a regular size cupcake way over prices. I'll stick to Safeway for my cupcakes
author: iron s.

description: They not only have wonderful cupcakes, but wonderful staff as well. I came in to claim a prize I had won, from their facebook photo number guessing contest, and I ended up getting more than I expected. They were so incredibly friendly about it and just all around super chill. I felt like I was coming in to say hi to friends and got cupcakes out of it. Love it!
author: Mia A.

description:
This place is SO cute!!! 

Because they're mini's, it makes me want to buy one even more. They're only $1, and if you want to explore flavors, get 2!! Why not, since a single normal cupcake is around $2 to $4 anyway.

I got the Aztec Chocolate, and it was pretty good! I kind of wished I got the peanut butter one though, since I like pb so much. :D
author: Jeanette S.

description:
In addition to the cupcakes being super delicious, I was really impressed with the customer service. They made it so easy for me to place a large order and pick them up quickly. I even paid over the phone as to make it easier on my niece that I conned into making the delivery for me. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Janine H.

description:
I wanted to be blown away by these cupcakes. I bought a groupon for a half dozen and a small coffee for $5 and happily took myself to this place on BART to pick up my treats. Unfortunately when I got there (2pm) they were sold out of everything except like 5 dried out cupcakes? Hmph. If you are open until later, how can you sell out? Mind you, there are trays of "orders" just staring at me from the back. SIGH.
At first she tried to tell me that I had to order 2 days in advance.. I had to tell her I got a groupon NOW deal meaning I had to show up between 12 and 4. I guess that meant get the leftovers. :(

I trek back to work and open my half closed box to see most of the cakes toppled over. I dip in to to taste the pumpkin spice one (or was it ginger spice). I couldn't tell because it didnt taste like either. It was just dry but the lemony topping was good. 

The reason they get a three stars is because the woman working the register gave me a couple extra because they ran out of coffee. That was sweet.

Otherwise, this hole in the wall needs to get it together. Otherwise most people I guess will just order in advance.

I doubt I will be back. I know Cako is closer and will probably frequent them instead.
author: Gina H.

description:
on the rictor scale of 4.5

I HEART EVERYTHING MINI...

Truly, I will consider this place one of my many cute secret treasure of the mission district. You ask youself... "Why mini?" Shoot,  Why not! I couldn't decide and I didnt want to just pick one. One isn't enough to expose this place to yelp. Therefore i ordered 3 dozen mini cupcakes.

THE AROMA OF 3 DOZEN FRESH GOODIES IN MY FACE, KNOCKED MY 5 SENSES OUT AND GAVE BIRTH TO THE SIXTH.... i see(feel/smell/hear/taste) cupcakes. CUPCAKES.

I wanted to go different from the typical vanilla, chocolate, and red velvet. SO i went different. 

1) BANANA MAPLE GLAZE- I think by far this has stole my heart. Maybe because I love banana bread and it had a similar texture and taste. And the maple glaze on top, WOW. Imagine the maple glaze on a donut... similar but ligher. And the maple glaze had a design on the cupcake and not just dumped ontop. I LOVED THIS ONE.

2)  PINK LEMONADE - first thought, you'd think sweet and sour at the same time. lies! the batter has a light lemon zest taste and the pink frosting ontop was absolutely perfect. the combination of both as it enters your palate gives you the taste of a pink lemonade... of course, in the shape and form of a min cupcake!

3) SWISS ALMOND COCONUT - people either love coconut or hate coconut. well, this is quite a taste little treat. it was the best looking of the three that i chose only because the decor was cute. tiny cupcake, with light creamly looking frosting, and shaved almonds on top. it tasted pretty good too, light tasting., nothing like biting into an almond joy candy bar or anything of that nature. 

I liked my mini's so much, I got another batch. And I plan on going back this week to get me yet another dozen. My orders are placed in these cute little pink boxes. AH! And when you open them, the mini cupcakes are just standing there peacefully. I opened the box and raped them with my eyes... then I indulged! Sick? I know, right!!!!


Price - affordable
Portion - mini but perfect
Taste - orgasmic

Will I be back? YES YES AND TRIPLE YES

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: Love their tiny cupcakes:) They are super cute. Good for both sweet and non-sweet lovers* The cream on their cupcakes are very fresh! I recommend you to try coconut cupcake:)
author: Maitai N.

description: Got 3 dozen - day-of order - for my wife's birthday. Got great reviews all around!
author: Ches W.

description:
Walking along Mission Street during Carnaval I saw Mission Minis in cart and had to try them.  They also have a store front.

I got Ginger Carrot & Ruby Red Velvet for $1 ea.  Pickup $1/ea or $11/doz.  For delivery $15/doz- 2 doz minimum select neighborhoods.  They are tiny cupcakes, maybe 2-3 bites each.

I thought they were ok, nothing special about them.

Website here:
http://missionminis.com/index.php

3168 22nd St Betwn Mission & Capp
author: Ann L.

description: One of the cutest bakeries ever. Oh look, i have a dollar! oh look, those cupcakes are a dollar! See where I'm going??! I can probably eat myself to death of the swiss almond coconut, but the red velvet and horchata are delicious too. I mean, buy a dozen, they're a dollar!
author: amanda k.

description: Amazing. Took advantage of a groupon deal. Ordered the almond coconut, pumpkin spice, and chocolate peanut butter oh and the gluten free chocolate. Loved them all!! My favorite was the chocolate peanut butter and the gluten free was sooo moist and flavorful, you wouldn't think twice that it didn't contain gluten. 3 thumbs up for Mission minis!!
author: Betsy S.

description:
I've previously had the mini cupcakes from here. To be frank, the Swiss Almond Coconut was not the best. The frosting tasted like pure whipped butter - but perhaps that's the flavor profile they were going for? I'm not a huge Paula Deen fan, so these were not my cup of tea. 

If the cupcake being a little too rich was their only shortcoming I would have left it at 3 stars but I found their customer service to be lacking and poor. I purchased a Groupon to buy some mini cupcakes for a party. I called 48 hours in advance to place the order but told they were full for the entire day I needed to pick them up. I understand that they may receive many advance orders BUT they apparently weren't full if I wanted to pay full price and not use the Groupon. This leads me to my final question - why participate in a Groupon if you don't intend to honor the deal?

Thoroughly disappointed but I'm sure my arteries thank me.
author: Aprajita Y.

description:
I mentally prepped myself for terrible service that I read on Yelp, but I think that was an anomaly post-groupon/St. Patty's-day-rush. 

I called up on a Friday 48 hours before pick up, service was friendly, and I was sent an e-receipt (note: boo...they forgot to give me vanilla). And all of their cupcake flavors were in full supply when I went to the store, so if you want to just stop by one day and pick some up, that might be a good alternative than preordering (which requires 48 hours notice).

The cupcakes themselves were just NOT good. I didn't like the flavor of the horchata, the chocolate-peanut butter was kind of dry. After taking a bite into the banana and being completely underwhelmed, I didn't even have any desire to try the plain chocolate. I guess the saving grace was that I liked licking off the peanut butter and cream cheese frostings, but I don't think I can afford that at $1 a pop. (They're REALLY  tiny by the way! Probably 3 would fit in my mouth at one time)
author: Jess C.

description:
Recently purchased some mini cupcakes for a family holiday. Some of the cupcakes were really good, but most of the flavors were unfortunately pretty dry. We tried each of the flavors, but didn't finish them because of the dryness.

The people at the shop were all really nice, but the cupcakes honestly just weren't that great. Some of the flavors (like the horchata) had real potential, and I would be willing to try them again as full-sized cupcakes. But as they stand, I probably wouldn't make the trek all the way down to 22nd Street for them.
author: Geno B.

description:
How does this place get an overall rating of 4 stars?

Got two dozen cupcakes from my best friend for my birthday -- all flavors - YUM!

The red velvet frosting is amazing..their frosting is just amazing, but unfortunately, the CAKE...needs some work!  Not moist and delicious at all... taste like day old cake, disappointing....and for $1 each? Unless you have some sort of Groupon (which I heard they couldn't even honor all of them) I'd say pass and drive your butt to Sprinkles..YUM YUM.
author: Melody T.

description:
Went to their grand opening yesterday. The cupcakes were yummy. I tried almost every flavor. (i probably wasn't supposed to). I got 2 bites out of their cupcakes. 

I love their Horchata and pumpkin spice cupcakes. I believe that most, if not all their frostings are made of cream cheese. I love that. The cake is moist and does not crumble. Too bad they aren't regular sized, but that's also good too or else i'd be eating a bit too much. All the flavors were good, can't go wrong with any flavor.

I think you have to pre-order them, dozen/$15. Free Delivery for orders over $25.
author: Leanne K.

description:
Came here twice in the last 2 weeks and both times they were out of the "pink lemonade" cupcake..so sad..=( 

The best thing about this price is the $1 per mini-cupcake. I can eat 4 different which would = to 1 cupcake if I got it from somewhere else. 

The bad thing is the cupcakes were just okay. Nothing really stood out. Don't think I will be back unless I was in the neighborhood.
author: James L.

description:
I had these at an event and liked them. They are much better quality than your average cupcakes, just a bit too much cream. The only turn off about these cupcakes were the price. 

These cupcakes are the size of a quarter and they wanted much more than that just for one. At this price I would rather buy a regular size cupcake.
author: M C.

description:
Cute. Cute. Cute.

I've never seen mini cupcakes before, so of course the first thing I thought was cute! They were all so tiny sitting one by one next to each other in their clear display case! There were rows and rows of them, I wanted to just grab a handful and engulf them all...heehee. 

It was a small shop with just enough to fit about four to five ppl. The guy that helped us was really friendly. Each mini cupcake was $1 each. On their flavors board was a total of 10 different flavors. I wanted to try them all but they were sold outta Classic Vanilla, Pink Lemonade, and Ginger Carrot for the day. So, I got two of the rest of the seven flavors. 

Pumpkin Spice: Just as if I was biting into a pumpkin pie but without the pie crust. It had just the right amount of cinnamon spice to it and the frosting on top was light. However, I'm not the biggest of pumpkin fans...so 4 stars.

Ruby Red Velvet: The cupcake itself was good, the cream cheese frosting was a bit to heavy to my taste and a little bit too thick too. 3 1/2 stars.

Swiss Almond Coconut: Oooo...this one was yummy...it had strings of coconut on top of the buttercream frosting and the cupcake itself was tasty. 5 stars.

Cinnamon Horchata: Very cinnamon-like. Not too sweet. Reminds of of biting into a cinnamon bun. 4 1/2 stars.

Peanut Butter Kiss: Very strong in smell and taste of peanut butter. As I bit into the peanut butter frosting, it was way too creamy and sweet. It felt like as if was taking a spoonful of just peanut butter in my mouth. It was too rich that it overwhelmed the taste of the cupcake itself. Definitely not my fave. 2 stars.

Banana Maple Glaze: Mmmm...this one was good. Everything was equally balanced. The smell of banana from the cupcake was very inviting...the maple glaze was awesome too. 5 stars.

Aztec Chocolate: A little bit on the sweet side but not bad. Chocolate frosting on a chocolate cupcake...it also a great traditional combination. 4 stars. 

The presentation of these minis are definitely worth lotsa brownie points. The taste of all the cupcakes are quite variable. It's like they hit some and miss some. I guess it was a good idea to try most of them to know what to stick with and what to stay away from for future reference. I am a bit disappointed I didn't get to try their Pink Lemonade, b/c I have heard great things about it. Maybe next time...=)
author: Winnie L.

description: Adorable little shop with even more adorable little cupcakes. At only $1 a pop, you really can buy every flavor without feeling guilty. All of them were fresh and moist, though my favorites were the red velvet, the cinnamon horchata, and the peanut butter kiss. I especially loved how the different flavored frostings paired real well with the different cakes. The guy was even nice enough to give me a free one to complete my to-go box.
author: Lily A.

description:
My cousin tried to take advantage of the groupon deal for 2 dozen minis for $11. I kinda feel bad for Mission Minis because I think they were pretty slammed with the response they got. Unfortunately they were not able to fulfill any orders over the St. Patrick's Day weekend (when the groupon deal occurred) so we had to wait until after the weekend to get our order. However, my cousin was able to get some for Tuesday so we quickly forgot about the delay and got excited at the prospect of after dinner sampling festivities! 

We cut a set of the cupcakes in half so we could sample and talk about our reactions. We agreed that presentation-wise, the cupcakes are too damn cute. So cute in fact that all you want to do is just take pictures and post them all over yelp or facebook (See my pics). However the flavor was a different story. Disappointing is the word that comes to mind; what the cupcakes had going for it in presentation, they lacked in taste. The creme toppings were inconsistent often too sweet and the cake was very dry and crumbly.

Swiss almond coconut: nice creme, coconut shavings gave good balance, cake was typical vanilla.

Ruby red velvet: nothing made it taste specifically like a red velvet at all. The aftertaste was also a bit weird and artificial.

Cinnamon horchata: the cake was very moist but the creme was way too sweet. Too much cinnamon sprinkled on that added to the poor result.

Aztec chocolate: the cake and creme were not too sweet but the cake was very crumbly. It didn't hold together after being cut in half so I had to use a fork to get the pieces into my mouth.

Pink lemonade: lemony taste was perfect but the creme was too sweet. Another dry cake.

Banana maple glaze: very delicious and moist cake that didn't fall apart. The creme unfortunately was way too sweet. 

Classic vanilla: nothing special about this cupcake even though the cake, on the crumbly side, and the creme were not too sweet. Feels like I could have made this at home.

Ginger carrot: my favorite. Love the balance of ginger and carrot flavor. The cake was perfect and the creme, though slightly on the sweet side, was very good.

Peanut butter kiss: My second favorite though the creme was way too sweet. I think I tolerated that because I expected this flavor to be on the sweet side anyway. 

I can't be too disappointed because we got a great deal through groupon. Otherwise I don't think I'd spend the amount it regularly costs to get cupcakes from here. Hit and miss cupcakes at the end of the day.
author: Dawn L.

description:
Amazingly moist yummy cupcakes. I'll never tire of Mission Mini's! Had them at first at an event at the SF Winery on Treasure Island and have been hooked since! 

Brandon and his team are super-friendly, and the cupcakes are yum. So can they please consider opening a location in Alameda? 

Thank you!!!
author: Natasha M.

description:
Been meaning to write a review about this place for a while.  Ordered cupcakes for my sister's birthday about 1 1/2 years ago. Prepaid for them about 3-4 weeks in advance and ordered every flavor her little heart desired.  So the day I went in to pick them up I thought it would be quick and easy considering I ordered AND paid like I said 3-4 weeks ahead of time.

Nope.  Walk in; the worker there tells me they ran out of about 3-4 of the cupcakes that I had pre-ordered.  I ask why wouldn't my order be completely fulfilled if I prepaid for them weeks ago.  He tells me they can't deny their customers who come in to buy cupcakes for the day.  So apparently I'm not considered a customer nor does me pre-ordering and pre-paying mean anything to them other than the fact that they got some extra cash in their pockets.  He wasn't pleasant in any kind of way, was definitely NOT apologetic about my order going awry.  I just picked out some cupcakes that I already had just to fulfill my order and get the f*&k out of that place before I murdered someone's face off.  

I emailed the owner the day after, he said he was sorry but don't believe that he understands how frustrating it was to pre-order and pre-pay for something I never actually received.  Didn't suffice for me and have NEVER and will NEVER go back to this place.  

Plus I've had much better tasting cupcakes, not really that creative either other than the fact that they're mini.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Pretty good cupcakes. They offer flavors you can get nowhere else, which is either a plus or a minus, depending on whether you like things like horchata, Mexican chocolate (with cinnamon) etc. They also offer the traditional standards -- vanilla, etc. All of their cupcakes are miniature, which I personally love since it lets you try out various flavors without pigging out. I've been here a few times to get a representative sampling, and I'd say the cupcakes are decent, if occasionally a bit dry. They also seem to be the only cupcake option anywhere around this part of the city (the Mission); most of the city's cupcake options are clustered in the Marina, so if you're hankering for a cupcake and don't want to head all the way north, this is a possibility.
author: Kathryn M.

description: I love Cupcake Wars, so I had to check out this bakery! -They were on a competition baking show. The location wasn't the best. It seems like a rough part of SF, but the shop was nice. The staff was really friendly. They answered all of my questions about the show. Their cupcakes are only a dollar and very tiny, so you can enjoy multiple flavored without breaking the bank! The red velvet had the best cream cheese frosting ever! The chocolate frosting was not the best I've had. Overall, a good experience.
author: Ketti R.

description:
Got two dozen along with the Groupon deal a while back.  Meh.  I tired of them within the first few bites, and just wanted to pawn them off on coworkers.

Overall: some are good, others I wouldn't waste a dollar on. Maybe it's the size, but they are denser and drier than regular sized cupcakes. Much less fluffy.  Save your money and make your own cupcakes, they'll taste better.

The better ones: ruby red velvet, aztec choco, banana maple, ginger carrot, and peanut butter kiss.  But even these were mediocre, as I said.  

The weakest of the weak: cinnamon horchata tastes just like ginger carrot. Pink lemonade just tastes like (bland) lemon cake. Banana maple isn't anything special (just frosted banana bread).
author: Chris A.

description:
I teeter between 3 & 4 stars...some cupcakes are a 3 & others a 4. 

Those that are a 3:
Cinnamon Horchata - unique flavor but the cake is too dense *until you read that it's Mexican rice milk cake so not the norm. I'd like the cream cheese icing to have a dash of cinnamon blended in & a light sprinkling of cinnamon on top...then I think it'd be a 4

Aztec Chocolate - good but lacking in the flavor punch. Nice consistency and the vanilla bean buttercream icing was good

Those that are a 4:
