Banana Maple Glaze - it's vegan. I was surprised at its richness. Banana flavor is apparent the icing is dense (it didn't move) as it's a pure maple syrup glaze. It was delicious. Each component - the banana cake to the maple icing - shone thru on its own and when put together it's a great combo.

Peanut Butter Kiss - my fave! The Aztec chocolate cake (same used in Aztec Chocolate cupcake) is light & moist but when paired with the peanut buttercream (oh yeah, baby!) the dark chocolate develops more flavor. The buttercream was whipped nicely with lots of peanut butter flavor. Mine was lacking the colored organic sprinkles the description states but I didn't mind...I'd rather have it without for the purity factor.

$1 each
author: Marissa H.

description:
These tiny decadent cupcakes were so sweet and delicious! I must've popped like 5 of the red velvet ones into my mouth consecutively in a span of 10  minutes! *nom nom nom*

My cousin and her now husband bought a bunch of these for their wedding dessert reception and one look at these little babies and I fell in love! They were so cute! Hehe....everyone knows girls go gaga over cupcakes these days!

They got the pink lemonade, classic vanilla, and ruby red velvet ones. I only tried the red velvet one. If I was ever in the mood for some cute cupcakes, I'd go there and load up on a bunch of them!
author: V M.

description: This rating is just because they don't answer their phones during posted hours. Slow to respond to messages too. But the cupcakes are delicious. If only they would stop using plastic adornments on these minis. I've had friends pop a mini in their mouth and swallow before realizing the garnish in top was plastic.
author: Cathy N.

description: The best place to get mini cupcakes in the city and each mini is only $1! You can't go wrong! Aztec Chocolate is my fave and I've heard the Horchata is pretty good too. I also had the Swiss Almond one and it was just alright.
author: Fallon P.

description: We called to reserve cupcakes this morning and when we went to pick them up nothing was reserved! These guys suck! I am never coming back!
author: K V.

description:
Dear vanilla chai mini cupcake, 

You owned me today for all 2 bites of you.  We could be lovers if only white chocolate didn't exist.  Add some of that and we could get hitched.

(Thanks, Mr.K for the treat at work.)
author: Athena S.

description:
Was able to sample two Mission Mini cupcakes thanks to my friends at Whole Foods Market Franklin. 

The Cinnamon Horchata with classic cream cheese frosting was interesting - loved the cinnamon flavor on top. This cupcake reminded me of thanksgiving.

I was most excited to try the Swiss Almond Coconut (coconut + almonds = my FAVORITE). I was disappointed and found the cake to be dry and not  flavorful.  I still loved the sliced almond and shredded coconut topping and ended up just tossing the cake for the frosting ;)

The presentation of the cupcakes is PERFECT - they are just SO cute! If only they tasted  as sweet as they looked. I'm not a huge "cupcake person" (would much prefer a french macaroon!) but would vote for Kara's or Moonbaby cakes over Mission minis in a second. Going to give them another try eventually - maybe I just caught them on a "dry day"? I'll be back to taste the classic vanilla and the Meyer lemon creme.... but till then I'm saving my calories for a french almond macaroon!
author: Caroline J.

description: Props to mission mini's for trying out new flavors. I got there an hour before closing so there weren't many options left. I got 2 red velvets ($1) and 2 honey lavender($2 each) and left. The red velvets were fine, nothing to write home about. The honey lavender were really good though a little dry. I'm willing to blame that on being out all day, though. Really disappointed I didn't get to try the horchata cupcakes, but oh well. I'd definitely go back if I wanted something out of the ordinary.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I purchased a coupon through Homerun.com to try these mini-cupcakes.  It was painless ordering what I want through the internet and then picking it up at the appointed time.  

There were lots of flavors to choose from.  My order was nicely boxed and ready for pick-up when I arrived at the business. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.  I love the Red Velvet, and Blueberries 'n Cream cupcakes .  These were moist.  A few were on the dry side (sorry, can't recall which ones).
author: Nanette L.

description: What a find! Needed to bring a birthday dessert to a party and Mission Minis was recommended to me by a friend. Got to taste a few and the cupcakes were a hit. Great service too.
author: Nicole O.

description:
On a day date with my love. He treated me to try all the flavors (we shared of course)! They were only OK :(

No flavor explosions from the bitty bite sized morsels. I've driven by Mission Minis several times hoping to find parking so I can go in and try. Finally got the chance and got my hopes up too high...
author: Candy R.

description: While their service was very good and the girl behind the counter was friendly, I ordered 4 dozen minis for our holiday party and they were very dry and not very tasty.  I wanted to be excited, but they were not good quality.  Much better cupcakes all over the city!
author: A A.

description:
My sister bought an entire assortment of minis to a gathering and each one we tried was very dry. Not a little dry, but very very very dry. I'm pretty tolerant when it comes to certain things, but these were so dry that I couldnt even continue eating them. I thought maybe the one I tried was from a bad batch, but I literally took a bite out of 3 different ones and each one was the same. It's a shame that we had to throw it all away because they were really cute.

Perhaps it was a bad day. I'll update if I try this place again.
author: M W.

description:
I was so excited to try all these assorted mini cupcakes. But it quickly turned into disappointment. I tried Almond Coconut, Double Chocolate, Aztec Chocolate & Ruby Red Velvet all were dry, not moist at all anywhere.

Happy to report at least 1 cupcake was good. It was the Blueberries & Cream.

I wish I could give half a star because after eating 5 cupcakes & only having 1 taste good is not enough for me to come back for more.
author: Donna D.

description:
I was on a mission to find the most affordable mini cupcakes in the city for my birthday boy.

It may sound silly, but when most bakeries are charging $2-4 per cupcake it becomes a mission!

Enter Mission Mini *ding ding!* where I bought 24 mini cupcakes for 24 dollars. An enticing variety of unique flavors, not-too-sweet frosting, and the fluffiest little bites for your taste buds, these cupcakes were a hit at the boy's party!

He raved about the Peanut Butter Kiss bite and I savored the Banana Maple.

I really wanted to try the Cinnamon Horchata, but those were snatched up quickly at the party...my only alternative? A return mission to Mission Mini!
author: Karen L.

description:
For my department March Cupcake/Snack break, I bought sets of mini-cupcakes from both Mission Minis and Cups and Cakes.  I got LUKEWARM reception from my colleagues for both bakeries.  In my OCD hunt for MY IDEAL cupcake, I must say that Mission Minis did not take the prize.

Yet, here are some great things for me to note about my experience here:
-Good Flavor Selection
-Very Nice Staff
-Option to order in advance 
-Packaged and handled with CARE!
-Parking is pretty available for this area
-Some of the icings are not too sweet (yay!)
-Price for minis and a full order is reasonable compared to other  "gourmet" bakeries

Yet, here are some reasons why I could not give them my 5 out of 5 stars:
-Some of the cakes that I tried were not really moist (I prefer moist cake - specifically, I tried the PEANUT butter cupcake, which I guess it makes sense to be on the drier side, but I needed a HUGE glass of soy milk to swallow that mini)
-some of the icings were WAY too SUGARY (the buttercream was PERFECT, but the other 2 that I tried, too rich and too sugary)

There is a little more left to be desired, but Mission Mini's provides a good, reasonably priced option if you need a cupcake fix and are in the Mission District.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
So unprofessional!! My fiance ordered a dozen red velvet cupcakes + a dozen red roses to be delivered to me on Valentine's Day. 

But first, they lost his order and had to call him back for the details. 

Then, they never arrived at all! 

And on top of that, it wasn't until HE called THEM to ask what happened that they apologized and offered a refund.
author: Yuffie G.

description:
I really wanted to love them! sadly.. I didn't.  I've met the owner/bakers of Mission mini at a yelp party and they are super nice. However, each time I've gotten their cupcakes has been a bit of a disappointment.  I remember trying them at the party and thinking they are pretty wonderfuL! However, each time my friend or I got them, they haven't been so great.

They have some great flavors, but every single time I've had them, the cake has been too dry!  They are so cute and danty and lovely to look at, but the taste is always a little off.   Too dry, and the frosting was always a bit hard. 

The same week that we got Mission Minis, we also had Cups and Cakese and their cupcake is more moist. 

In regards to the groupon we had, it was disappointing that Missioin Minis doesn't make extra when they know their groupon is expiring. Most flavors were gone by the time we got there at 3 pm (the day before the groupon expired) ~ and they stop taking pre-orders after they hit a certain amount ~  

Overall, I probably would get it again, only with a groupon. I doubt I want to pay the $1 a piece for less then two bites.
author: Kp P.

description:
If you just want a bite of dessert after your heavy lunch around the Mission, go to Mission Minis for that mini cupcake bite for $1 each.  Way to go about portion control.  I love the banana maple (vegan) and the cinnamon horchata flavors.  

They were closing up shop when my friend and I got here and they had semi-day old surplus cupcakes that they were giving away for... $FREE.99!!!!  They were gracious enough to give us a dozen each, which I brought home to my little nephews and they loved how they can hold each cupcake with their little hands.

Support their deliciousness!

=8)
author: Grace M.

description:
So many things went well at Mission Minis. I discovered them through a Groupon Now! offer, and they were more than accommodating.
The shop is very small, quaint and smells of sinful sugary delights. I really loved that with this Groupon I got to choose six mini cupcakes AND take home a made to order cup of coffee! 
I chose two of each: horchata, red velvet, and chocolate peanut butter. I made the mistake of bringing them in to work and could only grab one red velvet before risking getting my hand bitten off by some very hungry teachers. 
I loved the frosting above all, but the cake itself was moist, rich and perfect flavor. I'll be back Mission Minis!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Haven't ever been in the shop but have had them brought home to me...cuz I'm special that way hahaha ;0)

My favorite cupcake is the Cinnamon Horchata...loves it!!  I've also tried the Red Velvet, the Vanilla, and the Pumpkin Spice.  Some of them can be a little dry so was a bit disappointing but the Horchata has always been perfect!!

I'll keep coming to try their new flavors because they're in the neighborhood, but still prefer Sibby's in San Mateo.
author: Ninja H.

description:
I just picked up my red velvet cupcakes from a promotion from Gilt city. 
Can I say, uh-mazing! 
This little teeny place on the Mission is worth the trip. You can miss it completely if you're not looking for it.  I've tried every cupcake joint in the city and they are either too dry or the cream cheese frosting was just not up to par. But you will not regret this cupcake place!  A must try! 
Run, don't walk (running will make up for the calories too:)
author: Ny H.

description: Placed an order for my wedding rehearsal dinner. They were an absolute hit. I ordered three dozen mixed variety. Everyone loved having the choice of selecting a few options. They were delicious, moist and not overly sweet. I would definitely suggest placing an order here for these delicious sinful little treats.
author: Ronette B.

description: I love Mission-minis because it's NOT frou-frou.  I'm so sick of some of these frou-frou bakery's popping up every where.  Mission-Minis is just a cute little neighborhood place.  I get their cupcakes for my son's birthdays and other special occasions. Red Velvet is my son's favorite.  Oh and you can't get better price anywhere.  I've seen mini cupcakes sold for $2 each, elsewhere!  Not here!  Here, it's only $1 each.
author: Aban E.

description:
I went to the SF Cupcake Challenge and tried their cupcakes here.

They offered 2 cupcake options, I usually only tried one:
- PB&J -- The frosting of this one was great. It was more on the peanut butter side, not heavy or airy like other frostings. I don't think my cupcake had enough jam though.
- Pumpkin Spice

The owners were nice and a pleasure to talk to.
author: Anisha G.

description: Who doesn't love mini cupcakes?? Good quality cupcakes that come in a little pink box and a nice variety of flavors.
author: Maayan S.

description: I love these cupcakes! The cake is perfectly moist and the frosting is not too sweet. When I was living in the Mission I would drop by every weekend and get a half dozen. The flavors are delicious and change often. My favorite was the pumpkin!
author: Holly C.

description:
Dear Mission Minis,

It is winter time and this means I eat because my body is in hibernating season. I'm like a bear, I need to store food in my body to get through these cold days. YOU ARE NOT DOING MY FIGURE ANY GOOD by being just blocks away from my house. And you certainly are not helping by being only $1 a cupcake. Do you not know that I have no self control and that gluttony is my biggest sin? I have a love hate relationship with you. I am absolutely in LOVE with your pumpkin spice, your banana maple glaze and your red velvet (although you could be a bit more moist), but I hate the fact that your cupcakes are so small that I can eat 12 of them! Mission Minis, I will be back and when I do, I hope something called "self control" kicks in and I'll be able to only buy 1 and not 2 dozen (like last time).
author: Nancy Y.

description: Mission Minis is one of those places that you hear about especially when you're a cupcake aficionado. Unfortunately, it just didn't live up to they hype for me. I ordered two dozen minis using a daily deal coupon. It was an assorted box which allowed for a variety to try. But at the end of the day, nothing wowed me enough to warrant a return trip. Sorry!
author: Anna R.

description:
Horchata Mini Cupcake (left) and Red Velvet Mini Cupcake (right). The horchata cupcake was really yummy, full of cinnamony goodness, definitely prefer the cupcake over the real drink. The red velvet was decent also very tasty. My only complaint is that their cupcakes are a bit on the dry side, though that isn't too noticeable seeing as these cupcakes are teeny tiny.

Even though these are a bit dry, it's not too bad, not dry like a desert or anything like that. And these are the best cupcakes I've had in awhile, so 4 stars!
author: Constance C.

description:
Cinnamon Horchata is what brought me here multiple times, not because it was amazing mind you, but because they always managed to be sold out of them when I went.  

The workers here aren't very friendly and actually made me want to avoid this place.  They made me feel like I was bothering them every time by giving them my business, but the thought of a amazing cinnamon horchata cupcake kept me coming back.

After many visits chasing after the elusive cinnamon horchata cupcake I got my hands on two. One for me and one for my girlfriend.  I tried everyone of their cupcakes on previous visits and they were all pretty bland and dry.  The banana maple glaze cupcake was delicious, but it was more of a muffin than cupcake.  I figured if they executed the cinnamon horchata cupcake right then I could care less about any of the other flavors, but after biting into it I was severely disappointed.  The cupcake was once again on the dry side which is understandable considering their mini, but the flavor was almost non existent.  See i love horchata and i understand that it is a pretty subtle in taste, but seriously this cupcake was bland.  

I hate to give places 1 star, but disappointing cupcakes with employee attitude makes it hard for me to not.  Don't worry mission mini workers, I won't give you the burden of having to take my money any longer.
author: Domingo D.

description: A little unassuming spot. So cute. AND...so good. All the flavors rocked. Frostings were the highlight - across the board. (We had 6.) Dude gave us an extra one b/c we were so excited. My mom was psyched.
author: Andrew K.

description:
So I had some of these cupcakes at a friend's birthday party. They're little and cute, variety of flavors.. though I can't say I was impressed. They definitely weren't the worse cupcakes ever.. but I can say for sure I don't think I'm ever going back. They were just like normal cupcakes, on the drier side, made with super sweet frosting, but barely any flavors.

The other thing that irked me about them is my friend had placed the order ahead of time to be picked up by 5:45. They said if we got there too late, they'd close. They had one person working, a line of two people and the girl couldn't multi-task and figure out the other two of us were waiting for our pre-made, pre-paid order. I saw mine on the desk, grabbed it and told her it was mine so it wasn't the worse situation ever. But there were already grease stains around the side of the box. Great presentation.
author: Analisa S.

description:
I LOVE cupcakes and I like most of Mission Minis flavors.  I wish I could say I loved Mission Minis customer service, but I don't.

I purchased two google offers for a dozen assortment of mini cupcakes. I emailed my order for two dozen cupcakes and specified the 4 flavors that I wanted.  Someone from the store called and informed that I couldnt redeem the two google offers in one transaction. I said that's fine, I'll pay full price for the 2nd batch.  Why not--- I like their cupcakes. On the phone we discussed the flavors I wanted and she would prepare those flavors instead of the entire assortment .  When I arrived at the bakery, they were sold out and  my order was  WRONG.  Completely wrong.  I got two dozen with every flavor instead of the ones I particularly specified.  There was no way I was going to pay EXTRA money for something I didn't order, so I redeemed my google offers and didn't get the 2nd batch. I got a flimsy "sorry, the person was new" as an excuse.  Overall very frustrating.
author: Uchenna A.

description:
Great service. Groupon transcaction went very smoothly. 

But the cupcakes were not of the gourmet variety. I could have made these at home. The box was all greasy just a couple hours after picking them up. 

The best flavors we tried were lemon and red velvet.  The vegan tasted like a muffin not a cupcake.
author: Tina P.

description:
Delicious cupcakes at great prices. If you are in the Mission, this is it!

I love picking one up after a lunch in the 'hood.
author: Art A.

description:
Very tasty, perfect size and perfect price for a light treat. 
They only have mini-cupcakes but that works for me!
author: Dee K.

description: I would give it 3.5 stars, but I always feel happy when I see the minis, like little clouds waiting to be savored. The cake part is not too sweet or not much flavored, but the top is very creamy. So far, I haven't really got a favorite. The blueberry fruit so far is close second. They've got Cinnamon Horchata, Double Chocolate, blueberry, Meyer lemon (wish it could be more lemony - like shaving tiny peel), Aztec chocolate, peanut butter (very peanut buttery), the strawberry (need to eat immediately) and purple blueberry cost $2 each. You can eat these in one bite or for a friend-3 bites. I've always got friendly service.
author: Helen L.

description:
Mission Minis is a gem in San Francisco.
I love the appearance of the store (mini vintage ovens, table and chairs) but no it doesn't stop there.
The cakes are moist and not too heavy. Frosting is not too sweet and ingredients definitely taste fresh. 
Mini cupcake portions are perfect, staff is friendly and prices are right. 
I recommend the classic red velvet and the vegan banana was surprisingly delicious.
author: Sheila C.

description: I love the concept of a store dedicated to just mini cupcakes because after just a few bites I usually feel overloaded in sugar but unfortunately, I was not a fan of them :(  I bought a coupon off Plum District which was 2 dozens for $12 which was a steal... I had to call ahead and order and it was cool because they give you an assorted variety so you can sample all their flavors but I took a bite out of just a couple and thought they were were a little dense for a cupcake and I didn't really like their frosting.  They ended up being really ugly after the ride home because their boxes aren't that great and even the person at the store had warned us about that but there was no way to help that.  She told us we had to hold the boxes by the side and not let it sit on the bottom but we had places to go to before home and I wasn't going to do that the car ride home to the east bay.
author: Kymberli C.

description: Decent cupcakes - moist. I like how they're minis because it gives me more opportunities to try different flavors in one sitting.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I first heard about this place on The Food Network on the show Cupcake Wars and then read some great reviews on their Cinnamon Horchata Cupcake.

The cashier was very patient and helpful in helping me pick out the flavors that I wanted to try. They were sold out of the Swiss Almond Coconut flavor when I got there. :( I LOVED the Cinnamon Horchata cupcake although I am not a big fan of the cream cheese frosting. I wish I had ordered more!

It is $1.00 per mini and the cupcakes are quite mini! I would def. come back and order some more Cinnamon Horchata flavor minis.
author: Shannyn W.

description:
I ordered a dozen cupcakes so I was able to try a small variety of them. 
In general, the icing on all of them were great.  Just sweet enough so you don't feel that cavity kick in. 

I've had their Cinnamon Horchata (a tad dry), Meyer Lemon Creme (I love all things lemony so this fit the bill), Aztec chocolate (can't go wrong with double chocolate), banana maple glaze (also a bit dry) and pumpkin spice. 

This is a tiny shop so there isn't much space to sit so it's more so a take out cupcake shop.
author: Tanya N.

description:
I don't even like cupcakes. Or cake for that matter, but this spot, I CRAVE.

We found them after they had samples at a party at the Academy of Sciences. I was in love after I had my first Cinnamon Horchata. I could eat them all day long, the frosting is amazing and the cake is just sweet. The size is perfect to make sure you don't OD on deliciousness. 

I love this spot and will continue to come - the location is simple and the workers are always nice and so helpful!
author: Francesca F.

description: Got a groupon for cupcakes. Everyone who helped me in the shop was extremely friendly and courteous. The cupcakes we're delicious so we decided to have Mission Mini's at my wedding. They were a hit!
author: Cena V.

description: We got cupcakes for our son's 2nd birthday and everyone loved them so much I decided to bring a bunch back for Easter last weekend.  They were a hit again!  I love the flavors and size...just right and I don't feel guilty eating a few :)  The adults all complimented me on the different flavors I chose (though I just asked MM to give me a bit of each) and the kids loved them too.  So, they've become my go-to for anything I need to bring a sweet treat to.
author: Adlil e.

description:
I tried these bad boys (or should I call them bad babies because they're mini??) at Outside Lands, they were the PERFECT bite size to top off the other bad (read: oh so good!) food I  was having. I tried the blueberry, cinnamon horchata, and red velvet- all VERY good but my fav was the blueberry. 

Only leaving off one star because I haven't seen their actual location and haven't tried that many other flavors... but I plan to remedy this asap!
author: Amaranta C.

description:
Pretty sure I'm spoiled by CupKates because I think these are not really that great....compared to CupKates.

I may have had a bad batch because reading reviews... I am supposed to have had a moist cake. Mine was unfortunately dry. I'll give them a thumbs up for the interesting flavors, but the 4 cupcakes I had were dry.

Seriously, I've had better regular cupcakes and mini cupcakes. Not bad for $1 quickstop I suppose.

CupKates for regular-sized, La Luna for minis!
author: Charles L.

description:
Never really understood the whole cupcake mania. I understood it as basically a girl thing mostly.

Still, that doesn't mean a guy can't appreciate a good cupcake when he sees one. For some reason, I never really have any sort of urge to buy cupcakes. But when I have them in front of me, I eat them like no other. A very strange reaction.

So when they make it bite sized like these, I'm scared I'll eat too many too fast. Especially when they taste as good as Mission Minis.

Never seen mini cupcakes before, but call me a convert.
author: Andrew M.

description:
So are these like magic cupcakes (can't be because I didn't feel any super powers afterward)? Or do they have some special weight loss secret in them (nope because the oil seeped into the box after a while)? Because a bang for a buck is a little steep for such  a miniature-esque cupcake. Literally, its smaller than a piece of California roll and you can engulf the sucker in one bite. While the flavors were pretty enticing (Ruby Red Velvet, Aztec chocolate, meyer lemon creme, classic vanilla, cinnamon horchata, blueberries and cream) and super cute, the cup cakes weren't very spectacular. They weren't moist enough. I've had a lot better elsewhere. If it weren't for my special coupon, I think that I would probably have passed this up. 

But I gave them a three stars because the customer service was really good and the girls working the front were really nice.
author: Wendy L.

description: The cutest little cupcakes with soft, buttery frosting and moist, rich cake.   I tasted four flavors, of which my favorites were Red Velvet and Pumpkin Spice.  Take advantage of the 10 dollar dozen and try your best to share.
author: Alyssa F.

description: Yummm.. i'm such a cupcake fanatic and finally got a chance to try out mission minis. I had the ruby red velvet, swiss almond chocolate, meyer lemon creme, peanut butter kiss, and the cinnamon horchata. My favorites were the cinnamon horchata and the swiss almond chocolate. My only complaints are that because they're mini sized, i ate more than i should've. But i guess that's not so bad. Six minis equal one regular sized cupcake right??
author: Mertani G.

description:
Yes, they can get dry because they are so little and delicate..maybe they need a gentle humidifier or on a similar constantly cooking new ones rotation that Anthony cookies has to keep the freshness? 

But still pretty good and will go back.  I am thinking a large order will be fresher because they are not in the store front like the walk in ready to eat ones are? 

I wanted to sample for a large order for a party but when I heard 48 hours not same day or even 24 hour wait I knew I had to go in another direction for my party...I only had 36 hours lead time.
author: Sion S.

description:
I always pick up a few dozens of Missions Minis for my nieces and nephews birthdays because each kid requests for their own dozen! Their Red Velvet seems to be a big hit! 

I've bought mini cupcakes from a couple of other cup cake bakeries but the feedback I got was that Mission Minis were better.

I usually go as soon as they open because they tend to sell out real fast! The girls working there are always real nice and helpful too!
author: Soozie H.

description:
I had an optometrist appointment right before I was supposed to pick up some pre-ordered cupcakes from Mission Minis, so I wandered in with my oh-so-senior-citizenish sun-blocking shades.  Behind my blurred vision, I could really only see the tiny counter and the cute little pink boxes that my delightful treats came in.  The guy behind the counter was friendly, and my order was just as I asked for it.  Here's what I got:

Ruby Red Velvet
Cinnamon Horchata
Vegan Banana Maple
Aztec Chocolate
Meyer Lemon Cream
Blueberries and Cream

The Blueberries and Cream flavor definitely stood out among the rest.  I'm not sure if it was just my batch, but my cupcakes (with the exception of Blueberries and Cream) were a little on the dry side.  Some of my coworkers have pre-ordered from another mini-cupcake place in the past, and they were moist and delicious!  I still devoured my Mission Mini's and would probably still come back.  Blueberries and cream. Nom nom nom.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I drive all the way from the East Bay to pick up Mission-Minis for special occasions.

I love their different varieties of cupcakes and it is great that they are tiny bite-size cupcakes for portion control... although I eat 4 of them in one sitting... I guess that negates the portion control... haha... oops!

My favorite is their peanut butter but if you are not a fan or am allergic.. their horchata flavor is also really good.

Go there early or order your cupcakes because they run out early!!
author: Lynda N.

description:
I love these cute little cupcakes! My favorites are the aztec chocolate and the red velvet. I swear I can eat 5 of them in one seating. They are $1 a piece, which IMO can be kinda pricey for something you can literally eat in one bite, but oh well...id go again. lol.

4 stars because they only had the regular size cupcake available in vanilla. I wish they had more regular size cupcakes, but I guess that would defeat the name of the place, ha.
author: Susana M.

description: Tasty offerings at an affordable price. Fit for fun-loving foodies or anyone with a sweet tooth with treats for just a buck a piece. The best of both worlds! The guy at the counter was very friendly. The location is great. Would recommend it across the board. Cheers!
author: Jeff H.

description:
Those damn elusive pink lemonade cupcakes!

Mission Mini's has been under my radar for quite some time now (I'm a huge Philz Coffee fan & MM's display stares me in the face when I place my coffee order) but this week was my first time visiting the quaint & very pink 22nd & Mission storefront. 

Their flavors, although clever & cool, don't really pique my interest (I'd rather drink Horchata than have it in a cupcake & Swiss Almond Coconut sounds better in cookie form.) But Pink Lemonade--now there's a cupcake flavor I can get excited about. Unfortunately MM was all sold out. And when I do happen upon an MM vendor (Emmy's Spaghetti Shack, Whole Foods, various cafes), guess what? They're all sold out of the Pink Lemonade too. I'm beginning to think it wasn't meant to be...

My lunch partner & I tried three, more classic flavors; the Ruby Red Velvet & Vanilla were perfect (sweet, not too crumbly, flavor packed.) The Aztec Chocolate had a bit of a kick, but I always feel lukewarm about chocolate cake so I can't say I was enthused by this one (or any other chocolate cupcakes.)

I used to think a whole $1 was a lot to pay for one teeny tiny quarter-sized cupcake, but now I look at it this way: Mission Mini cupcakes taste good, real good...Dollar bills, they aren't too tasty (so I've heard...)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Although the cupcake thing feels like it's running its course, Mission Minis has revived my love of cupcakes thanks to their unique flavors and bite-size-only treats. Their Aztec Chocolate, Cinnamon Horchata and Swiss Almond Coconut are my absolute favorites, although I tried the Banana Maple Glaze and Pumpkin Spice last time, and I fell in love, too. I like that I can try 3 or 4 different flavors for the price of one regular size cupcake from those other shops (and $1 per is actually cheaper than places like Kara's whose cupcakes I really don't like anyway).

Last week, I placed an order for two dozen minis via a Plum District voucher I purchased last year, and the transaction couldn't have been easier. The coupon was for two dozen assorted baker's choice cupcakes, but I had emailed them two days in advance hinting at my four favorite flavors, and when my husband picked up the order, they gave us 4 of each of my favorites! Since their inventory gets low towards the end of the day, I recommend that you pick up your order as early as possible (we got there soon after it opened on a Saturday). My dinner guests loved the treats, and I have Mission Minis on speed dial for my next event!
author: Sara Y.

description:
I really wish I could give it a four.. oh the store front is so cute, the server so sweet, and the mini cupcakes so adorable and the flavors so original, like "cinnamon horchata" and "pink lemonade". But when you've had Cupkate's in East Bay, it puts all other cupcakes to shame.

I will have to come back to try more flavors and hope the rating will go up then! Love the small bite sizes. But $1 might be too steep?
author: Jackie G.

description: I loved their Horchata cupcakes.  I usually love the red velvet although they weren't my favorite.  Nice guy runs this and he has the cutest little boy who walks among the event passing out business cards! Too cute!  I would try them again no doubt!  Great for catering and for events.
author: Bahvee V.

description:
Brilliant! Girls love sweets but girls are also afraid of the calories that comes with it. Can't we just indulge and not feel guilty about it?!  Then BAAAAM- out pops Mission Minis with their pretty and delicious bite size cupcakes. 

My favorite is the red velvet and they are carried at many places such as Asqew Grill, Philz and Rituals. It's sweet but not too sweet (just like how I like it), their cake is moist and their cream cheese frosting has the perfect creamy and rich consistency. 

BTW, they're only a dollar each :)
author: Jenny K.

description:
$1 for each mini & $3 for each regular sized cupcake.  I purchased minis to try more flavors.

Ruby red velvet
Double chocolate
Vanilla
Aztec chocolate (cinnamon infused chocolate cake w/vanilla bean frosting)
Pumpkin
Peanut butter (chocolate cake w/peanut butter frosting)
Lemon myer

The cake was mainly dry.  Flavorful frosting.  The red velvet was chewy...not moist or dry...kind of a funky texture.  The best was pumpkin w/cream cheese frosting..the only one worth eating.
author: M K.

description:
I found out about mission mini's from a scoutmob coupon. I love the size of mini cupcakes so I was excited to find a good place right near school.

I will not be going back... I tried 3 different flavors, Vanilla, Chocolate and Pumpkin Spice. The flavors were ok, but the cake was extremely dry and the frosting was NOT good. They all tasted the same to me, like they were cream cheese based(pumpkin spice was).
author: Melissa D.

description:
A co-worker recommended them for an end of the year school event.  

She raved about their cupcakes, so I called and left a messages to place an order for 12 dozen cupcakes and a question about delivery.  

After a week -- no callback.  I called again and left another message.  No return call.  Went with another bakery.
author: Girlz M.

description: Looks are deceiving! I'm not sure how someone can give this place a stellar rating. I was thrilled at the chance to try these little boogers at the 2010 SF Weekly DISH event, since Mission Minis was partaking as a food vendor. Man, they definitely look better than they taste. Despite their unique combinations and flavors, the frosting was way off and just NOT good, and the cake so very DRY. Not a good cupcake at all.
author: Mansi A.

description:
two bites cupcakes! haha really worth your $1.

Found this place from groupon and wow, i'm addicted. we ordered 2 dozens of:

-swiss almond coconut
-ruby red velvet
-cinnamon horchata
-aztec chocolate
-meyer lemon creme
-bluerries and cream
-classic vanilla

the only one i didn't taste was the lemon creme but my friend liked it. i tasted them all and loved 'em all but the almond coconut. i was surprised since i love coconut but this was the only one that was a bit harder, wasn't as soft and moist.

i'd definitely would like to go there again when i'm in the area.
author: Viola C.

description:
I decided to get my birthday cupcakes here and am pretty happy I did!

I ordered 4 dozen red velvet cupcakes and asked for no sprinkles (sounds weird, but I had mini toppers to put on them).  I ordered two days in advance and had no problem picking them up when I was told they would be ready.  Price is pretty reasonable and they are pretty tasty, dry, but good.  They were very much enjoyed at my party and I'm so happy at how easy the whole process was.
author: Jen K.

description: I enjoyed the cupcakes here as much as the service.  The small cupcakes are awfully cute! Which I like very much and the flavors are delicious. I don't have much to complain because I can always smell the next batch they make there (after store hours, for the next day). Not to mention friendly worker at the counter, always a plus in my book.
author: Stephany H.

description:
Purchased a coupon $12 for 2 dozen cupcakes through Townhog. The restriction with the coupon is that you have to pre order your cupcakes and they don't take walk-ins.  Good thing I read this cause I was coming from out of town and would have been upset if they turned me away.  
Anyhow, the person I spoke to over the phone was VERY helpful (customer service EXCELLENT).  I picked up the cupcakes and delightfully sampled the cupcakes wtih my siblings.  I gotta say all cupcakes were delicious.  My favorite was the pumpkin, coconut and peanut butter chocolate.  The reason for the 4 stars is that the cupcakes, (taste wise), is not one of a kind.  Don't get me wrong I'd probably order from this place again but if I'm going to spend money on cupcakes their's still only one place I'd go to for that.
author: Blue S.

description:
My first run in with Mission Mini's was at SF Cupcake Camp in 2009. I remember their name but didn't remember their cupcakes because I ate probably around 15 cupcakes that day. Anyhow, I finally got to taste em again!   The BF Matt Jon A., picked up half a dozen for me since I wasn't feeling well. Mini cupcakes are awesome because you can eat more of em! I ate 3 the first day and was SO tempted to eat the rest but waited til the next day. The flavors I had were:

Aztec Chocolate - Unique chocolate flavor, but super dry and crumbly cake. 

Red Velvet - Eh eh. Nothin spesh, a little dry, and frosting was really cream cheesy and thick...the texture of their cream cheese reminds me of a dog trying to eat peanut butter. 

Swiss Almond Coconut - I liked this one very much. The coconut in the batter was really good and the frosting was fluffy and not too sweet. The almonds added a nice crunch too. 

Banana - tasted very much like a banana muffin, but it was yummy because it was not too sweet and very moist. 
 
Choco pb - yum, this was probably my favorite one. The frosting tasted like straight pb!
 
Horchata - cake was cinnamony but again the frosting was too cream cheesy 

Overall, I think the cupcakes are ok, and I'll return to try the rest of the flavors next time I'm in the city.
author: Trina A.

description:
I'm only giving 4 stars bc of the location. Parking is a b1tch here! OMG. I must have spend over half an hour looking for parking. Other than that, the service is great. the mini cupcakes are delicious. Moist. The frosting is not too sweet. and they have some very interesting favors. I love their horchata and red velvet. The coconut ain't bad either.

They also sell Creme Brulee from the Creme brûlée cart too! $4/each. I got the espresso and lavender. Both were very good. 

Mission Minis were on Groupon and then Bloomspot. You bet I got both! That's how I found out about them! I hope they'll have more coupons later. Such great deals!
author: Kim D.

description:
Just plain Yummy every time!

Moist
Fresh
love the frosting

don't mind paying a buck for each

I just care that it taste good

All the flavors are good.
author: Fabiola L.

description:
I don't know if anybody has noticed.. but within the last year there has been a huge cupcake trend explosion (along with red velvet cake).. I don't know why.. Anyway, I too have become enticed with cupcakes, and especially these cute little ones!

I have been seeing them all around the city, and because they are the perfect size for a sweet treat and the perfect price ($1 usually) I always try a new one. I have tried red velvet, cinnamon, coconut and chocolate. They have all been delicious. 

Sooo the day that I actually visited the bakery I was at Grand Coffee around the corner where I bought a mini cupcake.. the owner mentioned that it was close by, so I had to see the place! I love seeing ALL the possibilities of a specific treat (like ice cream flavors, cookies, yogurts,). I ran to the place and burst in. My interaction:

Owner: hi?
Me: Hi! I see your cupcakes EVERYWHERE.. I had to come in-
Owner: wait! We have food network filming us RIGHT now. would you mind holding that thought and repeating that entrance?
So I was on food network for this place! I forgot to ask when they were airing the footage, so I have probably missed it by now.

I asked whether they deliver, and the owner said that because the city is so small he can deliver a dozen for $15. I think thats an absolutely fabulous deal for a great surprise gift or catering for a party.. definitely going to do it. The place was small and had one table outside, so really more of a bakery location.

Summary: Delicious cupcakes for a great price. Not good to hang but THEY WILL DELIVER!
author: Sirina K.

description: We arrived just as it was closing at 4 yesterday on Sunday and caught them for the last cupcakes of the day. I'd tried to come here once before but was too late. We were each just going to try a few flavors but the woman was super nice and gave us two dozen, since they were closing anyway. I love that the cupcakes are so small, this lets you try a bunch of tastes in one go. They are sweet, but not so cloyingly sugary that I felt sick after, the way I often do with sugar since I almost never eat it. The frosting is creamy and they have a lot of tasty flavors. The lemon, pumpkin and aztec chocolate were the best. These are not the best cupcakes I've ever had (see Cupkates!! yum but they are on a food truck, so hard to get to, sadly) but they are way better than most cupcakes I've tried from bakeries. Not to mention, each cupcake is $1 only.
author: Merredith L.

description: My husband surprised me with a huge variety of mini cupcakes for my birthday (about 3 dozen). He got some special Google Offer for it. The cupcakes are DELICIOUS and I love that it's bite size because that's all you really need when you're consuming such a rich piece of cupcake. My particular favorite is the horchata cupcake. Big yum.
author: Diana Y.

description: These are very tasty and guilt free in their tiny demeanor.
author: Tina F.

description:
I first had Mission Mini's cakes for my co-worker's birthday a couple weeks ago before discovering the most sinister, amazing part of Mission Minis. 

They deliver.

They deliver dozens of their perfect cakes to your home or office in about an hour. If you get the mid-day craving for sweets, you can have dozens of cupcakes to share (or not) with everyone you know.

Their store is adorable and the cupcakes are delicious. (The cupcakes are also adorable, but they are mini cupcakes and that's only to be expected). Sometimes they're a bit dry, but that's just a hazard of mini cupcakes. 

I've tried the vanilla, red velvet, cinnamon horchata and aztec chocolate. The cinnamon horchata is by far my favorite, with a light cream cheese frosting. The red velvet is simply red velvet, but it is the cinnamon horchata that truly stands out.

But Mission Minis is a sinister, sinister business to do something as horrible as deliver.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I was on a cupcake hunt for my party and my go to were too expensive. So I went after Mission Minis, after all they made it to cupcake wars right? Eh, ok they sufficed cause the price was right. They really are not anything to write home about. 
The Cinnamon Horacha was the best of the bunch, then I would say the double chocolate. The batter was kinda dry for my friends who ate the frosting first then the cupcake.
The green tea is weird, the lemon too strong and vanilla boring.
author: Natasha M.

description:
I special ordered cupcakes for my friends birthday a few weeks ago and they were a hit!
The coconut ones were super moist with a light frosting. I had the aztec chocolate made gluten free and they were great too. 
Pick up was super easy and we even rented a cute cupcake tree for the evening.
I'll be back!
author: Hannah S.

description:
They are cute. In fact, very cute.

It's unfortunate that they don't taste as good as they look.  

Dry. Dry. Dry.

Also, it's so expensive! $1 for a cupcake that i can eat in a half a bite.  I could make 48 for the same price (and they would be moist, damnit).

For now, I'm sticking to Pillsbury.
author: Marisa R.

description:
I finally got a chance to try this place out after hearing it a lot.

The cupcakes are actually pretty awesome, the cashier was a cool guy, and they definitely had a bunch of unique flavors (especially the Cinnamon Horchata).

I mean there isn't a whole lot I could say, but I enjoyed the experience.
author: Ren L.

description:
I'm giving Mission Minis three stars, though there isn't anything wrong with their product. The cupcakes I ordered for my friend's birthday were moist and delicious. The miniature form had a number of pluses over the standard cupcake: easier to eat (one bite) and good frosting-cake ratio. Their flavor variety is also pretty good. At $0.99 a pop, I don't think they are really cheaper than a $3.50 cupcake by volume, but it is nice to be able to get a treat for a dollar. 

But this is why I can't give it four stars:

(1) I used a Groupon. I'm sure Mission Minis underestimated how many people would buy their Groupon and is overwhelmed, but they should be flattered! After reading a couple Yelp reviews I immediately placed an order for two dozen about 10 days in advance. There was no problem with this. I even got an email confirmation, which was nice. However, when I went to pick up in the store on Friday around 5:30pm (I had designated my pick up time to be 5-6pm), I felt like the guy behind the counter was annoyed with me. In fact, I dont' think he even greeted me; he just saw my Groupon that I was holding and asked for my name.

(2) When you place an order, you can't choose how many of what flavor to go into the box (though you can choose the flavors, up to 5).  Really?? I am placing my order ten days in advance, and they can't plan for it? This was important to me, as the birthday girl loves vanilla, and not so much chocolate. I personally love red velvet, and out of 22 cupcakes, only 2 were red velvet. Incidentally, there was a sign in the store saying red velvet was sold out. So, basically, it seems as if they heavily prioritize in store customers. Not sure why this is, considering advance orders are placed in ... advance. 

(3) Two dozen fit into a box snuggly, so they don't shift around. But it's a heavy box. I asked for a bag, as I planned to keep walking around for the rest of the evening and had nowhere to keep them. I was given a tall and narrow bag with handles...the box is short and wide. It was a bit of a hassle to hold the box horizontally all evening. Ironically, the next day, I brought it to my friend's party in a Sprinkles bag, which fit the box perfectly. 

These are perhaps nitpicky points, and I certainly don't want to discourage anyone from paying Mission Minis when in the area, but there are just some things that they might want to think through further.
author: Ada T.

description: How can you resist these adorable little morsels!?  The owner is the best - he was so accommodating in getting my large order of cupcakes. I served these at a party and they were a HIT!  I think my favorite flavor was ruby red velvet... no wait, I mean pink lemonade... no, aztec chocolate...!
author: Vicente G.

description:
THis place is poppin. I always come here with my sis. She loves mission mini. I like them a lot, they are so rich and soft and just freaking good. 
The day old boxes cupcakes for 5 bucks is a great deal it still taste fresh ! 
The workers are all nice and polite! And now that they made reg. size cupcakes ill make sure to comeback. But i still like the small ones XD.
Keep the good work !
author: THe real TrUth D.

description: Love this little cupcake shop, it's a damn shame it is right by my work and I have to smell the sweet aroma of their backed good every time I park my car in the morning, leave for lunch, or leave at night! I just placed a last min order at this place for a custom cupcake batch and they were so kind to do it short notice. I highly recommend them to you if you are catering a party and want some tasty treats. Need I also say that there little bites are a buck - so for less than 10 dollars you can get some cute decorative tasty morsels to bring to your office, party, or event!
author: Callie O.

description:
Standing at not quite five feet tall (or rather, short), I AM a Mission Mini.
So why not mini-me size everything? Perfectly proportioned and petite.

Indulge without feeling like you've gone overboard.
And then you realize, you too have one of the ubiquitous pink boxes chock full of the pouty-peaked sugar-piped babies. Irresistible.

*Horchata* = amazing. Perfect. Imagine a snickerdoodle in cake form with more cinnamon kick.
*Aztec Chocolate* = strong chocolate flavor but a little overwhelmed by the buttercream.
*Vanilla* = I could make similar at home. It's good but may as well get something else.
*Peanut Butter Kiss* = Have Milk Nearby. Like, in-hand nearby. strong pb scent seemed like overkill but it was bliss. Totally balanced, like-buttah frosting atop dark choc cake.

Get there early, these babies go fast. At 5 PM you are going to be severely limited, but don't fret, whatever's left should still sate your sweet spot.
author: Alissa A.

description:
My friend went on a mini mission and brought back some Mission Minis.

Mmmm mmmm, were they good - and for $1 each, totally affordable!  They had the right elements - moist cake, rich frosting, and the right proportions of each.  They were pretty to look at, too - each with a little decoration to make it feel special.

The flavors range from the classic (Ruby Red Velvet) to the more exotic (Cinnamon Horchata - loved this one).

The shop is adorable and well located on this stretch of 22nd Street where there is nothing else like it around.  

Good things DO come in small packages!
author: Liz S.

description:
Horrible. 

lacking in flavor... i would rather eat Hostess.  

Very messy store and the workers seemed more interested in their iPhones than customer service or cleanliness. 

Frosting was OK, but the cake was dryer than a 78 Year old Porn Actress. The prices are low.. and after taking a bite, i know why.

Next time, ill stick with Kara's. 
(this dump just seems like a cheap copy)
author: angelo b.

description:
I have to say I'm a little disappointed with Mission Minis. I was pretty excited to try this place as there are only a handful of cupcakeries that have interesting flavors that doesn't require you to order flavors by the dozen and inexpensive. 

I had ordered 2 dozen for a birthday party and my friend picked up 2 more to eat right away. The ones that we tasted right away were really good and moist, and just the right size for a delightful snack.

However, I wish the ones that I ordered were the same. I honestly believe the ones I received were left from the night before or maybe even longer. The frosting was hard on most of them, and in fact came off as one piece when I'd try to lift it off the cupcake because it didn't taste good. Usually when frosting does that is when it had been sitting around for a bit, ie when left out overnight. Even if the cupcake was left sitting out all day, I don't think it would do that!! But not only that, but some of the cakes themselves were harder than others as well! Again, leading me to believe that some were old. There was no bounce, no fluffiness to the cupcakes.
I just couldn't believe they would do something like that! 

If you walk in off the street, it may be your best bet since your cupcakes would be more fresh than if you had pre-ordered them. I don't know how well they'd do then if they had to cater a party or event to grow their business. It is a real shame because not only did they lose one customer, but potentially a lot more, simply because no one was impressed with them.

With so many other cupcakeries in the city, this may be something they need to work on...
author: Ly T.

description: I did a gig and they had some on the tables and they are tiny, so I stuck 20 in my pocket and took them home. OK, honestly they gave me a box of them, oh, very addictive little things. I want more.
author: Brandon M.

description:
April fools me, please! This is going to be a long one.

So I called on April 1st, hoping to place an order for my friends' birthday dinner on Saturday, but they told me they could no longer take orders because of all the groupons that were sold (I also wanted to use said groupon). I paused on the phone hoping they'd yell out - April Fools, instead, was met with sorry, but that they could take an order for Sunday instead (Uhh...but I don't need them on Sunday). Feeling dejected, I hung up.

An hour later, I thought about it and thought...heeeeey! wait a minute, I did what the groupon told me - call 48 hours in advance, so I called back and asked if I could come and just pick up a bunch of cupcakes on Saturday and the person told me no because I needed to order them in advance. *Scratches head* At this point, I was really annoyed and thought - forget those cupcakes!!!

Fast forward to next day. My friends changed dinner plans to Sunday, I became ecstatic to once again be able to use my groupon. I call them Friday morning and yet again, they said they could not take my order. BLAST!!! *Please believe, that the amount of frustration I felt cannot be exemplified in this review.* Luckily the guy I talked to told me that I COULD come in and just pick out my cupcakes. YAY!!! 

Sunday was raining like hell, but I hauled ass early in the morning to go and pick out my two dozen cupcakes for fear of them running out. I became pretty psychotic over these cupcakes, but thankfully everything worked out. The guy was super helpful and friendly. Birthday girls were surprised and the cupcakes were quite good. 

We had pretty much all the flavors on their menu and my reactions to them:

+Classic Vanilla - normal
+Pink Lemonade - good
+Aztec Chocolate - good
+Cinnamon Horchata - cake was really dry, disappointing
+Ruby Red Velvet - yum, yum
+Swiss Almond Coconut - pretty good considering I'm not big on coconut
+Banana Maple Glaze - tastes like banana bread which I love
+Ginger Carrot - really good, moist and flavor was perfect
+Peanut Butter Kiss - meh, not a big fan of peanut butter

All in all, it was quite the experience. I would probably eat these again, but will probably not try to order them in advance ever again. 

If you made it to the end of this review, kudos to you for reading my complaint!
author: Dolores L.

description:
I'm happy to drop a dollar for a teeny cupcake if they are awesome....
And they are, indeed, lip-smacking good.
The horchata is my fave.
As my girlfriend said, it would be fun if they had a punch card or something similar...
author: Dario B.

description:
I tried these cupcakes with a Groupon.  2 dozen cupcakes was a pretty good deal but I would no way go back and pay full price.  I was definitely underwhelmed.  I agree with a lot of the reviewers on Yelp, these cupcakes are way too dry.  Especially the Aztec chocolate, which is my favorite combo, white icing on chocolate cake, that was the driest of them all.  I also tried the red velvet, cinnamon horchata, chocolate banana (this one is new, it's just the vegan banana with chocolate icing), blueberry, swiss almond coconut, and the chocolate vanilla.  Maybe it's because these are mini and it's hard to not dry them out because they are small, but I'll stick with a regular size cupcake from now on.

I have also tried Cups and Cakes and That Takes the Cake and of the 3, I like That Takes the Cake the best.  But my favorite tuxedo cupcake can be found at some grocery stores, Just Desserts brand, and 4 full-sized ones are about $6.
author: Madeline M.

description:
We recently ordered 2 dozen for an office birthday. I was not pleased at all. The cupcakes were pretty dry and lacking flavor. The frosting was rich, but could not make up for how dry cupcakes were. We spent $30 on two dozen, which was definitely not worth the money.

I asked for an assortment of all flavors listed on the website and didn't even get one of each flavor. There were multiples of other flavors though. I believe they just gave me what was left over for the day, as I asked for a later delivery.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Ugh.

As an avid cupcake fan, I've been trying to find a standard cupcake bakery I can go to for those days that I just need a little pick-me-up. I was so excited about Mission Minis, especially considering their convenient location in the Mission and how adorable and tasty everything looked. 

However, I was so disappointed by the cupcakes that I doubt I'm ever going to go back. I ordered three flavors -- classic vanilla, pink lemonade, and red velvet. The only true winner of the trip was the classic vanilla cupcake, which I'd only bought because it was my first time at the shop and wanted something plain to start out with. Pink lemonade tasted nothing like what they described on their website (lemon cake with blackberry meringue buttercream). While the flavor itself was okay, it was a little annoying that it tasted more like strawberry frosting on a slightly lemon-tinted vanilla cake. Also, meringue buttercream? Talk about lies -- it tasted simply like buttercream to me. The real disappointment, however, was the red velvet, normally my favorite flavor. Having had my fair share of red velvet cakes in my time, I'm sorry to report that this was one of the worst red velvet cakes I'd ever had -- just super dry and almost stale. It almost tasted like nothing it was supposed to. 

I'm sorry to say that the entire experience was incredibly underwhelming and I most likely will not be coming back. There are far better cupcakes in this city, I'm sure of it. Or you're just better off making your own.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Do not use Mission Minis if you are planning to have the minis delivered.  I made a large order of 14 dozen and asked that they be delivered at our party site in the Tenderloin (not far from their store) at 1:30 pm on a weekday.  I had to pay $3 extra per dozen to have these little cakes delivered.  By 1:50 pm I called and the man who answered said he would be there soon.  No apology or acknowledgement of his lateness. Waited and waited...guests were to start arriving at 2:30 pm.  Called again at 2:15 pm and the woman said he was on his way, but she couldn't call him to find out when they would be delivered..nice customer service.  But the best was yet to come.  The delivery guy arrived at 2:25 pm. Again no apology.  I asked what type of discount they would provide since they did not live up to the agreement that we had, and that unfortunately I had paid for prior to delivery(big mistake).  He said there would be no reduction in the cost.  Because he was an hour late, I asked if he would help us put them on the trays for our guests.  He said he would have to charge extra!!!  But the last statement solidified why no one in their right mind should frequent this place.  I said that he should be doing something for our nonprofit since he broke the contract, and he simply replied:  "WHAT DO YOU THINK I AM...A PERCISION DRONE??????????????????  There are too many cupcake places now that provide good service and good cupcakes so don't waste your time here.....

OMG, just found out that the mean delivery man from Mission Minis is its owner!!!  Tragic.  Wonder how much longer he will be in business...the very worst service in history!!!
author: Sherry S.

description:
The first batch I bought from them, i was in love!!!  Ultra moist, super cute mini cupcakes that you just want to take a bite the second you open the box.  

The second batch that I just purchased last week? A little bit disappointing.  The creme on top was just not as flavorful as I remembered and the cupcakes were a bit dry.  

My favorite out of the flavors would have to be the horchata, red velvet and the banana.  Everything was just a little mediocre, and the you literally ONLY get TWO bites from that mini cupcake making you question, Is it really worth it for $1?   

...and that pink cardboard box is not a pretty presentation for these poor greasy mini cupcakes.  Save these cardboard box for the asian bakeries please.
author: stephanie c.

description:
I was sadly underwhelmed by this place.  Even though the store itself was very well kept and the sales person was nice, I won't be coming back here.  Why, you ask?  

Because I found their cupcakes to be dry and lacking "oomph."  Normally I love red velvet, but I found their red velvet cupcake to be not moist enough and I found the frosting to be too cheesy for my liking (and this is coming from someone who normally likes cream cheese frosting).  I actually feel like the Duncan Hines mixes are moister.

I also tried the chocolate and chocolate peanut butter ones, and also found these to be either too dry, too cheesy, or too sweet.

At $1 a pop for a cupcake the diameter of a quarter, they should have been the best darn cupcakes around.    And they weren't.
author: Nina B.

description:
Had groupon but otherwise it was a bit overpriced and the selection was only so so.

they aren't kidding when they say mini--like seriously mini.

I did like the seasonal blueberry cupcakes--those were lovely, but other than that, I didn't find any other stand outs.

However, as for the place, the staff was really nice and accomodating, I just didn't love the cupcakes.

I'll just make my own next time.
author: Lu E.

description:
A friend of a friend brought a bunch of Mission Mini's over for a dinner party.  Yeah for trying new foods for free!!! I tried the aztec chocolate, the double chocolate, and the cinnamon horchata.  I'm not a huge fan of the whole cupcake craze to begin with, but these tiny concoctions seemed overly sweet (I think this has something to do with an off frosting to cupcake ratio) and indistinguishable in flavor. 

I don't think I will be picking any of these little guys up next time I'm in the mission.
author: Lara O.

description:
1:30pm Saturday, they are sold out of every flavor except red velvet and blueberry something. It didn't help that they were a little too cool to chat a little... 

Fine, we'll go with what you have - we promised to bring these to a party and we will deliver.

Though in the end, we could have just gotten something at Whole Foods. 

I was utterly unimpressed by the flavor and texture of the cupcakes. The cake was a little dry and the frosting was nothing special. 

Kara's is still #1 for me and this is not a substitute.
author: Shal J.

description:
What makes food taste better to an Asian person?  Make it kawaii and make it cheaper than the other trendy options out there.  That equation guarantees at least the cold portion of the Asian heart that loves a deal.  It was even better when they offered for a short period of time a dozen minis for pick up for $11.  No longer.  I guess they realized that public transport is no obstacle for the girl on a mission.  To the mission.  Ha ha ... ha. 

I liked the price here.  It's $1.  Per mini.  And they only do minis.  It's like the Korean Soondobu places that only do Soondobu.  And at the same price.  I don't like the small variations between the "filled" and "seasonal" and "orgasmic" or "magic."  I like to know that each whole integer can be exchanged for something red with white cream cheese frosting on top.

I've tried various ones.  But I come back to the red velvet.  The red velvet here is great.  It's red.  Not devil food cake brown.  But red.  Like Scarlet O'Hara if she were made into a cupcake.  The icing is the right amount.  It's not too buttery (ahem, cupkate).  The cake is dense and does not fall apart when I try to take the cupcake wrapper off.

Don't you hate that when it happens?  it's like there was not enough flour inside or they didn't think to mix it, and when the wrapper comes off, these huge crumbs just disintegrate and fall off with the cupcake.  Why?  

The pink lemonade was just fine.  I actually like the buttercream on this and normally, I think of buttercream like a Prince Albert. 

Smores had the marshmallow topping.  The cake was ok, but nothing as good as Red Velvet.  

Vanilla was also good.  

For my birthday, I'm going to get a million of these and put a candle in them.  

Did i mention that they deliver?
author: Christina C.

description:
So i recently found out about this website, TownHog, where you can get gift certificates for half off.  So far nothing had gotten my attention until I got an email one morning saying $10 for $20 gift certificates at Mission Mini. Wait. What? Cupcakes for half off!!! Heck yea! And being in true fatty status, I bought 3 gift certificates.

I called to find out how much I'd actually be getting with my gc and Brandon (the owner) said I'd get two dozen. YAY! That worked out perfectly since I was going to visit a friend and wanted to bring her a dozen minis. I placed an order for Friday morning pickup and he was nice enough to let me come earlier than his 9am opening time. Sadly, I think he forgot friday morning. It wasn't a big deal since there was parking right in front and I only had to wait 5 extra minutes. Also, the order wasn't already put together. That was another bummer.  One of his workers put together the order and it took a while. I found out later why it took so long...those tiny suckers are hard to place neatly and cleanly in their container.

I got the red velvet since it's how I measure all cupcake places.  Frosting wasn't too sweet and there was a nice ratio of frosting to cake.  The cake wasn't the moistest I've had but it was still better than most.

Kudos on making the cupcakes mini...helps me feel less guilty about eating cupcakes.
author: Mary L.

description: Hate to switch it up again, but I've purchased cupcakes from here a handful of times since my last review, including several dozen for a party. Who would have thought there'd be leftovers? The cupcakes have solid flavors, the frosting is a bit hit or miss, but the cake itself is way too dry. On the rare occasion, I'll get some moist ones, but 9 times out of 10, they'll be dry. They must come out nice and moist, so if you get them when they're super fresh, they'll be great, but get some that were made early on in the day, and you're screwed. That type of inconsistency makes it hard to want to come back.
author: Brittany P.

description:
One should not retweet a Twitter post about free cupcakes and forget about it. Letting opportunities for free grub slip should be a crime!

Me: "Are you gonna go cupcakin' on Sunday? I'll go if you do."
Friend: "Didn't hear about it. Where are the free 'cakes?"
Me: "Wha?! You retweeted it earlier."
Friend: "Haha! I did? I must have forgot. Still got Giants fever."

The giveaway was a free half dozen to the first 50 people to stop by the store in honor of the World Series win. Rain didn't stop us from getting them. We were oblivious to the fact that there happened to be a camera crew standing by as we received our goodies. We were stopped on our way out to sign a waiver. Apparently we were taped in a segment that's set to air on tv before the end of the year. Oh wha?! That was certainly a "sweet" surprise. 

The half dozen contained 2 each of Swiss Almond Coconut, Ruby Red Velvet and Aztec Chocolate. Wasn't too wild about the coconut, but the red velvet and chocolate ones were yummy mini pieces of heaven. I figured that after downing a few minis (which were dubbed as "cupcake shots") at another friend's wedding shower the day before, I would take a small hiatus from cupcakes. Wrong! I love these guys too much to let them go. Can't wait to try the rest of the MM menu.
author: Rhia R.

description:
I came here with my cousin and picked up 4 dozen assorted cupcakes for half off, courtesy of HomeRun.  The place is super small and there was a small line that moved fairly quick.  Note: parking sucks so it's best to come with a driver so they can circle the block while you pick up your cupcakes.  

The mini cupcakes are a lot more "mini" than other mini cupcakes.  They're teeny tiny and since they're so small they aren't as moist as cupcakes should be.  We got this deal for our cousin's 1:30pm bridal shower.   By evening time, the left over cupcakes have gotten a little hard.  They sell day old cupcakes for $5 a dozen, which is a deal but I wonder if they're even edible at that point.  

I like how they are pretty creative with their flavors.  The Cinnamon Horchata, and Banana Maple were my favorite.  The regular flavors like Chocolate and Vanilla aren't even worth the calories.  They're two bite mini cupcakes or one bite if you're my BF.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Again, I read my sister's reviews.. and this was within the other spots I've checked out a few minutes prior.

I'm not much of a cupcake guy.... but I gotta admit.. these things looked really good.  We got the dozen.. and we got all flavors (except red velvet - sold out) .

They run a $ each.. but really good and unique too.
author: Roger A.

description:
Raising my rating and saying a big THANK YOU to Mission Mini's!

I ordered a large quantity of their delicious little bites for my birthday party earlier this week.  They were super nice, extremely helpful and more important were no muss, no fuss about me using their Homerun coupon for my order.  In fact they welcomed it.  

The cupcakes were pure deliciousness.  Thanks to Corey and the rest of the gang at Mission Mini's for making this part of my party planning easy- peasy.  

Mission Mini's rocks!!  Nuff said.
author: Russell D.

description: Mission Minis did an amazing job catering for our 40-person baby shower! The cupcakes were delicious, and they did a perfect job with getting everything done just right, especially considering we had very specific instructions for them (among other things, each mini cupcake was filled with a frosting color that we pre-picked). Their service was wonderful and they really were HUGE in making our party super special.
author: Eugene L.

description:
I have tried these Cupcakes from Whole Foods and have to admit they are really GOOD!! So GOOD that when GROUPON had the $11 for 2 dozens I jumped on it and was so excited to order them for EASTER DINNER DESERT, so I called and was told the orders were closed for GROUPON since they had over 120 dozens to bake! HELLO WHY PARTICIPATE WITH GROUPON IF YOU CAN'T HANDLE ALL THE ORDERS! NOW I NEED A PLAN II FOR DESERT! ANY IDEALS?
This is why I am giving them such a low score for customer service! The person on the other end of the phone tells me "you can still come in and buy them here at the store" . LIKE HELLO! WE CAN USE THE GROUPON! Thanks for not trying to HELP!!
author: Vincent D.

description: This place gets 5 stars just for outstanding customer service. Twice I have ordered a cupcake assortment via gmail and ended up showing up AFTER the place closed by a few minutes. Each time I called ahead, and the guy would stay behind for me. The second time, he even gave me a dozen cupcakes for half off because I was a "regular customer." That's like rewarding me with 6 free mini cupcakes for being late. $0.50 per mini! Fantastic!
author: Fawn B.

description:
1st visit to Mission Minis:  
What the hell...only Aztec Chocolate cupcakes were available on a Sunday afternoon?  Blech.  Major FAIL.

2nd visit to Mission Minis:
So we went back the following weekend and all flavors were available except for Ginger Carrot.  We tried one of each flavor.  The verdict: completely disagree with the majority of you Yelpers.  Sorry, but I just don't understand any review over 2 stars.  These cupcakes are dry and flavorless!  More specifically, the cake is especially bland and the frosting is only slightly more flavorful.  It tastes like they beat the batter so much that it turns out tough and chewy, instead of moist and fluffy.  Seriously, you'd be better off baking your own cupcakes out of a Betty Crocker box.  

Another minus is that they are cash only.  There are so many cupcake places around these days, I wouldn't waste my time coming back here.
author: Cianne M.

description:
Likes: cute mini cupcakes with different flavors

Dislikes: kinda on the pricey side
author: Karen M.

description:
Delicious.

Not too rich and just the right amount of sweetness to satisfy that tooth.

The staff are great, the place is clean and it's a perfect place to stop for dessert after enjoying some of the Mission's finest dining.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I grabbed a couple dozen of these for the office when the Mission storefront opened up last year. They were fresh as can be and super delicious. Mini means being able to try more flavors without feeling like a fatty. Unfortunately, I've been back a couple of times and things just weren't as consistent. When my cakes were hand-picked from the display case on a warm day, they seemed a little stale. My theory is that their size doesn't allow them to stay moist for very long (so gobble them up quick). 

My favorites (when super fresh) are Swiss Almond Coconut and Pink Lemonade. Though I'm a fan of lighter frostings.
author: Tony S.

description: Mission Minis is my fave cupcake place in the Bay. $1 for a good sized mini cupcake. Cake is moist and icing is abundant. Best red velvet I've had next to Marita's in San Leandro (which closed). The service has always been awesome. Grab a daily deal if one is available but if not it's not a big deal. It's only $1 a cupcake.
author: Kiristen R.

description:
The owner, Brandon, contacted me after he saw my yelp review.  He apologized for the bad experience I had.  I still wasn't planning on giving this place another shot until I read an SFgate article about how many small local businesses were not prepared to handle the overwhelming Groupon responses. After reading that article, I felt a little more sympathetic.  I decided to give them another shot because I could see the owner cares enough to read his reviews and wants to improve his business and service.  I got in touch with Brandon and he offered to give me a taste test at his store.  

My coworker and I went to meet him today and he was super nice.  It also appeared as if they learned a thing or two from the Groupon fiasco.  He explained all the cupcakes have to be made one day beforehand and that they now keep it in a special storage casing so that it doesn't get too dry.  I was impressed when he told me that they put much less sugar in their cupcake recipes than other stores (such as Kara's) and that they use fresh ingredients like lemon zest for their pink lemonade flavor.  

Now for the actual taste test:  WAY BETTER!  I am glad to say that the cupcakes were now moist, none of the frosting was too sweet, and I loved the vanilla flavor the most.  One word of advice though....is that I think the cupcakes should be a little bigger.  They don't have to be a full cupcake size (after all, they are called Mission Minis), but just a bit bigger.  I think this way the cupcakes wouldn't get stale as easily, there would be a better balance with the frosting, and the clients will feel more satisfied with the price.

I think after this experience, I was very impressed with the owner's business practice.  I would give higher ratings, but I'll save that for the next time I come back for an actual customer service experience.  =)
author: Melanie C.

description:
The whole cupcake thing has really been on the rise but it's difficult because they dry out so fast. So the minis is a cute idea but the one's I tried were not quite up to par. 

Most of the cupcakes I tried were tough and burnt(?!) on the sides and some had an unpleasantly gummy texture in addition to the dryness. However, kudos on the carrot cake and cream cheese frosting bite as it was the one I could've enjoyed a few more of. The cinnamon was alright but again, something about the texture just wasn't quite right. 

The frosting could have been a tad less sweet too but overall it's a "cute" idea and I hear good things about other flavors so "maybe" I'll give it another shot. Considering the plentiful competition it may not happen though.
author: Kat W.

description:
Mission Minis gets a big thumbs up for great customer service and the cupcakes!
I bought a Groupon for them and placed an order via email.  There was an email mis-communication due to the heavy response from the Groupon and I almost didn't get my order.  Mission Minis retracted and placed my order and when I picked up the cupcakes, there was a free dozen gift certificate waiting for me as well!  That is terrific customer service!  Not only that, the cupcakes were a hit!
I live in Nob Hill but I will keep going back to Mission Minis!!!
author: S K.

description:
Brandon's cupcakes appeared in my living room one night this week, and I can't tell you how much it made me love him for that. I'd never met the guy before that night, but if you want to win my favor, just present me with a fresh-baked, home-made, cute mini Mexican chocolate cupcake. My love for you is instant. 

My summation of Brandon's mini cupcake creations comes to this: if he's this smart about winning people over with sweets, imagine how good the sweets are.
author: Kat E.

description:
I ordered Brandon's mini cupcakes to bring to my daughter's classroom on  her fourth birthday.  The cupcakes were a big hit among both the children and the teachers.  The mini-size was perfect for a children's party.  And the flavor was deeeelicious.

I only wish I had ordered more to bring home.  :)
author: Julia Y.

description: These cupcake are ok. My favorite out of all of them is the chocolate peanut butter! I want to try the blueberry one but they sold out.
author: Karen T.

description:
