I had these bites of heaven at Outside Lands this weekend. I'm normally not a sweets eater but the inventive flavors pulled me in. I sampled the Strawberry Lemonade and the Horchata. Both were some of the best cupcakes I've sampled in a while, but first place goes to the Strawberry Lemonade. The tart microplaned lemon peel on top of the frosting cuts the sugary overload that I'm honestly not a fan of. A definite sweet for non sweet eaters to sample!

P.S. I hear they are delivering in SF now via golf cart!?!
author: chelsea b.

description: What a disappointment.!! last weekend  we saw Mission Mini on the food network and being a native from SF i was excited to try them when i was in town again. Well it turn out we were in SF yesterday and we picked up 2 doz at a cost o $24.00. They were stale, dry, not pretty at all, and so so tiny. We will not be going back ,nor will we be recommending this store to our friends.
author: Michelle S.

description:
It seems as if all our volunteers are ending their time.  Our Wednesday volunteer got a job with Mission Minis recently so she doesn't have as much time to come volunteer anymore.  So she decided to bring a special treat for the kiddies to say good-bye and thank you - three dozen cupcakes!!!

I've never been too big of a cupcake fan...until I started going out with A.  He is a cupcake fanatic, so I've had my fair share of cupcakes in the past year.  He claims the black bottom cupcakes that I bake are his absolute favorite.  I'd like to believe him, but I think he's just saying that because I'm his girlfriend.  Still, it's very sweet.

Anyway, she brought the Cinnamon Horchata, Aztec Chocolate, Classic Vanilla, Pink Lemonade, and Peanut Butter Kiss.  I tried the Peanut Butter Kiss and the Aztec Chocolate.  Both of them were really good.  I actually liked the frosting on both the best.  The peanut butter frosting was super peanut-buttery and the Aztec chocolate was just the right consistency and vanilla.  So good and totally bite-sized.  I swiped a half-dozen and took them home for A since he missed out and he loves cupcakes.  Plus, we bought the GroupOn deal for Mission Minis and haven't used it yet, so this was a good preview for what's in store for us.

Definitely give Mission Minis a try.  Although, there weren't any of the Cinnamon Horchata left.  All the kiddies took them.  I asked two of them how it tasted.  One of them said it tasted like nothing and the other just gave me a look and said he didn't like it.  Ah well.  You can't win them all.
author: Kris L.

description:
After a lunch of tapas with my 2 girl friends, we walked down the street to Mission Minis. They were so excited to see the petite size of these cakes.  It was decided to get 6 cupcakes and share between the 3, so we ordered the Cinnamon Horchata, Aztec Chocolate, Ruby Red Velvet, Banana Maple Glaze, Peanut Butter Kiss, Swiss Almond Coconut

We absolutely loved the peanut butter kiss (which essentially tasted like a reese's peanut butter cup...yummy), the aztec chocolate, swiss almond coconut, and banana maple glaze.  These were perfectly moist and sweet.  We all loved the flavored cream cheese frosting on most of the cupcakes.  The horchata cupcake was more cinnamon tasting than horchata.  I imagine it difficult to make a cake taste milky-ricey-cinnamony like the drink.

After eating the half dozen cupcakes, we realized there were only three flavors left to try.  So we walked back in and got the pink lemonade, classic vanilla, and ginger carrot.  Of this batch our hands down favorite was ginger carrot.  It wasn't too gingery, which would have been a turn off for all of us.  It was perfect.  None of us liked the pink lemonade, the lemon flavor was a bit off.  The vanilla was your typical moist and sweet vanilla cupcake.  So, in the end, we liked 7/9 cupcakes, not bad!

I will definately return and will definately tell friends to stop by and try these little goodies.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Nowhere on their website does it say anything about an advance order policy.  I wasn't ordering with a Groupon, I was placing a genuine full price order for 2 dozen minis about 30 hours in advance of my desired pickup.  Instead I was told they have a two-day advance order policy.  Something this important should be CLEARLY listed on your website as I wasted several hours thinking my cupcake order was being filled.  WRONG.  Looks like the search for my friend's birthday cupcakes goes on.  I'll try Mika's cupcakes, at least they need just a 5 hour window and they have only 2 people working!
author: Yolanda B.

description: Cupcakes were ok, nothing special. A bit on the dry side, definitely missing that moisture and they werent flavorful. It was more like a Plain Old Simple Mini Cupcake. Sorry but wont be returning:(
author: Selene P.

description: This place is somewhat a hole in the wall... I got a dozen of the mini cupcakes because I wanted to try all the flavors. Some were sold out though, but my two favorites were banana maple glaze and ginger carrot. I was excited to try the cinnamon horchata, but it was dry. I also got some creme brulee, but I had to ask for it because they didn't have it on display or any signs for it. I read reviews saying that they're really small mini cupcakes, but they're the same size as any mini cupcakes out there.
author: Lily Z.

description: Mission Minis is our favorite cupcake shop!!  Best service! Best selection. Great bakers. The big name places' cupcakes taste like doctored up box mixes. The owners & staff at Mission Minis are always so very friendly, accommodating, making great suggestions. Plus if you're not sure what you want, they let you sample. My husband & I have tried every flavor - All delicious. Our favorite being the red velvet, & blueberry & cream.  $1/mini cupcake is the perfect price.  For $2 you get a special flavor of the day. Excellent!  The cupcakes make a nice dessert, great gift. My husband & I try to stop by whenever we are am in the area.
author: Pam R.

description:
The bakers at Mission Minis have perfected their cupcakes.  
The frosting was always 1st rate but the cupcakes were dry.  Not anymore.  It is now a perfect cupcake.  I've gone to several bakeries (Kara's, Sprinkles, It take the Cake, etc.) trying to find a cupcake worth the cost (without a social coupon).  So far, Mission Minis wins.  Not only are they the best but because they are mini, you can sample several different flavors and not feel guilty.
author: Susan Y.

description:
Horrible customer service! I called Wednesday to place an order for 5 dozen cupcakes to pick up Saturday and was told they are no longer taking orders for Saturday. Uh I thought it says give 48 hours notice?! That's 72 hours I am  giving! The woman on the phone assures me to call ahead on Saturday morning and do a phone order so they can set aside the cupcakes and they will sure have plenty to fulfill my order of the 5 dozen I needed.

So today is Saturday and I called in at 10:08 am and ask the gentleman on the phone if we can do an order for him to set aside some cupcakes for me. His reply was "No we don't do that, and even if I could I am too busy! If you come here in the next hour there might be some cupcakes left" I am a business owner myself and would never reply in that tone or manner. Even if the woman was mistaken on telling me I could call the same day, the gentleman today should of just simply said I'm sorry no we can't.

So now no cupcakes for a graduation party that I had promised. No idea what they taste like because I never got a chance. And never to return.
author: Christina B.

description:
Mission Minis is absolutely fantastic. I first tried their cupcakes at the YoCup in Rincon Center, so I knew exactly what I was getting. The cake is moist and the frosting is perfectly balanced. I love how the cupcakes look really delicate but are packed with flavor! I used to not think of myself as a cupcake snob, but then I moved to San Francisco and tried a few less-than-stellar trendy desserts... and, well, Mission Minis has totally turned me around! I'm not jaded anymore!

Anyway, the business doesn't only earn 5 stars for flavor. I love that they're sold at a bunch of convenient locations like YoCup and Whole Foods. Even better, they deliver. Brandon is a genius for posting photos of tons of mini cupcakes to Twitter... so when I needed a relatively last-minute dessert delivery for my boyfriend's birthday, I tweeted a request and got set up with an order within a day of emailing my many, many questions. Great service! The cupcakes arrived nicely packaged too -- all in cardboard trays that kept the cupcakes apart from each other. Our coworkers couldn't get enough!

I don't want to knock other local businesses too much. To be honest, they make pretty darn good desserts as well. But I do prefer Mission Minis to Miette, Kara's Cupcakes, and Sweet. I think they're reasonably priced ($1 a piece at retail, or $15/dozen including delivery) and perfectly portioned. Since they're fairly small, you can either restrain yourself and not eat too much... or go nuts and eat one of every single flavor ^__^
author: Sharon W.

description: It's mini cupcakes. The portioning is good considered many cupcakes are usually too sweet for me. I tried the horchatta, chocolate, red velvet and banana. They are okay but none are considerably notable
author: Cliff T.

description: I never even knew this place was here. My daughter and I just happend to be in the area yesterday so we stopped by. I was close to closing so it wasn't much of a variety left. My daughter got a red velvet cupcake and enjoyed it. We'll have to stop by a little earlier to try other flavors.
author: Ayana K.

description:
I tried the red velvet flavor today when a coworker treated us.  So I am rating this low without even buyer's remorse for wasting $1.  I DO regret wasting the calories.  The cupcake was DRY and the frosting was lackluster in taste.  For a company specializing in minis, I would have thought they would nail down how to keep these little bites moist.  

I might go here or bring these to a party because they are adorable in presentation, but don't go here expecting your palate or waistline to thank you.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
In a city where there are plenty of options to satisfy the cupcake cravings, Mission Minis just isn't up to par.  

Aztec Chocolate - comparable to Duncan Hines boxed chocolate cake
Cinnamon Horchata - tasted like carrot cake to me
Ruby Red Velvet - really really bland, no richness of the cocoa flavor at all

The only thing they got going for them is their frosting.  So light and smooth and nicely sweetened.  Oh, and free strawberry lemonade!
author: Helen V.

description:
All I have to say is that mission mini's has the cutest lil mini cupcakes! Nestled in the heart of the mission district, it's a small little cupcake place that one wouldn't think even existed in that area.  I am not a big fan of the butter cream topping, so naturally the butter cream topping was a bit repulsive for me.  I can say however that the red velvet was yummy!  I was feeling the pink lemonade and the ginger carrot cupcakes...mmmmMm....

Parking is hard to find here, make sure you do go with a buddy system in place.
author: Shirley H.

description: Come here for portion control..they ONLY have mini sizes and only about 10 flavors.  I'd say these were marginal..nothing special.  They have unique flavors such as cinnamon horchata, but I certainly didn't get any unique horchata flavor in that 'bite'..I mean - mini cupcake.
author: Rissa R.

description:
Best deal in town when it comes to miniature cupcakes. First of all - they are simply delicious! Also, I have never seen kids to be so excited about the choice of dessert! My personal favorites: pink lemonade with crispy pieces of real lemon zest and red velvet with cream cheese topping. 

At about $1 a piece - you cannot go wrong with their variety of flavors for any type of party. What I like the best: is to forgo messy cake-cutting. To get it right, you need to add about 3 minis for one "normal"-size cupcake. 

Super-friendly service, nice hardworking staff. I do not mind their nook-in-the-wall "pick-up only" setting, however, I think that some coffee and few tables would be a plus. 

Cons: I would appreciate a little more effort to make the cakes appropriate for our kinds' B-day party. Colorful sparkles on frosting and a little more than a plane white box would have been handy.
author: Lana L.

description:
I'd been hankering for a cake lately and I had seen this place between the WellsFargo and the jewelry shops on 22nd. I walked in and it seemed closed but I was told "i'm open for you. we just baked some cakes." It felt nice to literally be welcomed in. There was a kid roaming around the shop, sitting in the window, and then under the counter and it was funny because as the guy working got my cakes he said to the kid, "hold on. i have a customer. does it hurt that bad? are you sure it's growing pains? you didn't just hit your leg?" and the kid was now laying down on a metal shelf. i thought it was cute to hear this guy have a discussion with a little kid about growing pains. it made the experience even cuter.

on a total product based note, i got all different kinds of cakes (he even threw one in for free) and my favorite is officially the swiss almond coconut. creamy, moist and pretty. to that person who bashed this place and said they'd rather eat hostess, go ahead. i think your mouth might be broken though. i like local businesses popping up and doing what they do well.
author: Aurora B.

description:
Being the financially savvy yelper that I am, I decided to take advantage of the recent Group-on promotion for Mission Mini. I placed my order for two dozen mini cupcakes over the phone 72 hours in advance and was told that I would receive an email confirmation. So the morning I was supposed to pick up my order, I called again to confirm. Unfortunately, the employee I spoke with originally had never placed my order. Fortunately, the lady I spoke with over the phone was super flexible and made sure to process my order right away so that it would still be ready at my original pick up time. 

Cupcake night with my roomies was salvaged after all! We thoroughly enjoyed
- Pink Lemonade
- Red Velvet
- Swiss Almond Coconut 
- Horchata! 

Horchata and Pink Lemonade were my favorites. These are cupcakes that should be devoured within the first two days. Due to their rather petite size they dry out quickly!
author: Marissa P.

description:
3.5 stars

i used my townhog coupons and ordered cupcakes for my family. we had the red velvet, cinnamon horchata, aztec chocolate, maple banana glaze, peanut butter kiss and classic vanilla. 

red velvet- very dry with a weird after taste, maybe they were from the day old batch when i did a phone order but i'm not sure? but TTTC or cups and cakes red velvet were better, just the dryness threw me off.

cinnamon horchata, aztec chocolate, classic vanilla, peanut butter kiss- these were my  favorites all were very moist and and tasty. the frosting was kind of sweet but it wasn't overly done. these were simply perfect.

maple banana it was average, i loved the banana taste but i dont really like banana cake too much.

i will be back again for the other cupcakes but for sure i will give the red velvet cupcakes another chance hopefully they wont be so dry next time!
author: Stella J.

description:
This are the greatest cupcakes! Everyone is different! They all have a very moist flavorful taste. I have been to the bakery and now can get them at the local Wholefoods stores.

Thank you Mission Minis!!!!
author: Jane D.

description:
Yummy! Pink lemonade and Aztec chocolate the first time. I really liked pink lemonade and my bf liked the aztec chocolate. 5 STARS.

The second time I came here, I got every flavor except classic Vanilla and Ginger Carrot was sold out. I wasn't impressed..sadly.. The cake part was dry and it didn't taste that good. I even came in the morning when its "suppose" to be fresh. It was disappointing.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Given all the average reviews, I had low expectation so it was better than I had expected.  We didn't eat ours the day of and had it in ther refrigerator overnight but did let it come back to room temp before eating it.  The plus are: the frosting aren't overly sweet; it's mini size so you can eat several different flavors it's cheap; .  The average is that the cake is a tad on the drier side than I would like.  I wouldn't mind going again to try a few other flavors if I'm in the area that I didn't get to, but wouldn't go out of my way to get it.
author: Irene C.

description:
Cute trend. 

Cheapest one that I've found in SF.  Other places are charging $1.50-2/mini, which is ludicrous because its flour, water, & sugar in a 1" diameter.  

A little dry.  Honestly - I'd rather  just make the cupcakes myself.  

If you go- I recommend the horchata, banana, & red velvet cupcake.
author: Deanna A.

description:
I had 2 dozen delivered for my birthday. Wow -- love the Mini! Just the right size and not too sweet.

Nothing like them on the Central Coast or the Peninsula for that matter.
author: Steve O.

description:
Not bad. We jumped at the Groupon when they offered it for a bridal shower we were hosting.

They really are mini. I think my favorite was the chocolate peanut butter one. Mainly because I think peanut butter frosting is delicious.

Other than that, nothing was super amazing. It was cheap with the Groupon, a great crowd pleaser. The cake itset was a little dry. But if you're on a diet and like cupcakes but want to cheat a little, the portion sizes are perfect!
author: Beverly T.

description:
Pretty friendly staff, addictive minis, just wished they had better deals, a buck a pop is too much when you can eat a mini in one bite....

Overall, nice place, clean, cool concept, and I find myself going back pretty often ;)
author: Rene V.

description:
I'm wondering if the collective consciousness of Yelper's taste buds has gone on vacation.  Mission Minis' cupcakes are really awful.

The cake is dry.  And that's inexcusable.   Some flavors (I'm being liberal here, there's very little "flavor") are way too sweet.  The ones which are not too sweet just don't taste like much of anything.

The frostings are just dreadful.  First, there's hardly any.  I'm sorry and sloppy big dollop sitting atop a cupcake like a plastic Walgreen's shower cap is not appealing.  You can tell by the photos . . . .something unnatural is going on in the frosting here and it's not pretty or tasty.

Some cupcakes have slopped on drizzles of mystery sugary swill.  Again, not appealing.  And certainly not tasty.

I've been making cupcakes and cakes since I was tall enough to reach the mixer while standing on a chair.   Cakes made from those cheap just add an egg mixes are better than Mission Minis cupcakes.  

They are absolutely not calorie worthy.   They are not worthy of the flour and eggs wasted to make them.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description: Great local place for mini cupcakes! Aztec Chocolate is the best!!! $1/cupcake, but they also have day-old ones which taste just as great for less! And for those of you who don't know, the pastry chef was on cupcake wars and did very well!!! :)
author: Carol J.

description:
I'm a fan because of the bloomspot coupon I got!  2 dozen mini cupcakes for $12!  What a great deal.

The coupon states that it would be a variety chosen by the baker, but when I called in my order, the guy said I could just choose what I wanted!  (Since I was picking up on a Saturday and he was pretty confident they would have all the flavors!)

I wouldn't mind getting a potpourri of flavors, it makes life a little bit more interesting.

I will definitely be back, since the service was great, and the cupcakes are so cute and yummy! (and I have more coupons left!)

Don't forget to bring lots of coins to feed the parking meter!
author: Beth M.

description:
3.44 stars...

Love mini cupcakes because you never feel too guilty. Mission Mini's has definitely done a good job with them. 

But....they could be better...and they could be a heck of a lot more organized when customers are placing orders, too! I understand that they have gotten slammed with Groupon orders, but my thought is if you can't handle it, don't do it. Not only was I told my order was "out of luck" because they didn't have access to the particular email account that is listed on their website, but after that was cleared up with the manager, they managed to MESS THE ORDER UP!  

Minimum order = 2 dozen. I order 2 dozen. I receive 20/24 cupcakes. Wha wha what?!

Meh.

The swiss almond coconut ones are the best, with the cinnamon horchata running a close second. There is a lavendar lemony one that I find at Philz coffee ever-so-often and it is very good as well. That said, I will not order from them again and instead go a la carte should I crave a trip to their shop--or just get them from Philz.
author: Tysen C.

description: Bought cupcakes for my daughter's 2nd bday party this morning and they were perfect.  I pushed it to the last minute and Eduardo helped me choose the flavors I wanted and put me at ease.  Thanks, Eduardo!
author: liora k.

description: It was almost 3pm and they only had 2 flavors left, booooo! They sold out of the other 10 flavors earlier that day. But the two that were left were their most popular: the ruby red velvets and cinnamon horchatas. These are perfect if you just want a bite of sweetness. The cake was moist and had a good flavor. Also available are a day old cupcakes and sold for a 2 for 1 price. Come early if you want more of a variety!
author: Neva R.

description: I picked up 2 dozen minis for my office the other day. I had never had them before, but I had wanted to try them especially since they are nearby. I got 2 dozen variety of all the flavors they had everyone in my office LOVED them- I had the blueberry one which was sweet, but not too sweet and it was the perfect few bites. I heard good things about most of the flavors: lemon, PB, red velvet and coconut especially. Overall cute set up and very tasty cupcakes.
author: Nicole S.

description: I'm all for cupcakes...I love cupcakes. Different sizes and flavors, it doesn't matter. I needed to kill time and stumbled upon this place. It was the perfect place to sit down and have a snack. The cupcakes are what they are: mini. And that's probably a good thing. I had the pumpkin spice and the Aztec chocolate. Both very good and enough to satisfy a craving. When I am in the area again, I will stop right in! Love!
author: Mel P.

description: There isn't anything too wrong with Mission Minis.  The staff are friendly, the location is fine, there is metered parking out front.  But, honestly, the cupcakes aren't all that amazing.  Of the many cupcakeries in the city, this one is definitely on the lower side in terms of my preference because the cake and frosting taste a bit stale to me (like they were baked a few days ago and weren't properly stored).
author: Banana S.

description:
I like Mission Minis! I was able to try them at two events during my stay in San Francisco... They are moist, the frosting is balanced in flavor, and they are the perfect sweet bite. I like that the frosting is light and not crazy sugary. I like that the cupcake keeps its shape and can be eaten without crumbling.

FYI's~
* I would like to try more! I have only done a tasting of basic flavors and desire to see what else can be packed into a little cupcake...
author: Natalie W.

description: I am a huge fan of Brandon and his mini cupcake operation! I am a special event caterer and Mission Minis are one of my go-to dessert offerings. They are consistently snatched up at my events and the variety of flavors are a sure fire way to please a diverse crowd. The mini-format also allows my clients to enjoy more that one and they always do. Keep up the great work Brandon and crew!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Mission Minis is a great little spot in the Mission where you can get just the right sized desserts at just the right sized price. At 1$ each they are the perfect amount of indulgence for my sweet tooth and my wallet.

Each cupcake tastes like it has been baked with love. :)

Today for a friend's birthday we had pumpkin spice cupcakes. They were ideal for a lovely fall afternoon in the city.
author: Cara L.

description:
I was on an emergency cupcake hunt for my hubby's and my anniversary last month. I needed to find some red velvet cupcakes and I needed them fast. Long story. 

So I'm in the car searching on yelp, and this place comes up. I call. The head guy, Brandon, answers and tells me that he's got a bunch leftover from a delivery today and that if I wanna come pick them up, he'll be around in about 1 hour. Sure enough, he calls me one hour later and tells me where to meet him. He also asked me if I wanted any other flavors. "I'll give you a dozen."

Yes, I know this sounds like an odd transaction for cupcakes, but just go with me on this. 

I show up, and Brandon meets me outside with a dozen mini cupcakes wrapped up and ready to go: 3/4 red velvet, and 1/4 cinnamon horchata. Nicest guy ever. Wouldn't take any money. Wasn't weird. 

The cupcakes were delicious and the hospitality was top notch. I would definitely support Mission Mini's again - they deliver!!!! Thanks, Brendan!!!!
author: Anne Y.

description: Yes, it's a hole in the wall. There is nothing fancy about this place. The cupcakes aren't for show. Cupcakes are for eating!!! I've been to the location once because they were kind enough to donate a gift certificate to an event I was hosting. And recently a friend bought me some as a present. They were assorted. They were delicious. They didn't last long. :)
author: Nao D.

description: Cute little stamp size cupcake bakery.  Minis are yummy.  My favorite is the Horchata.  We bought these to share with friends we were meeting up with and everyone was a happy camper with the minis for dessert!  Thank you Mission Minis; staff is nice too!
author: Steph C.

description:
I ordered from here before there was a store in the Mission. The service was excellent. The 3 flavors we got for my friend's birthday party were yummy & the best part, less expensive than any other option I explored that was open to us. 

We had the pink lemon-aid, Aztec chocolate & red velvet. 1 dozen of each. They delivered them to us free of charge (we were in their delivery zone) & delivered them to us on time. 

My friend, who's birthday it was, has since called to ask where I got them because he wanted to buy some for a party he was going to.

I like the ratio of frosting to cake, I can see why some people say it's dry but I like a drier cake so that was a plus in my book. Out of the 3 dozen we got for that party there was maybe 4 cupcakes left.
author: Joanna P.

description:
I have mixed feelings about Mission Minis.  I've purchased them twice now for parties and they were ok.  They tend to be on the dry side.  The first time I bought them for a party it was a little hard so not sure if they were day old or over baked.  I bought 2 dozens so got a little of each flavor.
Red velvet and vanilla are good.
Others are ok.
There are other places that are better.
author: Ai C.

description: Pretty good and I love the mini concept.    Very friendly when working with them.
author: Tracey M.

description: They had Peanut Butter and Jelly on the day that I swung by, and I could have easily eaten a dozen of those they were so good.  But in the interest of fairness I tried the Vegan Banana and Classic Vanilla too...also delicious!
author: Heidi D.

description: I have to say that the response I received to my original review was so friendly, accountable, and professional, that that in itself, earned Mission Minis another 2 stars from me. They did it exactly how it's supposed to be done. They reassured me that I caught them on an off day when I saw the dirty kitchen; they offered to send me a complete list of their ingredients, and they offered me a free 1/2 dozen cupcakes as a thank-you if I want to try them again. Folks, that is how a business should be run, and, frankly, though I do not like their cupcakes, I like their style--A LOT. Whoever is handling their YELP reviews should get a raise. Well done.
author: reverend d.

description:
My cupcake culinary adventure results....

Cups and Cakes Bakery 5
Love at First Bite 4.75
Mission Minis 4.15
Noe Valley Bakery & Bread Company 4
Miette Patisserie 4
Cafe Madeleine 3.75
Leonidas Chocolates 3.5
Market Hall Bakery 3.25
Sibbys Cupcakery 3.25
Urban Bread 3
Cako Bakery 2.5
Bay to Breakers Cupcake Girls 2.1
Cupkates 2

The texture and taste of Mission Minis' icing is excellent.
author: Anna S.

description:
In as much as I hate posting a negative rating (This 1 star is my lowest rating ever), I just have to do this to help the local Business.  I hope they read this.

I'll start with what went right.

1 star for the awesome frosting & bite-sized portions.

Now, the bad news...

-3 stars for service.  

My fiancée & I finally got time to cash in our Groupon deals (2 coupons for 2 dozen each) since we planned to be in SF last weekend (We drove from the Peninsula - 30-40 mins away from The Mission).  We both emailed our order 2 days prior to pick with our cupcake order & time of pick up & we both got a confirmation email w/ a pdf invoice of our order.  Being at the Mission, parking was & will always be an issue so we decided to just have my fiancée pick our orders while I drive around looking for a place to park (I should deduct the only star left for this but it's not really their fault).  

After being in line for almost 15 minutes (yep, for a pick up order, this IS a long wait), the people who worked there told her they can't give her my order (even though she had my coupon print-out) & that I had to go inside & claim it myself.  To add insult to injury, they did not prepare her order & since it was late in the day, they RAN OUT of the flavors she wanted. So, disappointed & obviously annoyed, my fiancée filled me in & I went in for my order (while blocking traffic mind you).  I got inside, waited for 5 minutes & was shocked (not really) that they could not find my order.  So, they also did not prepare my order & asked me if I can still remember my order. I showed them the pdf of my order in my phone (as proof that I ordered, paid & got a confirmation) & was told they ran out of Red Velvet.  So basically they just gave me a random box of SOMEONE ELSE's order (I guess, if you don't show up, they sell your order-- I sure hope they only do that to people who haven't paid).  The guy even promised that the cupcakes were made today & are fresh (REALLY?).  I just took whatever they gave me & went back to our car.

-1 star for Inventory & Cupcake Taste/Quality/Value

I understand they owners/employees want to avoid waste & only make cupcakes that would sell for the day in order to keep the freshness legit but come on.. they have been open for sometime & they should have an idea on what flavors sell out & which ones that do not. Or at least bake a new batch if you are about to run out.. hello, the bakery is just right behind you.

As for taste/quality... granted they have awesome tasting frosting but that doesn't even make up for the fact that most of the cupcakes were dry.  It made me question if the random box I got was actually fresh.  I have read other reviews & i'm not alone w/ this gripe.  Being priced at $1 a mini cupcake, we expected to be blown away.  

We weren't.

We recommend alternatives for cupcake lovers (and we are cupcake lovers) such as:

That Takes The Cake in Union St at SF, CA -- Parking not much of an issue & the cakes were really moist & the frostings are amazing.  But come in early, they bake their cupcakes in the East Bay so they also have the inventory issues of Mission Minis

Sibby's Cupcakery in San Mateo, CA -- They have no store front so all orders are email/call in orders 48 hours before pick up.  They confirm & collect payment even before you pick up your order so the pick up would be fast & quick (also, if you come in late in the day and if they have extras, you can buy some more).  My fiancée's coworkers gave her a dozen full sized cupcakes as an engagement day gift (Frosting was custom built to have rings and "i do" on the cakes).  I can still taste the awesome cupcakes & frosting.  Excellent product & service.

Icing on the Cake from Los Gatos, CA -- Awesome tasting cupcakes & great selection of flavors.

Sprinkles in Stanford Mall Palo Alto, CA -- Not really a big fan of Sprinkles but their cupcakes are better than Mission Minis. Plus, my coworker follows them on Twitter so he scores free cupcakes. 

The Cupcakery in Las Vegas (more like Henderson), NV - Yep, I even took home 2 dozen of these babies from Las Vegas.  The cupcakes stayed moist up to a day after we got home in SF.  An amazing feat considering we bought them in the middle of the desert.  Frosting was great too.

Magnolia Bakery in the Greenwich Village in NY- If the name sounds familiar, yes it is the cupcake place Carrie Bradshaw had her cupcake fix.  There was a line but it was worth it.  Frosting was creamy & yes.. the cakes were moist too.

So there you go. I hope the owners of Mission Minis would get their act together & fix these issues. Granted we used a Groupon deal so our orders were not "worth" as much as walk-in customers, but a customer is a customer.  Groupon was your chance to hook new customers.  But you failed to wow us and we may never come back. 

Please, improve your service and fix the dry issue. I hate to see a local business suffer because of issues the owners can do WAY better.
author: Arnold V.

description:
I took a 'Mission Mini' cupcake class with a groupon and had a blast! Veronica was an amazing teacher. Our class flavor was vanilla with butter creme frosting....yum! The 2hr class flew by. We prepared, baked and decorated our mini cupcakes; sampling as we went along. The best part - taking home our 2 dozen mini cupcakes! 

Mission Minis - May I suggest posting your cupcake class schedule with prices and flavors on your website?  I would love to sign up for another 'flavor' to learn from you.
author: Julie M.

description:
I see most of these recent reviews are Groupon focused, so I thought I'd take some time to talk about what Mission Minis is like for the Joe Average:

It's great. The cupcakes are great (as most of the reviews point out), and the service is great. I was usually getting my Mission Minis from nearby coffee shops, but their shop is awesome and always has some weird new flavor... which is really what I want. 

The red velvet is awesome, but I'm always anxious to see what new cupcake experiments they have in the shop.
author: Doc P.

description:
I randomly came here one day while wandering around the mission.

Some notes:
- $1!  Perfect for a quick bite for somebody that can't just decide on one flavor (I'd rather pay $1 for 3 mini's vs. $3 for one big cupcake).

- The store was deserted - I had to wait about 5 minutes before anybody came out - I checked around the back and they were busy baking.

- Cute flavor combinations - I wanted to love them.

- Unfortunately, each of the 3 mini's I ate (this was around noon) were all very dry.    I do understand though - it's very easy to overbake mini cupcakes.

- Horchata - good flavor, but dry.  This was my favorite of the 3.
- Swiss Almond Coconut - this didn't really taste like anything, unfortunately, and I normally really like this flavor combination.  Also was dry.
- Pink lemonade - light on flavor, and dry.

I give it 3 stars for keeping the price reasonable - I would still come back to satisfy my sweet tooth and to see what new flavors they might have.
author: Lana Y.

description: I love the way they look and the size, but the taste doesn't match some other cupcakes I've had...
author: Megan M.

description: Mission Mini's cupcakes are good enough to eat... like 4 dozen in one sitting.  We ordered 96 for our baby shower, and they were all eaten before lunch was over.  I mean seriously, how can 96 little cupcakes get eaten so quickly?  I really have no idea, since I was still grilling when they disappeared.  Luckily, we sampled each flavor when we made the order.  The horchata was excellent, as was the red velvet.  The entire cupcake is really mini and bite sized.  I ripped them in half and stacked the bottom to make little, bite sized, cupcake sandwiches.  :-)    If this place was closer to the house, I'd be picking up a few dozen every week!
author: ROB L.

description: Based on the Yelp reviews and a number of friends that love this place, I had to try it.  I brought home 4 minis for the family.  They were not good or memorable.  The cake itself was not light or fluffy.  The taste was not great either.  The frosting was just ok.  I am not sure why everyone likes this place. I certainty think CupKate's put Mission Mini cupcakes to shame.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Mission Minis is a cute spot to stop and get a sweet treat when out and about in the Mission. 

The Meyer Lemon Creme is a perfect bite.  Every time.
author: Mea A.

description:
I can see Mission Minis from my office across the street. I think about cupcakes a lot.

We regularly pick up cupcakes from Mission Minis for office events, birthdays, and just because. Veronica (the baker and counter person) and Diego (the counter person) are both very friendly and remember us, which is a nice feeling.

Favorite flavors: peanut butter kiss, classic vanilla, Swiss coconut.

It's a tiny place, but since we're based in the same block, taking them back to the office is easy (although sometimes one or two will disappear between the store and the office, so we usually buy a few extra).
author: Stacey H.

description:
A friend purchased 3 doz cupcakes for a baby shower.  Went in to check out the flavors and ask if they had cupcake stands to rent for the party.  Yes they did.  Bonus!  We were shown 2 really cute wire cupcake stands (that are free loaners), perfect for our event!  Each stand holds 2 doz.  We purchased a 4th dozen to fill up the 2 stands.  Asked if we should take the stands now or wait til Saturday for our Sunday event.  "They'll be here waiting for you on Saturday afternoon, no problem."  Great!  One less thing to do, run around to buy cupcake stands.

Saturday afternoon:  Went in to pick up the mini cupcakes and 2 stands.  The manager guy tells me "Sorry, but I can't find the stands"  "We usually keep better track of them, but we don't know where they are."  "We've been looking for them all day and have no idea where they are."  We can let you use this other stand for free...  A large white plastic 3 tier stand meant for 6-8 dozen cupcakes. Me:  My 4 dozen cupcakes are gonna look really lonely on that huge stand.  Him:  Yeah, this stand is meant for a bigger order.  But you can unscrew it and have only 2 tiers, that should help.    Want me to do it for you?  Me:  Nope.  I'll take it as is and see what the party hostess wants to do.  No need to write about that encounter...   As I'm walking out the door, totally disappointed, and not understanding why no one called us to give us a heads up that we'd have to figure out something else, the manager guy tells me this:  "We need you to bring back that cupcake stand in 2 days for another order"  REALLY??
author: Kim A.

description: Yay cupcakes! Always support your local ma n pa. Brandon caters for any sort of event, but his little bundles of joy can be found at several coffee shops, including Sugarlump. His cupcakes are better than Sprinkles, and on par with Sweet Constructions (though the latter specializes more in cookies). Of the three, he certainly has the best visual appeal. Thanks to Michelle for the recommendation!
author: Esther L.

description:
Thank you Yelp for helping me find Brandon and Mission Minis!

I emailed Mission Minis to see if they would consider delivering to Daly City, since I'm in Laguna Beach and wanted to send some tasty little cakes to a friend on his birthday. 

Not only did they deliver with perfect timing and a personal note, but my friend called immediately to tell me how amazingly delicious the cupcakes are! 

I can only go by the happy eating sounds on the phone, but the combination of four flavors were a big hit. He got the Cinnamon Horchata, Ruby Red Velvet,  Aztec Chocolate, and Swiss Almond Coconut (his personal favorite).

Next time I'm close enough, I will make sure and visit the store and thank Brandon and his crew. Every detail was perfect, from the invoice to the follow up. No worries from 500 miles away. That's service!
author: Allyn B.

description: Last year on my birthday (which happened to start of VERY badly), I was driving into the city to visit my sister and go to Outsidelands.  I stopped at my sister's place so we could walk to the park and she surprised me with a little box with three mini cupcakes.  She turned my day around!  It was mostly her surprising thoughtfulness, but those cupcakes were darn good too!  I can't exactly remember the flavors she picked, but the cakes were moist and the frosting was perfect.  Perfect little bites!
author: Shawn Y.

description: I haven't been to their shop but I had some today courtesy of my office & while not good for the waistline - delicious!  I tried the pink lemonade and the aztec chocolate flavors and both were delicious!  Love me some mini cupcakes (well cupcakes of all sizes actually) - these are adorable, perfect for parties.
author: Suzanne V.

description: Mini Deliciousness!! I tired the red velvet and the horchata ones. I like that they're mini cuz you can just pop them in your mouth. If you walking around Mission you should defintely give it a chance! I mean they're $1. I gave it 4 stars because they close too early
author: Victor G.

description:
I can only comment on the peanut butter and red velvet because they ran out of everything else.  So if you're picking up an assortment for a party, call beforehand.  

Peanut butter cake tasted kind of weird but frosting was good.  Red velvet was good.
author: jen b.

description:
I went here with my boyfriend on a gorgeous San Francisco day and was greeted by 2 employees who seemed like they were thinking "damn, another customer, which one of us has to deal with the pain of helping yet another customer." After seeing there faces, I immediately felt uncomfortable and just stared at the cupcakes in front of me. The girl didn't even ask me anything or even explain which cupcakes were available, she just added to the awkward silence. The other person was on the phone and was obviously unhappy. So I asked for a cinnamon horchata cupcake and she finally opened her mouth and said we sold out already. She then says that the flavors available are on the board above. I am already not feeling this place and quickly order a ruby red velvet, aztec chocolate, banana maple glaze and peanut butter kiss. The cupcakes were okay and were $1 each. The banana apple glaze was my favorite but as my boyfriend said it was a good mini muffin more than anything. 

I am willing to give this place another chance and hopefully it gets better because I really do want to try the cinnamon horchata. Please don't fail me next time.
author: Jayne A.

description: We dropped by their one year anniversary event for a little bit and scored a couple of mini cupcakes. The cinnamon horchata is still as amazing as ever but the strawberry lemonade I tired for the first time and did not care too much for. Thanks for the freebies and happy anniversary!
author: Helen L.

description:
Absolutely a fantastic experience!  Brandon called me back within minutes.  The prices are more than reasonable.  The order arrived on time - early even.  The presentation is outstanding - very cute little cakes in individual place holders to easily take them out without messing them up.  Not to mention the fact that the cupcakes are delicious!  I would give you an extra star if I could!

These guys thought of everything and perfected it.  Kara's could learn a thing or two from Mission Minis :)
author: Amanda S.

description: The Lady's Secret Cookie Company is an Incredible new cookie line... Mancatcher (Choco/bacon) and a vegan gluten-free version of the Mancatcher... light and crispy and tastes like real bacon delights.... Incredible and good for you... Bravo
author: Charles D.

description: They sell out quick. Get there right when it opens, camp out the night before, or pay someone to get them for you (because parking is a biatch), ha!
author: Ro R.

description: My favorite cupcakes! I am not a big fan of cupcake mania, but these cupcakes are really good. And they're small too so you can just inhale them! I think the small cupcakes are a great idea, because you can try all the flavors...and also they are not too sweet like a lot of cupcakes.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Sampled these last night @ SF Weekly's Dish event.  Wowza...of the three flavors (chocolate, red velvet, lemon), the lemon was this chocoholic's fave, so you can imagine how exceptional it was!!

I'm heading into the city to pick up a dozen. (-:
author: rhonda s.

description: Highly disappointed with the cupcakes.   I ordered 4 dozen, 4 different flavors and the cupcakes were dry while the frosting was fresh.  It was like they baked the cupcakes 1-2 days before and then added fresh frosting the day of.  The only plus was they looked good!
author: Michelle B.

description:
The staff was SUPER nice.
Their cash register is antique looking and adorable.

Presentation: Wonderful!
Names: Fun and unique
Frosting: Good
Cupcake: OK, alittle underwhleming, dryish, not fluffy...nor dense...hard to by my finger on it.

All this said, this a solid place, not my #1 go-to, but if I'm in the area and I'm hankering a cupcake, I'll drop in.
author: Angel L.

description:
I used my $12 Plum District coupon for $24 worth aka 24 of the delightful mini-cupcakes to take to the office and share the not too sweetness and delictably, moist mini-cutenesses.  Here's a link for Plum District:
https://www.plumdistrict.com/?ref=uf497aaf4383
On street parking was a snap at 12pm so no problem there...would be nice if they had kind of a flavor key so you know what the cupcakes are before you sample them or pass them out to office coworkers.  
Personally I love cupcakes and office staff noted that unlike some other mini-cupcakes, Mission Minis somehow manage to keep the tiny, underlying cupcake moist and "You ain't seen nothin' till you're down on the muffin..." as Aerosmith so eloquently stated in their tender, love song.
Wow. these cupcakes make you horny ... ahaha ~ 
Actually I could envision (I bet you could) some awesome lovemaking scenarios that involve these mini-cupcakes BUT that's another story ... okay, the frosting is kind of erotic ... Mini-cupcake orgy !!!   Ahaha ~
So dear Yelpers, if you want sexy-ass mini-cupcakes, well, you hella know where to go now.
Seriously, they make some really special tiny cupcakes so even if it wasn't an unresistable Plum District deal, you can't go wrong.
The cashier girl could be a bit more outgoing and friendly but at least your order is already boxed and ready to go ... they travel well in those boxes, so you know ... okay, now I'm all hot and bothered ... ahaha ~ 4U ~cupcakes on ME ...
author: Terry A.

description: I was walking by Mission Minis today and couldn't resist.  I couldn't decide between the aztec chocolate and the coconut almond.   I asked the lady behind the counter if the aztec chocolate had cinnamon in it (like mexican chocolate) and she said yes so I decided to go with that one.  I think I like these better than Kara's...the frosting sold me and they're nice and moist.  My only complaint is the aztec chocolate did NOT have cinnamon in it and they are a smidge too small...I could have easily eaten 3 of them.  I think I'll go for a dozen next time.
author: anne m.

description:
Just came here tonight with my boyfriend :)

Of course, we came around 7 so it was pretty late. there wasn't really much left to choose from. The only choices we had were the cinnamon horchata, peanut butter and jelly, and another one that was ginger flavored? They only had the mini size left so I was kind of bummed about that. ESPECIALLY after I tried their cinnamon horchata! 

That cupcake was moist and delicious. The frosting was not overly sweet. All in all, it was just delicious! I hope to come back here at an earlier time so I can get a regular size one. :D

Service was quick, too. The guy stood there patiently while I tried to choose what I want. He didn't rush us. And after we paid, I took a while to get organized. He didn't look annoyed or anything. He just smiled and continued what he was doing. So that's a bonus.
author: Jessica T.

description:
the unique flavors lured me into this establishment. the assortment of mini-cupcakes along with the presentation of these dainty looking treats was a great first impression.....

.....thus i settled on getting one of each of the 10 flavors available that day. i was really looking forward to the cinnamon horchata since it was not as common of a flavor in pastries. so in my head im thinking a vibrant cinnamon explosion based on the name and the shade of the cupcake. it was upsetting to find that was not the case. the cinnamon was subtle and the frosting tasted very plain, though it did have a light sprinkle of cinnamon on top. the cake was semi-moist on this cupcake and on the others. i found the other flavors to be mediocre as well, until i came across the peanut butter kiss cupcake. the combo of the rich peanut butter frosting and the semi-moist chocolate cake was great. there was a nice saltiness to the frosting that gave it that extra kick.

the staff was pleasant but the storefront was not. minimal space to sit and enjoy treats and there seem to be some unnecessary hardware in the retail area. on to the next cupcakery...
author: Ryan E.

description: Very tiny cupcakes for a buck.. Felt like splurging when I went there, that's why I bought a few, but if I was in my right mind idk if I would pay a dollar for a literally one bite size cupcake. But the cupcakes taste decent, better than others I tried in the city.
author: Patrick L.

description:
I was never really that into cupcakes until Mission Minis came along....and that's when my addiction started. 

The first time I tried them was when my coworker graciously brought 2 dozen into work one morning. Needless to say, it was the best cupcake breakfast I've ever had. 

One of the coolest things about Mission Minis is how many delicious and creative flavors they have. Cinnamon horchata and pink lemonade? You rarely see flavors like that at other bakeries. The cupcakes are always moist, and the cream cheese frosting is absolutely amazing...probably my favorite part. Most other cupcakes have crappy "cake frosting" (for lack of the proper name) on them, which I'm not a very big fan of. 

The price is right too. $1 for a mini cupcake is totally reasonable.

It's a good thing I don't live anywhere near the bakery on Mission street or else cupcakes would become my main food staple!
author: Isaac W.

description:
I was on my way to the Bank and past this place. After, I found myself going into this place and got a Banana Maple and Ginger Carrot. I liked it, not bad. 

I have to admit that $1 for one of these "half a dollar" size mini cupcakes is more than I would spend. Now anyone that bakes knows how hard it is to have moist cupcakes, especially that small and it was a little dry, but it still wasn't too bad. 

My Daughter heard about this place and couldn't believe that I didn't bring any home for her. So, today I got her the Ruby Red Velvet and Cinnamon Horchata; her favorite was the Cinnamon Horchata. Now she's ready to try others. Guess, I'll be going back.
author: Naomi H.

description: Glad Mission Minis' cupcakes are $1. Minis shouldn't cost more than that... regular sized cupcakes are overpriced too.
author: Mimi L.

description: Ordered some mini's online on a Wednesday with the disclaimer saying you have to order 48hrs in advance. It doesn't ask you for a pick-up date either. Arrived on a Friday with my little print-out and was told my order was made for yesterday (Thursday). WTF? I guess that's why they took that option off online... I explained and the guy at the counter apologized and asked when I needed the cupcakes so they can whip up the flavors I ordered. It was too late so I just picked out the ones they had in the front. It was the usual chocolate, horchata, red velvet, and coconut. I have yet to try the other flavors, but I'm glad it's close enough to home so I can! I love the bite-sized cupcakes. They even make specially colored ones for different holidays! Very festive and cute. Just make sure you order thru the phone... I will be back!
author: Wendy L.

description: Decent but unremarkable cupcakes. The Aztec chocolate was especially disappointing... no spiciness at all. Cinnamon horchata was better.
author: Kimberley D.

description: I bought cupcakes here for my daughters 1st birthday and everyone loved them. As tradition I am going to buy cupcakes from here every year for her birthday and birthday parties at school. They are so yummy....we love the horchata and red velvet cupcakes. They are so good and perfect for little children and for gourmet cupcakes they are not that expensive.
author: Sophia R.

description:
I love them I love them I love them!

lil bits of deliciousness... 

And Brandon is the most helpful business owner I have ever ran into, and that is saying a lot since I am a frequent shopper ;) He really helped me out when I was in a bind, I will forever remember his hospitality.

* But People, please remember to not take advantage of his willingness to help and make unreasonable demands! 

These are great cupcakes, and it feels good to get them from such an honest and locally owned shop!

I HEART MISSION MINIS :D
author: stormy s.

description: so i guess you can't really beat it for $1 for a mini cupcake (and I used a scoutmob deal for 50% off, making them only $0.50), but I wasn't too impressed. they tasted like normal cupcakes i could make at home. and again, a good deal for the price, especially with my discount, but i don't think i'll b making a trip out of my way to go there again.
author: lisa l.

description: I finally tried Mission Minis because of a HomeRun coupon I purchased. I ordered a variety of cupcakes and couldn't wait to try them. I wanted to like them, but they were just ok. They were definitely mini, a lot smaller than other minis from other cupcake shops. Some cupcakes were a little on the dry side and seemed to just be flavored by the frosting. I do intend on trying them again, maybe they were just having an off day.
author: Adelina W.

description:
so good! banana was my fav.
however, i might not always be down to pay $1 for a tiny cupcake.
author: mark s.

description: I want so badly to love you very much but we are destined to be mere aquaintances.  I had two dozen of your pretty minis.  Clearly very buttery from the oil soaked exteriors of the pink boxes.  Here's the problem.  You just don't make a super tasty cupcake.  Perhaps it's all organic and local and healthy or something that gets a small pass for not being delicious.  I've just had much better elsewhere.  I ended up eating the cupcake top (like muffin tops) for breakfast two days in a row.  Blueberry was my fav, followed by your classic vanilla.
author: Poppy C.

description:
Dear Mission Minis

I admit I'm woefully un-hip.....tragically so!!! In the interest of full disclosure, I lead a rather dull and cupcake-less life and never eat the things. My life is also tattoo-less and TV-less....and traffic jam-less....but at least  I am not tooth-less (thank god), owing in part to my cupcake-free ways; guess I never got the memo that cupcakes were the "new black".  Was it a top food / top chef TV network conspiracy craze or something?  Well anyhow,  this review is more for the shopping experience  at MM from  pre-ordering to pick-up to post consumer feedback about your cute little critters. On a late  Sunday night, I emailed an order for about 50 cupcakes to bring to an event on the following Tues.  I rec'd email confirmation of the order the very next day, thank you for that. Because I'm also wrist watch-less, I left work a little late on Tues (the day of the big batch pick-up).  and raced over to you to get the goods before  closing.  Fortunately, (since I 'm not phone-less or brain-less) I had the smarts to call ahead to let you know I was running late and enroute. Your cheerful cupcake counter lady replied that my order was all baked up,  boxed up, bagged up and rhet-to-go for me.  I think I'd ordered about 5 of everything.  The entire process was so  smooth and  hassle-free. At the party, there were countless  ooohs and ahhhs and compliments specifically about your cupcake creations.....and.....I .....(woefully naive and unhip little ole me),  was a big-hit wonder at the event. Thank you Mission Minis for having my back and  for saving my face and making me look so good.
author: Baby J.

description: I purchased a voucher through Plum District for 50% off. Thanks for the reminder that the voucher was about to expire. So a few friends of mine had a playdate for our children at Party Playhouse. I decided what perfect timing for me to go pick up some mini cupcakes for the kids as a treat. I called ahead to make sure I didn't need to call ahead 48 hours like it says on the voucher. The person from the bakery was very pleasant to talk to and told me that as long as they're not special orders, I could come by and pick out any flavor they had on the shelf. I got there and the worker quickly gathered my variety selection. The children were excited I had cupcakes for them. My daughter only likes frosting, so she gave me her cupcake as soon as she was done licking up the frosting. I thought it was delicious. I saved half a dozen for a friend I was going to visit that afternoon. I had about half a dozen left to bring back to my mom's. Before heading down to my friend's for a visit with the half dozen, I decided to try one more of mine. I think I tried the Classic Vanilla. It was so tasty, I quickly ate another one. I must've had four or five by the end. Mission Minis, I love your cupcakes! I've tried the others' that some people have mentioned, but theirs were so sweet, I would never go back. I've found my favorite cupcake place!
author: Ana W.

description:
so lucky to have a cupcake shop in the Mission! these little treats are divine! just the right size so you don't feel too guilty about eating a cupcake, the flavors are all so good. we tried the red velvet, lemon, horchata and aztec chocolate. the red velvet was the best, the other three all came close. love that the cupcakes aren't too sweet and at a $1.00 a piece, i will definitely be back! can't wait to try the rest of the flavors.
hope that this mission business does not loose its charm. this girl is in cupcake heaven!
author: heather z.

description: I was left feeling a bit underwhelmed. The cupcakes did not taste fresh at all! Although I will give them credit for the pumpkin spice cupcake, the cake was moist and the frosting was also good. Overall, these cupcakes are average, nothing special, but is worth a try every now and then...
author: Ru G.

description: Delish!  Their cake is moist but still fluffy and their frosting is not too heavy.  I will definitely be back for future celebrations!
author: S B.

description: Cute cute cute cute cute. Little bites are perfect for smaller receptions or just having a few friends over for dinner. I have gotten Mission Minis for tea parties, bridal showers, bachelorettes, and birthdays, but mostly for dinner parties, since it is a lovely way to finish a meal! Not too heavy but big on flavor. Your friends will up your adorable-factor by 5 points!
author: Christina C.

description: I try to stop by Mission Minis once every two weeks as my son Angel loves their cup cakes and they are yummy delicious and I will recommended to my family and friends. The best part though is last Friday I rush to the store before closing to my surprise one of the people at tells me you can get free cup cupcakes today. I got 12 free one and my son was in heaven when I told him about it. Thank you Mission Minis for being so good and for being a local business in the best city in the world. Keep up the good work and I will always stop by to get my cupcakes from you always. God Bless.
author: Juan C.

description: I think that what Mission Minis has going for it is its location. Very much true to its name as it is in the heart of the Mission district. I checked them out the last time I was in the area and was a bit of bust for me. Perhaps it was sweetness of the frosting (very) in relation to the cake (very small).  The biggest disappointment for me came when I tasted the horchata cupcake. A poor imitation compared to the horchata cupcake I had from Cynsational Delights. I would recommend you check out cynsational delights to compare for yourself. For the amount of $$ I spent at Mission Minis, I would have had a cup of full sized cupcakes at Cynsational Delights.
author: Rosa A.

description: OK so I had to try them out again and much better....with time the quality of the cupcakes improved!
author: Allison T.

description: Pretty average. Cute cupcakes, nice variety of flavors, but quite dry.
author: Heather H.

description:
I was super excited about this place opening and I think the concept is great and the folks who work in the shop could not be friendlier or cuter. But, as a vegan cupcake eater, I have to say that the vegan cupcake- the banana one- tastes like a muffin and not a cupcake! It's a fairly satisfying muffin...but it's a muffin! Where's the vegan frosting? The vegan chocolate? All that good stuff? 

Also, I tried a non-vegan (shhhh!) red velvet one and while the frosting was great, the cake was a bit dry.
author: Michele F.

description: I picked up 2 dozen of these cupcakes for a party last night and they were a big hit.  There were initially some problems with the order - they didn't give me the selection I had pre-ordered, which I didn't discover until I got back home, but they sent the correct order over via delivery later in the day.  I thought that was exceptionally good service.  Cupcakes were good too :)
author: KT R.

description: Good cupcakes (I tried the horchata and red velvet) but on the pricey side.
author: Ricky M.

description: Am I the only one that thinks this place is kind of ridiculous?  I mean, the cupcakes are pretty good I guess, but not the most amazing cupcakes I've ever had, and one teeny tiny bite for $1???  If they were 50 cents each this would be a different review entirely. Also, no deal on a dozen, no baker's dozen... no incentive to spend $12 on 12 teeny tiny bites.  Meh.
author: Honey T.

description: I had to stop here after seeing them on Cupcake Wars...we drove around the block numerous times...no parking. My friend let me out of the car so I could run in. Tried the Red Velvet, Vanilla, Meyer Lemon, Cinnamon Horchata- all so dry...The blueberry lemon was good but none of them were worth the stop unfortunately. I would much rather drive to Santa Rosa and have cupcakes at Sift!!
author: Carla L.

description: Loved these!  They came to a Yelp event a little while back. I have been craving the horchata and red velvet cupcakes ever since. Cream cheese frosting. Delicious.
author: Natasha P.

description: I called three days ahead to place an order for two dozen assorted cupcakes for pickup on a Friday. On the day of, I got stuck in a meeting and realized I couldn't make it to get them by the time the store closed at 6. So I called three times to see if I could pick them up the next day, but no one answered so I left all of my information in a message. Never heard from them. I came to the shop the next day to see if I could pick up my order still. Well, they were sold out and said they had no record of my order or my calls/message. And I was told they could do nothing for me, except maybe if I came back the next day. I was left without desserts for a birthday party. Not a fan.
author: Audra L.

description: This place does red velet justice. The minis are the perfect size of indulgence.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I finally got to use my Groupon coupon vhere after months of being denied email orders due to too many orders. It seems like they have gotten their act together, but are still a bit slow in responses. 

I got to try every flavor and the pink lemonade, cinnamon horchata and red velvet were standouts. The store is out of my way to get to, so I probably vwon't be back for awhile, but it's cute and worth a quick stop.
author: Keromi K.

description:
Local mini-cupcake shop with expensive cupcakes....I would venture to say its about 4-5 of the minis = 1 regular satisfying cupcakes. They taste fine. Nothing specatcular. The dimunitive size is really the gimmick... 

I live two blocks away and have stopped in for a treat every once in a a while. Their flavors don't seem to change though.... If you're choosie about your treats, I would recommend getting Kara's cupcakes instead....They are insanely delicious. Also expensive but blissfully worth it.... And crazy flavor combinations...
author: Audrey L.

description: I bought a cherry deal for two dozen cupcakes at mission minis.  I think If public scrutiny were not an issue, i would have eaten all two dozen myself :) Will definitely be going back for the next birthday, anniversary, or whatever other excuse I can find!
author: Erin D.

description: Cute and pretty mini cupcakes with interesting flavors to choose from.  Unfortunately, the cake itself was dry and unremarkable flavor-wise.  My husband and I tried a Ruby Red Velvet and the Aztec Chocolate and both came up with the same conclusion:  We've had better cupcakes elsewhere. The upside, the frosting was pretty good:  fluffy and sort of made up for the cake's lack of flavor and dryness.
author: Beth K.

description: I got a coupon for half price cupcakes so I sampled two (cinnamon and Mexican chocolate).  Both were dry and didn't have especially great flavor.
author: B. Y.

description: Cutish. But kind of dry and tasteless. A neighbor gave me a dozen (very kind!) and they seem to be all over my neighborhood. But a dollar a pop? How about 50 cents ? Or a quarter? Even then, not sure I would buy them again. A bit dull.
author: Lisa K.

description: AMAZING CUPCAKES! I could come here everyday, the cupcake size is perfect and the flavors are super tasty. 5 STARS! If your in the San Francisco area, you gotta check it out. Daniella your da bomb!
author: Alisa P.

description: Catchy name got me to go...well anything that has to do with "LA MISSION " then i gonna check it out. After CARNAVAL my girl and i walk up in for something sweet...it was something simply to place an order choose your minis and then walk out. The Minis were delicious we tried all 9 of them and we were satified....
author: Emilio J.

description: Haven't had the cinnamon horchata yet, which I hear I must, but I was very impressed by Mission Minis. I believe that one can judge a bakery's cupcakes based primarily on the icing on the red velvet cupcakes, because most establishments screw it up royally with some horrid whipped-cream concoction. Mission Minis makes a delicious, not-too-sweet cream cheese icing for its red velvets and I wholeheartedly approve.
author: Caroline M.

description: Met this group of talented cupcake masters in Los Olivos for a wine tasting! Though i've never been to the store front- I did have the honor of tasting the most amazing mini cupcakes known to man!!! I live in LA- and "sprinkles" cupcakes have quite the reputation and in my opinion "mission minis" go above and beyond. I hope that i get to visit the SF location sometime soon- as for now i'll just remember my port and cupcake experience with a big smile :]
author: maCkenzie t.

description: These cupcakes are the best. Kara's is overly sweet and noticeably artificial. Sprinkles, again too sweet and noticeably artificial. Mission Minis cupcakes are moist and there icing does not coat your mouth in that odd preservative film that gets left with these other cupcakes. Mission Minis is my go to place for parties.
author: Alexander O.

description:
i ordered 3 dozen mini cupcakes for my bf's bbq, and brandon was very helpful and easy to work with.  it was helpful that they delivered, which was one less thing to do.

i didn't get a cake since the bf one for birthday cake.  the cupcakes served as the birthday cake and dessert.  they were a hit and none went to waste.  i like these mini cupcakes because people will eat them as opposed to serving slices of cake that never get finished, and end up getting chucked in the bin.
author: Sheri N.

description:
about time there is a place where i can get a bit sized treat that is not over powering. love it.

i hardly eat cupcakes since they are too big and full of sugar. i love sugar dont get me wrong. i eat sweets like it is my job but i love the idea i can have a bite sized dessert and not feel like my sugar level has sky rocketed!

thank you, mission minis. i heart you. small stuff is awesome.
author: Rachna P.

description:
YUM!
I am a huge fan of red velvet and these mini cupcakes really gave me my fix today. The cream cheese frosting is deliciously light and fluffy and the cake itself was the perfect texture. I also tried the horchata cupcake which was amazing too. The best part about these cupcakes are that they're adorable and make such a great gift.
author: Allegra F.

description: Mission Minis you rock my world. At a dollar a piece I have to try you all and the sizes don't make me feel guilty. I also like that I don't have to go to your bakery on 22nd I can just make the quick trek to my local cafe and your minis are waiting for me there! Thanks for making cupcakes so good I almost bit off a chunk of my finger.
author: Jim L.

description: Holy red velvet cup cake!  This is a fav of mine. And BONUS they deliver. Now I can be even lazier and last minute! Get these and take them to your next party. You won't be disappointed...or you could always make them yourself. But trust...their frosting is way better.
author: Marianne s.

description: I am addicted to their red velvet and classic vanilla cupcakes.  I am also in trouble because they are just a mere couple of doors away.
author: MJ C.

description: Their cupcakes are really cute. I had the Mexican chocolate but I'm not a fan it was too dry for me. I also had the horchata but I only tasted cinnamon...it was ok. The red velvet was my favorite so far, it was too sweet or too dry. I'm coming back to try the rest of the cupcakes!
author: Christian P.

description: Mission Minis are the "bees knees"!!!  I was handing them out at the Noe Valley Merchant's Association sponsored Hayride for Children last Saturday and everyone absolutely loved them. I highly recommend ordering mission minis for your next event!  Carol H.
author: Carol H.

description:
These cupcakes are way too dry. They got my order wrong. All the cupcakes taste the same. The only one that save them is the banana maple. Horchata and aztec chocolate very disappointing.

 The only reason why I am giving them an extra star is because I used a coupon so I didn't pay full price for them
author: c c.

description: I felt like adding myself to the choir. I just had the rare pleasure of tasting the pumpkin spice cupcake at Aksew Grill last night. Each of their lovely selections is beautifully displayed on a delicate wire tower by the registers and they're only a buck! I'm glad I exercised restraint but now I'm jonesing to try another flavor so much that I may go back to Askew tonight too. These cupcakes are far superior in quality to competitors such as Kara's as the frosting is much lighter and most of the flavors include further garnish such as the tiny toffee crumbles atop the pumpkin and paper thin roasted almonds on the banana. Can't wait to have a party and order several dozen of these. Well done, guys!
author: mimi t.

description: Cinnamon Horchata Cupcakes! Yuuuuuuuuuum! At only $1 they don't kill the wallet or the diet.... yeah, I could eat a whole bunch of them.
author: Maria G.

description:
as far as cupcakes go, mission mini definitely makes some of the most creative and flavorful tiny little cakes. the flavors i had today (banana, ginger carrot, cinamon, pink lemonade, chocolate and vanilla) are distinctive and as light as sugar pastry can be -- they're not so sweet as to overpower the flavors, which you can always taste. compared to these many other store-bought cupcakes i've had would simply give me a sugar attack (which might be what you want i guess)!

another great thing is that because they're so tiny, you can try out a few flavors at a time instead of just getting only one flavor. think of them as the sushi or dim sum of cupcakes!

anyways, i never ordered them over the phone, and just get whatever flavors look good when i see them. i think the whole groupon episode really hit the new business hard. i think they will get over this challenge soon so i'm not gonna rate them on service yet and will revisit later. for now i'm totally give them 5-stars for the quality of the cupcakes.
author: Will L.

description: I order 4 dozen mini cupcakes for a baby shower and they were fantastic.  Moist, yummy frostings, good individual flavors (I got cinnamon horchata, red velvet, double chocolate and swiss coconut). They were a big hit at the party.  This is a cute little bakeshop in the Mission District and they do a really nice job.  I'm not sure why there are so many posts saying these cupcakes are dry as they were quite the opposite - nice and fresh!
author: Nicholette M.

description: We just got the most wicked mini cupcakes DELIVERED from Mission Mini's and we loved them.  No kidding, great deal for 12.  We love it here at Joffer.
author: Rick R.

description: Oh my gawd, horchata mini cupcake heaven. Just got my afternoon caffeine fix at Philz in SOMA/Mission Bay and saw these cute little $1 cupcakes just waiting to be eaten. Who can resist? It was just what I needed to be inspired to design a few new logos.  Inspiration: Cute, well-crafted, perfect balance (creame and cake), sophisticated flavor, and just enough. Back to work!
author: Leslie T.

description: I first had these cupcakes at Outside Lands and I was hooked. I'm excited because according to their Twitter a retail location is coming soon. In the mean time you can always pick these up at Philz Coffee locations but they can sell out fast. Although the Horchata was delicious my favorite is still the Pink Lemondade. If you need a lot they do orders in SF and have free delivery if you spend $25 (last I checked a dozen was $15).
author: Kelly O.

description:
I wanted so much to love this little local gem. I love cupcakes, and love rooting for the little guy. Sadly, though, I was a little disappointed.
As everyone else has said, many of the cupcakes are dry & stale & lack flavor. I'm guessing they sell day old or even older cupcakes as though they were new.

I understand that they were completely swamped with the Groupon orders (and I'm happy for them that a little local business is making it), so maybe they're cutting some corners recently?

They WERE very cute, made a fun looking dessert at a party, and the people were super nice (plus they have a cute little shop). Overall though, I would go to Miette, Citizen Cake, or Delessio's for my cupcakes.
author: Christine K.

description: Mission Minis has wonderful customer service and a really great can-do attitude. I spoke with Brandon who was very helpful and really got things done for me when he easily could have said no to my personalized and last minute request.
author: Marisa w.

description: Give them some time.  I recently placed orders with Mission Mini's and the outcome was "green" and not because it was earth friendly.  I believe they have a good concept but they need some time to work out the kinks.  Delicious frosting, interesting flavors, DRY cake, and messy; non working holders.  Brandon did everything to make it happen in short notice but the product fell through.  Try back in 2 months.
author: Allen V.

description: they were really good , but the only thing that dissapoints me is their a little overprced for a tiny little bite of cupcake .. i would go back though !!
author: Adri A.

description: Ordered 5 dozen cupcakes for a birthday party to be delievered. They were delivered right on time and for a very reasonable price, I might add. Everyone loved the cupcakes - moist and delicious - just two bites so people ate more then one and coudl try the various flavors. Thank you Mission Minis!
author: Linda I.

description: My fav is the Horchata cupcake! They are SO DAMN GOOD! Pick up your MIssion Mini at Philz Coffee (SOMA)! They sell out everyday.
author: Shauna B.

description: Yesterday was my first time trying this place out. I heard about it cause on PlumDistrict.com was having something about it and a friend of mine said she liked it. I have to say that this place is ok. I like to go and try out a lot of different cupcakes places. The cupcakes were a little dry and was bit on the sweet side. However, it was good that it was a mini.
author: Melanie T.

description: mini cupcakes allow for not feeling gluttonous when sampling every flavor offered, which makes me happy. what doesn't make me happy is when you order a peanut butter cupcake and instead get vanilla. they also weren't very moist. but some of the flavors are creative and who else was going to open up a cupcake shop in the mission?
author: Regina C.

description: these cupcakes are beyond amazing! i couldn't believe how good these little tiny cupcakes were. the pink lemonade and the swiss almond one were my favorites. unfortunately, they were out of the ruby red velvet and cinnamon horchata. next time i come to sf, i'm for sure coming here again. BUT they do need friendlier workers! after i bought the cupcakes i said "thank you" and the worker said "UM WHAT?!" i said again "thank you" and he said "oh yeah you're welcome" ugh. whatever, love the cupcakes!
author: Eileen Q.

description: need to be better run without running out of stuff so early in the day. tasty cupcakes, tho...reasonably prices...
author: Roy N.

description:
i was super excited when this place opened, just down the street from me. 

what a disappointment!

we tried 5 flavors:  Aztec Chocolate, Ruby Red Velvet, Banana Maple Glaze, Ginger Carrot & Cinnamon Horchata.  despite the tiny portion, it was easy to split them- not one was worth a second bite.

all were very dry and bland.  the aztec chocolate tasted a bit like dirt.  the red velvet (usually my favorite flavor) was the right color, but otherwise tasted nothing like it's suppossed to.  the banana maple tasted like they used artificial banana flavor!  frosting was super rich, but completely lacking flavor.  

i wanted to give them an extra star for flavor creativity, until i read other reviews and noted that they don't vary their flavors at all!  that would be ok if they'd perfected these, but they might as well get creative, they have nothing to lose.
