flavor wins over convenience- i'm sticking with SOMA's 'cups and cakes': http://www.yelp.com/biz/cups-and-cakes-bakery-san-francisco for all my cupcakey needs.
author: kaye C.

description: I redeemed my Groupon for 2 dozen cupcakes (red velvet, vanilla, chocolate, carrot cake (?)) so I had to place my order 48 hours in advance. Meh, no problem, I guess. It was pretty easy to do and pick up was a breeze since there was a space right in front. It came in a nice box with little cupcake holders, but I noticed that some still toppled over. I think the groove is too shallow to really hold it in place. The cupcakes were not moist and not fluffy. It felt rather dense when I picked them up. Perhaps it was an old batch. The frosting was good, but the cake itself was a total disappointment. It was just dry and the outer crust was hard. I brought a dozen to a BBQ and someone else brought cupcakes from Sweet Dreams (?) in Colma. It put my cupcakes to shame as theirs were fluffy and very moist. It was also slightly larger. Needless, to say, I didn't even touch one from Mission Minis. Dam, I have another Groupon for it too.
author: Freckles H.

description: I picked  up 2 dozen mini cupcakes yesterday, unfortunately, I was very disappointed.  I ordered the Red Velvet, Chocolate with Chocolate Frosting, Lemon and Swiss Almond Coconut.  All of the cakes were very dry and the frostings had very little flavor.  The most disappointing was the Coconut.  Not only was the cake very dry, the frosting tasted like old butter.  They need to learn how to make cupcakes from Sibby's Cupcakes.   Also, whoever they have working at their counter needs to be taught personal customer service.
author: Kathy P.

description: we came by today and ordered the half-dozen. instead, brandon gave us a dozen for the price of a half-dozen! sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeet! i particularly liked the red velvet and the swiss almond coconut. mmmmmmm... definitely coming back here and telling all my friends about this sweet little shop.
author: Marisol T.

description: One word, OVERPRICED!!! Cupcakes are the newest fad food and bakeries are trying to make cupcakes a luxury item when they are not. These cupcakes should be called nano not mini because my thumb was bigger than the damn thing. I even tried Kara's cupcakes and didn't see what the big deal was. I've had equally as good quality of cupcakes at regular bakeries without the price spike.
author: Shahram S.

description: I always feel like I have to try a place at least a couple of times. The first time I ordered 8 dozen for a party and they were pretty dry, but I gave it another shot recently and still...very dry. They are super cute and present really well, and the frosting is really good, so I just wish they would maybe undercook the cupcakes a bit or change something to see what customers' responses are because I think they have such potential. The service is great - - I've used all methods: online ordering, delivery, walk-in, scheduled pick up. Very friendly service each time.
author: J. Y.

description: All I can say is: great mini cup cakes. I love the red velvet!! Order some next time you go to a party, a real treat!
author: julie q.

description: Cupcakes are great, service is terrible. I called to order ahead per my coupon instructions. Couldn't get through ALL WEEKEND because as I later found out, they have an internet phone and their internet service was down. I went to the place and it was about an hour before they opened. They refused to accept my order because it was now "too late" even though their phones were down. I called again later to speak to a manager but they weren't there that day and they would not take a message to have them call me back. A little customer service goes a LONG WAY folks!!!
author: Lori M.

description: I have officially turned into a Groupon-a-holic. I keep seeing all these good deals and can't stop, Cupcakes aren't usually my thing but I decided to give it a try. I ordered 2 dozen for $12 and each cupcake is usually $1 each, so this was a deal I couldn't refuse. I've had these cupcakes before at random events but I wanted to try different flavors. My default: red velvet and my newbies: Pink Lemonade, Peanut Butter Kiss, and Blueberries & Cream. So what makes a good cupcake? My opinion is based more on the cake and less on the frosting. But in this case, I was not wow'ed by the cake - it was dry. I know mini cupcakes are hard to get "just right" and most places overbake them but this place is suppose to specialize in minis. Now, the frosting is a different story - very flavorful and fluffy. I thought I was eating peanut butter right off a spoon when I bit into the Peanut Butter Kiss frosting. The Pink Lemonade has a light touch of citrus which made me forget about the texture of the cake. The frosting makes this cupcake worth trying at least once or twice.
author: Candace F.

description: i ordered 4 dozen cupcaker on 4/20/10 and they were great tasted so good... i had the red velvet,aztec chcolate,pink lemonade,peanut butter kiss all very good.. when i save alittle more $$ i'm planning on ordering more..great job mission minis keep up the good work, only 4 stars because of the cost per dozen $15 and the delivery charge but i understand the cost
author: jonathan h.

description: I love Mission Minis! Simple rad cupcakes.
author: katy j.

description: I've been on a bit of a cupcake kick recently - so I was really excited to try this place as I ventured into the Mission last weekend.  I arrived at 6:05 on a Sunday night and was disappointed to see that they had just closed.  I was standing at the window, about to turn around completely bummed to have missed them - when the salesperson saw me and let me in!  My excitement could not be contained and I ordered one of every flavor.  My favorites were the Aztec Chocolate, Cinnamon and Peanut Butter Kiss.  Mmm who doesn't love a mini-dessert?  They sure are tricky because you can't (or rather, I can't) eat just one!  I'll definitely go back!
author: Nicole H.

description:
love 'em. just had 'em for my baby shower, and they were hand-delivered by the owner (brandon you rock and you know it), and were killer-awesome. red velvies all the way.
love my mission minis.
author: Latrice B.

description: Sooo yummy! I've had Mission Minis cupcakes in several places now, and they are always super-tasty and adorably presented. I love their bite-sized-ness. I think the Cinnamon Horchata is probably my favorite, but please don't make me choose! Plus, the staff are super awesome. I recently worked with them for an event, and they were so friendly and responsive - couldn't have been more pleasant. I'm a fan!
author: Margaret M.

description: they're cupcakes but they're mini and they're frickin' tasty. what's not to like? less guilt per cupcake = win.
author: Luke J.
